title: Expensive for foreigners and dirty
text: The entry for foreigners to enter the park is 150,000 per day??  That's far too high a price when the roads and facilities are terrible and like other Indonesian national parks full of rubbish.   Then when you arrive 7km from the beach, you are not allowed to take your own motorbike down to the beach and have to pay 250,000rp for a private taxi.   I would suggest boycotting Indonesian national parks until they sort out their pricing and their facilities.

title: The best surf beach
text: This area is so peaceful and the surrounding natural setting , wonderful trees and plants . it is known for its top surf and many people from all around the world visit this spot. Sand is superb and the water so warm . on the way in you go through some fantastic old villages and easy to get to from the Bali Ferry or there is now a flight from Bali to within 30 klm or so .  A must if you surf or just sight seeing, unique.

title: Explore the nature
text:
Well, it tooks us more 4hrs drive to finally reach the beach known as GLand. 2.5 hours driving from Banyuwangi to arrive at the gate where you paid the pass to enter the national park. This beach one of the location in Alas purwo national part, the also have savana and other beaches that you could visit using your own car.
For the GLand its selves it still require 15 minutes to another gate where you park the car and report to jungle ranger your id and plan. And then you talk to Pak Komar as a coordinator to arrange your transportation to GLand (plengkung beach). You need to pay 250.000 idr for a car and a driver to drive and pick up for the return, they only have 6 cars where you need to wait until they retun from dropping other visitors. It takes 45mnts to arrive at the plengkung beach or you could walk for about 10km, i've seen some teenagers in group walking through the forrest.
Don,t complain about the road condition since the goverment will try to keep the part remain the same including the whole ecosystem from human interference.
Some advice : dont expect too much for the beach , it's not for kids or family visit, mostly for surfers. And ask the driver's mobile number  you need it to ensure when he will come back to pick you up.
There are some surfers camp you could rent for 450rb/person/night or 100$/Overseastourist/night.
Only mobile provider tel*omsel can reach this location :(

title: EXOTIC G-LAND
text: G-LAND One of those out of the way places known to locals , surfers and adventurers. Recent changes to the district government have seen a proactive approach to developing tourism and support of local businesses. Great beaches stretching around a cone shaped island. Quite a distance from POLUTIONS

title: amazing surf and setting
text: This is a truly amazing surf location and setting.  The national forrest is alive with animals that seem to have all but disappeared in other areas of Indonesia.  The monkey are definitely a little more wild than those you  come across at temples that attract the tourists.

title: Walking to G-Land
text:
The government has left Plengkung Beach (alias Grajagan alias G-Land) in Alas Purwo National Park to private enterprise.  Three surf camps (a fourth one went broke) accommodate surfers at inflated prices - typically USD 70 to 110 for full board - after they have been shipped over from Bali.  While we would not deny these surfers their favoured sport, we do regret that the accommodation for wildlife watchers at Trianggulasi has been discontinued by the authorities.
At early morning we walked the 9 km from the Pancur checkpoint to G-Land along the road close to the beach but mostly shaded by trees.  We were rewarded by the sounds of birds and the sight of a deer family crossing the road.  Of course there were monkeys in the trees too.  At some places one can take a dip in the sea, but later in the morning the water is too low for swimming.  The surfers too then come back to shore and wait for the next high tide in the afternoon.
When we walked back later in the day we were fortunate that Mr Giran's jungle taxi overtook us.  As his car was empty he let us hop on for Rp 25,000 p.p.  If you need transport to or from G-Land, call him at mobile 081 348 757 511.
Directions: From Genteng the distance to G-Land is about 57 km, from Banyuwangi it is perhaps 10 km more.  We followed signboards “Wisata Plengkung” which led us the border of the park near Tegaldlima village. But the ticket office is 10 km further south at Pasar Anyar, and from the barrier at Pancur you have to either walk the last 9 km (two hours) or take a jungle taxi (45 minutes, Rp 250,000 irrespective of the number of passengers).
Admission: At the ticket office we paid Rp 2,500 p.p. for admission, Rp 6,000 for our car and Rp 5,000 for bringing a camera.

title: G-Land for the Adventurous
text:
Although the road is mostly in a terrible condition, and taking a long time to get there (2 and a half hour to do 60 kms). I don't regret going there, through the orange groves, teak forests, etc.. until a parking area, where one has to go for a 4x4 vehicle ride through the final 5 kms stretch to one of the most beautiful white sanded beaches. Plengkung as it is known, has some of the best waves, attracting surfers from Kuta; who do the trip by fast boats.
One can see all sorts of animals in the forest from peacocks, to Deers, strange monkeys, Komodo-like lizzards, etc... Great place! but bring your own lunch, to have in one of the few spots prepared for the occasion. the few restaurants on the beach are very expensive...as deliveries are scarce and risky.

title: Fab beach & great beach cafe to relax in for a few hours
text: Fab beach, so wide & wild, also recommend the lovely cafe beach bar with sun chairs, beside lifeguard tower - lovely friendly staff, good coffee, nice snack food, well priced, a great place to relax for a few hours. Great serviced bathroom facilities & good value car parking.

title: Changed Forever
text: Nice beach but the real draw is the surf which at certain times of the year can reach epic proportions attracting some of the world's top surfers! My wife used to live in Cascais in the early 60s and would often ride horses or spend time on this beach. The area is now significantly more developed with restaurants, several  hotels and large residential developments. Oh well that's progress I guess!

title: Great beach, particularly for surfers.
text: Great beach, particularly for surfers. Lifeguard on duty so good for (experienced) swimmers also. Well worth a visit.

title: Good
text: It is a famous beach frequented by tourists. the atmosphere is young and the look is breathtaking. A mandatory visit for everyone who passes through Cascais.

title: Surfs up!  Beautiful beach
text: Surfs up!  Beautiful beach to learn how to surf. Go se Johnny at Shaka Surf School.  Easiest to get there by car, pay for parking but not expensive.

title: A beautiful beach worth seeing while you’re in Portugal
text: As we explored the western coast of Portugal, this was a beautiful beach, and a must see location. It was easy to walk around and every angle offered a stunning view to admire.

title: Guincho is one of the worlds unique places
text: This beach is very unpredictable because the weather is also unpredictable. We can have wind and a sea with a lot of swell in the morning and in the afternoon it is phenomenally hot and the sea is calm. Here is where I feel the Atlantic Ocean and where I feel zen with Nature.⛱️☀️

title: Great beach bar- fab white sangria & views
text: Great beach bar- lovely white sangria & food ( chicken curry mayonnaise tools) , lots of attentive  staff & great views . Visited on a windy day but sat out in the front and loved it- nice & busy- could spend days here- highly recommend a visit

title: LARGE EMPTY BEACH
text: The day we visited at 1130, there was only one other person on the beach. Very long and wide beach with decent waves. Windy though.

title: Pleasant 9 km  Cascais-Guincho Beach power walk / run / bicycle trip
text:
Sorry, this post is not a review of the actual beach - but it’s written to inspire you to do some nice exercise with a magnificent view all the way.

The thing is that there is a combined walking path / bicycle lane running along the coast from Cascais to Guincho Beach - 9 kilometers each way.

On the way you can:

Rent electric bikes
Rent electric kick scooters
See the famous Boca do Inferno
See the Forte de Sao Jorge
Enjoy the fresh air and brilliant views

- and you don’t have to go all the way; it’s only optional (c;

title: Best view of the day!
text: Portugal is a lovely country and nowhere is that more clear than the beaches around Cascais. Sunset lent a gorgeous light to the view and the weather even in November was perfect for an evening stroll.

title: Beautiful beach
text: It was a lovely sunny day in the beach. Lots of rocks surrounding. Portugal has the best beaches in Europe

title: Guincho is a marvel!
text: Can't beat this beach only 40-50 minutes from Lisbon by train/Uber (less time if you drive).  It's just far enough to avoid huge crowds in a heat wave (we went on a 95F+ day), and it is a dramatic, beautiful beach with great waves and small waves alike, pristine sand.  Only downside is there are no public restrooms (contrary to what some beach review sites say).  Highly recommend!

title: Great beach especially for surfing
text: We made a quick stop here after visiting Sintra and the beach seemed really nice. It is popular mostly for surfing as it can get quite windy here. Not sure if it would be as enjoyable for swimming given the wind, but the views were quite nice and relaxing.

title: Sun wind and surf
text: Special charm of Guincho is so worth visiting-  beautiful beach even if you are not a surfing aficionado

title: Paradise in medium wind. Excellent bar but bike rental was tricky. Don’t use beach cruisers. Bikes have to be back by 7.
text: Unreal beach experience.  Well worth the trip!  The beach bar was excellent. Bike rental in Cascáis on our day trip from Lisbon was less than ideal, however. We didn’t understand that the bikes must be returned before 7 and had to hustle our beach cruisers 6 miles back to Cascáis to beat the clock. The bike shop staff didn’t do a good job of informing us about the situation. DONT use beach cruisers for this ride. Mountain bikes are best for the ride from Cascáis to Guincho. Umbrella rental at Guincho beach was also more expensive than expected. The wind at Guincho was perfect when we went in late June. The surfers were not thrilled with the lack of wind but it was great for lounging on the sand.

title: Simply wild and wonderful
text: It is very rare to have nice beach days in Guincho (specially in mid Summer) as the winds can be ferocious, but on a quiet day with no wind, this beach offers you unpararelled pleasures. Beware of the big waves and tides

title: Quick Photos
text: Did a quick stop here while in Cascais for some photo opportunities. Lovely beach and was not too crowded, at least during the middle of the work week.

title: Guincho Beach - the other side of the Atlantic Ocean
text:
I'm from the east coast of the US and have only seen the Atlantic Ocean from there. This was a cool experience, to see and wade into the water of the Atlantic Ocean from the other side - from Guincho Beach. 

I visited on a chilly day in April after a side trip to Sintra. Barely anyone was around but the waves crashing against the shore made me feel calm.  Beautiful place and worth a visit.

title: Far too windy!
text: If you don't surf, there is not much you can do, unless you want sand all over you. It's very windy and the sand stings your skin all over your body. It's not worth it and definitely won't return here. It offers a great view when going down to the beach, but that's about it.

title: Nice view
text: Nice place to talk a walk and see the coast. Good spot for surfers. Not much around so if you want to spend a day bring all your own items.

title: Stunning
text: One of my favorite beach - I love the vibe, views , surfing and bars . It is easily accessible from Cascais via picturesque road along the side. Especially by bike! Can you ask for more?

title: Beautiful Beach!
text: The scene is so breath taking, large waves, people parasailing and walking along the beach  on the walking path. Nice place to stop and have a cup of coffee and lite lunch. Watch a beautiful sunset over the beach with a glass of wine.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Guincho Beach is beautiful and worth going to have a look. there a several restaurants to choose from if you wish to make a day out of the trip.

title: One of the most beautiful beaches in the world
text: Fantastic sea, fabulous sand, beautiful landscape. Excellent for surfing, windsurfing and kite surfing! In summer time there's no better beach!!

title: Lovely beach but windy
text:
It's lovely sandy beach which is very popular with all forms surfers because of the wind.
Roadside parking can be a problem at the weekends and during the summer.  When approaching on the coast road from Cascais, park in the Mar do Guincho restaurant car park for only €2 a day
If leaving on the coast road heading east after about 1630 at the weekend or during the summer, there is usually a long queue for the first roundabout on entering Cascais. To avoid this, drive slightly past the beach (on your left) and take the junction to the right as you approach the wooded area.  This takes you to Birre in the northern part of Cascais, and the start of the A5 motorway.

title: Wonderful beach .... when not crowded
text: I walked along this beach on a cold but sunny December day. Waves crashing   Beach nearly deserted.  Wonderful

title: Winter Visit for Surfing
text: Took my kids there for their first surfing lesson. It was a wintertime visit. But it was nice weather. The kid's wore wet suits and we hired a nearby surf shop. The beach is huge and beautiful. Not many people there. So, on a nice day, a December visit is ideal. I also suspect that they clean the sand because the beach was immaculate.

title: Spectacular Beach- not only for surfers
text: The natural beauty of Guincho beach is worth a visit . Nice train ride from Lisbon and a short taxi ride from the station .

title: Unspoiled and beautiful
text: Guincho beach is truly beautiful and unspoiled, pretty much deserted out of season and a must for die hard windsurfers. The water is super cold and tricky, lots of powerful currents and big waves at times. During the season there are life guards in some of the beaches but out of season no, so if you feel adventurous and go for a swim proceed with great care. Or just sit and look and the sea, it is SO amazingly beautiful. Unforgettable sunsets guaranteed too! Big sand dunes and great walks nearby, namely one which starts roughly opposite Fortaleza do Guincho (big yellow building, old fortress) with wood paths to walk on and beautiful meandering paths providing stunning views. Not to miss!

title: Fabulous
text: This is a fabulous occasion and although most of the restaurants are expensive, its just a short taxi ride to Cascais.

title: Fabulous wild water beach!
text:
We came across Guincho beach on a drive out of Cascais. Couldn’t believe how wild it was compared to the calm waters in Cascais. It is amazing,the weather wasn’t great unfortunately,so no sunbathing for us,so we watched the many surfers taking advantage of the huge waves,it was exhilarating! 
Would definitely recommend a visit here.

title: Waves and Surfers
text: Looks good to see, but a beach I question. Maybe good for a stroll in settled weather. Think it is possibly a bit overrated.

title: Amazing beach!
text: This beach is unbelievable.  I spent the afternoon there and thoroughly enjoyed myself.  It is not far from town, so grab a rental bike and head out. There are many restaurants, and enjoying coffee or lunch is a terrific option.

title: Kite Surfers were gorgeous
text: Beautiful day on the beach watching the kite surfers - 18 surfers at one time - it was an unbelievable sight!

title: Ideal beach for relaxing
text:
Travelled from Cascais on the bus. Every hourly service and a few euros.
Short walk to the beach. Beautiful clean sand.
Great facilities hidden away.
Lovely beach cafe.
It was very windy but the sun was hot. We didn’t swim as the sea was too rough but it was very inviting.
I would recommend visiting if you are in the area.

title: Spectacular
text: Great surfer´s beach and sunset spot. Have a stroll on the boardwalk path over the Cresmina beach dunes while you are there- You´ll find a lovely little café with great views.

title: Getaway
text: Fabulous sandy unspoilt beach idyllic at this time of year. The place to go if you want to getaway from it all and chill.

title: Do you need exfoliation?
text: A beautiful beach with cold waters and sometimes very windy with sand blown by the wind. Be sure to go if you are surfing, windsurfing or kite surfing.

title: Wind Factory
text: A beautiful picturesque beach with amazing surf and people too. Would recommend for surfing, kite boarding and windsurfing.

title: Most beautiful sunset
text: Atlantic ocean waves, colorful surfers, wind surfers and kite-surfers, Guincho beach's energy hypnotise all travellers

title: closest point to North America
text: This was a great beach but windy and can be rough at times . Its open ocean water and you need to take care of small children at all times . Its a large Beach with lots of room for to be private . It has parking and a place to eat . This beach is well known for its wind surfing and sailing races . Its only 8minutes by car . Taxi will be 7 Euro . Its easy to get an Uber any time in Cascais . Cascais is one of my favorite places to visit . Hope you enjoy

title: Fabulous beach
text: Great place to spend the day or stop for a sundowner at the beach bar. Freezing water but great people watching.

title: Great day at Guincho
text: When wind is not strong it is a very pleasant place. We stayed close to Bar do Guincho, where we had lunch. We also rented the sun beds which are quite comfortable.

title: Incredible beach. Worth the trip
text: I rented a bike from cascais and rode a half hour or so to the beach. It’s vast and beautiful.  Great for surfing (but the water is damn cold so bring a wet suit). One of the most epic sunsets I’ve ever seen.

title: Best beach naar Cascais
text: Beaches in Cascais are crowded! Rent a bike and go to guincho beach, Enjoy the waves and the surfers

title: Nice beach, shame about the sunbed charges
text: €20 for a couple of hours use of 2 sunbeds and a ridiculously low sunshade felt over priced. Difficult beach to get to if you don't have a car.

title: Beautiful location
text: Although the water was a bit cool the location was fantastic! Walking to the furthest end off the beach is quite isolated and not crowded when we were there so lovely. The nearby cafe was nice too and not over priced. A fab day trip from Lisbon.

title: Perfect for surfing
text: Had surf lessons here. There are no other people on that beach apart from surfers. Enjoyed it more than Carcavelos.

title: Soft sand, amazing waves and breath taking sunsets
text: This place is amazing to have a beach day, is not as crowed as other beaches in the area, the soft sand is ideal to rest, also you can do a few walks to nearby beaches. Make sure to check the bus schedules since they stop real early, some times there is an uber or bolt you can order, also there is a place to buy drinks and a toilet.

title: Amazing beach
text: If you love surf this is one of the best place, the waves are good and it perfect for all, advanced and beginners, or if you just want to chill in the sun it is worth relaxing. The landscape are amazing.

title: Beautiful!
text: It's beyond words how beautiful this beach was.  I was staying in Cascais.  I went to this beach twice - once by bus and the second time someone drove me.  It's easily accessible by bus or bike from Cascais.  The bike lane is on the broad walk all the way from Cascais along the beautiful coast.  The first time I was there it was very quiet I almost had the whole beach to myself except a few surfers the second time more people but still didn't feel crowded as it's such a big long beach.  A great place to surf or watch surfing.

title: My favourite beach
text:
Beautiful sandy beach. 
Two main accesses. 
One big paying parking leading to the Bar Do Guincho and access to the beach. 
Lifeguard on duty 
Surfing schools available around. 
We ate several times at the Bar Do Guincho. Simple tasty food.

title: Very nice
text:
Lovely place. Definitely going back when possible.
Great place to run or walk. You can have surfing lessons there. A bit windy sometimes.

title: Wild, Windswept, Waves - Wonderful!
text: This was easily the best beach we visited in the area. Well worth the trip from Cascais (in our case 30 mins by bike). The beach has a rugged, natural beauty that is breathtaking. It’s less easy to reach, therefore far less crowded than other beaches in the vicinity. Huge waves with some rocky areas - which creates something of a surfers paradIse. Best to travel right to the far end to avoid a tough trek across soft sand. Some shelter from the (usually strong) winds can be found beneath the furthest rocky outcrops. The restaurant above the beach is popular and serves decent grub but is considerably overpriced. Other than that, we loved everything about it.

title: Great if you love scenic beaches
text:
We had a couple of visits to this beach on our holiday. Setting is superb and the scenery is stunning. 
Good parking and a range of cafes and some expensive restaurants.
The beach can be windy and is cool in summer with an onshore breeze.
It is great for surfing byt NOT for swimming as there are strong currents and rip tides. Not suitable for small children to be in the water!

title: You have to rally believe it when people say it’s windy!!
text: We walked here from our apartment in Guia. About 4k. The coastline is stunning but the wind almost knocked us over. When we arrived at the beach the wind was whipping the sand into our faces and it certainly wasn’t warm. We just got an Uber home. I ‘m sure it’s great if the wind drops.

title: Couples
text:
Beautiful beach, calm sea lovely golden sand.  Cafes local for food or a drink. Little sun trap to 
enjoy the view

title: Wonderful beach!!!
text: Not too crowded and not even to compare to beaches in Cascais city! To be reached easily by Uber or bus! We visited on a day with a lot of wind and fantastic waves. Although swimming was not an option because of the currents, this didn’t bother us at all. The water was clear and quite cold as it is the Atlantic Ocean! Definite recommendation!! Beautiful!

title: Fun!
text: So much fun and lots of wind. Definitely go in July - September! It was so nice, and I did get to swim in it. I loved it in early October.

title: Atlantic Ocean
text: First time I’m was alone in holidays , beautiful place . I’m happy! Good place for surf, for chilling!

title: Lovely beach but soooo windy!
text: Lovely beach in beautiful location but don't go there for sunbathing unless the wind is low. Lovely, cool little cafe there too

title: NIce beach a bit out of the way
text: More of a beach for surfing than swimming as the waves are big and water is cold. Also if your are planning to stay the day, then bring your own food and drink as there is not much about and what is, is quite expensive. Lovely sand though and you are not far from the Cabo de Roca where you can watch the perfect sunset.

title: Surf paradise
text: Fun to relax and watch the surfers. There are a few restaurants near the beach.  Parking was easy and inexpensive.

title: Amazing view!
text: You should visit this place, is the most amazing view of cascais area. If you can go and take surf lessons too!

title: Loved it
text: Beautiful beach, amazing weather and people doing surf. Perfect combinations. Amazing...I WANNA GO BACK!!!

title: Best beach in Portugal
text: A bit windy (some days very windy) but still one of the most beautiful places in Portugal coast. The natural beaty is breath taking...

title: Muchaxo hotel
text:
A lovely place to visit parking hard to find but otherwise a truly gem of place with fine restaurants and beautiful location lots of surfers chasing the waves 

Stephen

title: Great watersports
text: Great beach with surfers and very clean. Great place to relax in the sun too. Surfing is reasonably priced here

title: Great value surfing
text:
€20 for 2hrs surfing incl. wetsuit. Helpful and friendly staff in the beach surf shop.
There is also a nice cafe overlooking the sea. The waves were strong for a beginner surfer but great fun.

title: Good
text: This is a very good beach. A good place to spend time with your family and friends. A small walk from the main road.

title: Interesting place with Michelin starred restaurant
text:
The main point of staying at this hotel is if you want to eat in the Michelin starred restaurant. The food served in the bar is very good too and we especially liked the wine recommended by Rui who was very nice and very knowledgeable. All the staff are very helpful and attentive. 

Bed was comfortable and the room was very clean and well equipped. It was rather dark because of the way it's built but had a door to a glazed in terrace overlooking the beach.

title: Gorgeous!!
text: Beautiful beach just a short car ride or easy bike ride away.  I recommend riding your bike from Cascais as the scenery on the way there is amazing as well.  This beach has huge waves and therefore a lot of surfers.  It's a must see if you are in Cascais area!!

title: Just another beach
text:
Nice to stop by and take a few minutes break . Not worthy of a special trip. 

Ocean view is nice but can be windy and cold.

title: I'm being a grinch about The Guinch!
text: Walked here from Cascais on reading good reviews. We were a bit underwhelmed by the beach. It was ok but not spectacular. Also there was little around in terms of bars and restaurants where you could sit and admire the view. There are better beaches along the coast going towards Lisbon.

title: Don’t go here
text: I hate crowds. Don’t go here. I want it to myself. There are sea monsters and giant squids that will grab random people and eat them. Please stay away.

title: Sea meets dune
text: Fascinating drive down from the mountains then suddenly among white sand drifting across the road and the sea crashing by. The vast blue sea and pure white waves were at their most dramatic as we visited during a spring tide. We didn't actually go onto the beach but really enjoyed out 10 minutes of cheering as each wave emerged, lurched and crashed.

title: Sunset
text: Beautiful place, blue waters  very peacefull place , next to the   Serra de Sintra.  we can enjoy the beauty of the ocean blue sky .

title: Bike ride
text: A 10k bike ride from Cascais. Bike hire was 6€ for the day and there were great views along the way. Guincho beach looked amazing and fantastic for surfers. There were dog walkers too. A real gem

title: A little paradise facing the Atlantic Ocean
text: This is one of the best beaches of Portugal! The beach is very big, surrounded by nature, well connected by public transport and you can surf as well! Right there at the beach you have the possibility to rent the surfing equipment and even to have a surfing lesson. Near the beach there is also a restaurant, a hotel and a bar with swimming pool. The bar is pretty expensive in comparison with the average prices in Portugal, but it has an amazing view over the Ocean!

title: Beautiful beach
text: A large stretch of golden sand backed by dunes leading towards high cliffs in the north with not much between here and Cabo da Roca, the most westerly point in mainland Europe, is exposed to the full force of the Atlantic making it a great surf spot on its day, although very windy, through the summer months a stiff breeze tends to blow from the north (cross shore), lovely to spend the day on a calm day.

title: Worth the detour!
text: When traveling from Lisbon, on your way to or from Sintra, try to choose the detour along the coast that will take you to Estoril and Cascais, famous coastal communities. You will inevitably drive along the beach of Guincho: natural, wild and empty, a total contrast with the busy cities of Cascais and Estoril. And a surfer paradise too!

title: With my love
text: Started the year 2019 year!!!! Just sunny day and great food and environment.... Meet some friends there and sunny was shining and food great... What can I say..... Underfull...

title: Spectacular
text:
Portugal, and Lisbon especially, is so lucky to have a wonderful coastline within it's vicinity. And none more beautiful than Guincho Beach. For us, it's the UNdevelopment and wildness that we found so incredible.

Hope it remains in it's pristine condition.

title: Nice enough beach
text: The beach was nice enough for being close to Lisbon, but definitely wouldn't come to Portugal for the beaches, compared to other european countries.

title: The beach is beautiful, wild and unique!
text: The beach is beautiful, wild, no construction. Not far from the capital but so beautiful! We absolutely loved it, there is also lots of surfers, waves are huge!

title: The most beautiful beach on the Lisbon coast!
text: The beautiful Guincho beach in Cascais can be reached from Cais de Sodre station in Lisbon by train (40 min ride) Tip 1: hire a bike near Cascais train station and go to the beach by bike, a fantastic scenic 5km bike ride along the beautiful Atlantic ocean you will not forget! Tip 2: Bar do Guincho at the very west end of the beach is a great spot for drinks & bites Tip 3: when coming by car follow the signs for Bar do Guincho, there is a big parking off the road note: when the only thing you want is sunbathing, it is very likely that this will not be the perfect beach for you (unless on a windstill day of course) as there is often lots of wind on guincho beach, hence it’s the place to be for kite surfers

title: Pretty beach
text: This is a very pretty beach about 40 mins drive by car from the city centre. The sand is beautiful and the waves get stronger at high tide of course. And right there you have the guincho bar/ restaurant wirh an amazing view over the beach and delicious food. It is very close to Abano beach. We hiked from one beach to the other and it took us about 15-20 mins. That was fun. And we are not hikers at all. But it was a very easy trek. You should try it. This beach is worth a visit. And from there we took an uber back to the city centre. I tell you, the uber drivers in lisbon are everywhere and you don’t have to wait long to get one. It’s amazing. And it cost us max. 30€. And there is no way to reach this beach without a car. There are no trains or buses that go there. So take an uber or a taxi (which is more expensive though).

title: Much more than a beach for the adventerous.
text: Beautiful and rugged beach.  Great for surfing. Limited facilities. Take advantage of the free readily available bikes and cycle from Cascais (20 - 30 mins easy ride)  Check out the dunes and off into the national park.  Great half day activity.

title: My favorite beach!
text:
If you like rough beaches, with big waves, a good sea breeze, and piece and quiet, this is the beach.
I can sit and lay here for hours.
If you like surfing or to watch surfers, this is also the spot.
During summer, this is also an excellent place to look at the falling stars (perseides) at night as there is light pollution.
Also you have good beach bar.
Be aware that during summer, and especially during the weekends it can be very crowded.

title: Great waves and beautiful views!
text: We drove down and stopped at several points to admire 5e waves crashing in to shore, a few hours after hurricane Leslie blew through.breathtaking!

title: Amazing surf beach but poor services
text: Great beach, fantastic watching the surfers. Just next to the main road. But no facilities or loos, which was a disappointment.

title: Big beautiful beach
text: We rode our rented bikes out to Guincho beach from downtown Caiscais. Easy ride and oh so scenic. Lots of kite surfers to watch while you relax on the beach. A ton of wind but worth the visit. It was a great day and we bar hopped along the route back!  So fun.

title: Best beach ever
text: Beach is nice and windy, perfect for catching waves and relaxing. There is also a nice beach bar, to take a snack and a cold drink.

title: Beach
text: Located between Sinatra and Cascais. Beautiful sandy beach with high surf. Not warm water. Be prepared if you go in for a swim! Nice place to relax and enjoy the sounds of the ocean.

title: Lovely place to relax
text: Really stunning (but a bit windy at times..!) The beach bar is nice but can be super busy on a very sunny weekend

title: lovely beach and beach bar, be aware no toilets!!
text:
huge beach, quite windy hence the water sports.
great bar with good food and drinks but no loos!
cycle here from Cascais, even as a non biker its possible.

title: All beaches in Portugal are not for sunbathing.....
text: Guincho is an amazing but intimidating beach on the western point of Portugal. If you are looking for a quite beach for bathing and sunbathing this may not be the best option in the area. It is wild, exposed and full of thrill seekers. That is what makes Guincho special and worth the extra mile of travel out from Cascais. Surfing, Kitesurfing, Windsurfing are all local sports. On a less windy day it is popular with surf schools, on the really windy/wavy days you sit and watch the professionals.

title: Impressive and intimidating
text: Definitely a surfers beach. Swimming can be challenging, but exhilirating or just impossible. My two year old was firmly in my grip, but enjoyed the surf coming in and playing on the sand. There's a nice cafe and restaurant, but cafe often didn't have what was on the menu. Also a bit pricey, but everything seems to be in the Cascais-Guincho area! We made a day of it by taking a tent which worked well. Check conditions before going to make sure it suits what you plan to do there.

title: overrated
text: not worth the detour, long stretch of beach dedicated to surfers, hard to find parking, water is cold and the undercurrent is strong. Full of surfers, no cafes or restaurants to speak off. waist of time, unless you intend to surf.

title: Let's see it once.
text:
Guincho Beach is Portugal's most beautiful Atlantic beach, outside of Sintra, on the route to Cascais with its beautiful sand dunes. The fence was not to disturb the beauty of this sand dunes.
There are wooden bridges to walk from the beach to the beach to not pass into the sand.

title: A simply stunning beach!
text: What a stunning beach! It is naturally preserved of any "tack" and kept wild and natural. Great for a walk during the day and enjoyed a cocktail in the Fortaleza watching the sun set .....

title: Plenty of room to relax
text: Great beach along our Cascais day-trip and seafood restaurants abound to choose along the way.  Great views.  Wonderful breeze.

title: Beautiful beach
text: We UBERed from Cascais to the Bar do Guincho and walked the length of the beach after lunch. This was on a sunny Saturday afternoon and the beach was packed with locals enjoying the day and watching the many surfers. It’s a gorgeous beach but it lacks public facilities (restrooms).

title: Beautiful beach
text: We came here for windsurfing but got it on a week with no wind but the area is absolutely beautiful, very quiet the days we came to relax. You can run, walk or cycle along the coast road red path from Cascais to guinicho, it's about 12k round trip and take in the view of the waves rolling in. If your into surfing, nature and the sea it's beautiful and wild. Tons of parking, free and paid. One or two coffee huts with homemade maderia cake available to enjoy! There are also a hand full of restaurants. We love that this location is still not really tarnished by tourism yet. The drive along the coast through the hills towards Sinatra is lovely, winding, very green and feels tropical a bit like the road to Hand in Maui.

title: Windy
text: Just did a day trip here. Lovely beach, I reckon you’d have to be experienced in swimming here at it looked pretty rough today. Lovely clean beach

title: Nice beach but check wind conditions
text: Nice beach if you would like a surf beach but either get there early or check wind conditions as once they come up very unpleasant on the beach.

title: Wonderful for surfers
text: Guincho is the perfect beach for tourists who appreciate nature’s raw power and are willing to travel that bit further for a stunning location Sintra mountains behind and amazing sand dunes.Worth seeing as this beach is famous for wind surfing.

title: This is the Place to Surf
text:
From beginner to Expert Grinch is the beach to surf.
There are hotels, returns, and rentals to meet any traveler needs.
Lot's people from all over the world some to surf, and windsurf, and hang out on the beach.
Nearby Cascais is beautiful and has it all.
Lot's to do and see.
The month of august is Holiday time in Europe and vacationers from nearby Spain, France, and UK tend to produce crowded lines, but any other time is best to visit.
Have fin in the Sun

title: Great beach
text: Guincho beach is the best Cascais can offer, for all ages. Very large beach area with plenty of room for everyone, the water is excellent and there is a refreshing great beach bar you can enjoy!

title: amazing beach
text: This beautiful beach is the best in Cascais offering loads of space and a great beach bar. Be warned though there are no toilets!

title: Wild beach
text: If you walk or go by bike from Cascais there you have the coast line with stunning views! The beach is very large, Sintra mountains behind and sand dunes. The waves are big enough for wind surf but the tides/currents  are not indicated for swimming. We got a very windy day, we didn't make it there for mote than one hour but worth it. There are restaurants, hotel, parking and wind surf school, you can rent the equipment. Worth going there!

title: The only decent beach from all the others from Oeiras to Cascais
text:
Decent beach, agressive sea, somehow clean. 
Cascais Town Hall services are poor and dont care much with cleanning in Cascais.
Best beach in Cascais near Sintra, however Sintra has better beaches.
If you looking for a good and clean beach in Cascais, Praia do Guincho is a decent one. All the other beaches from Oeiras to Cascais are poor and dangerous for your health since all the Sewer networks drop directly to those beaches and Town hall services are non existent.

title: Big waves
text: A good big beach with big Atlantic waives coming in - hiring bikes in Cascais and cycling along the cycle path made for a good day out - and avoided the queues for the car park...

title: One of our favorite beaches in Portugal
text:
Guincho beach is one of our favorite beaches in Portugal. This sandy beach is often very windy and attracts lots of kite surfers, wind surfers and surfers (great waves). There is not a lot of parking space around and due to the usual strong winds not a lot of umbrellas and no mass tourism. 
The beach has a surf school a small shack for drinks and snacks and the bar do guincho at the far end - great place for burgers and beer.

title: Beautiful beach, with the most divine view
text: We visited this beautiful beach in February on a sunny day, so even though it was a bit chilly, the sun warmed everything up. The air was clean and clear, the sky was blue. There were many people around with dogs and everyone enjoyed a sunny break after a rainy spell. The sand was soft as ever and the water crystal clear...

title: Incredibly beautiful
text: Stunningly beautiful beach. Very windy but that makes for incredible waves. Fine sand and magnificent views.

title: Nice surfing
text: Although crowded, this beach is one of the best in the area.  Great waves and nice fish restaurants.  Be aware parking is an issue, be ready to walk.

title: Spectacular Portuguese Coastline
text:
If you want to experience the true beauty of the Lisbon Coastline, at your leisure, do rent e-bikes in Cascais and travel the 9.5 km along a designated cycle path to Praia do Guincho. Spectacular beach, well worth a visit if just to witness kite surfers in action. The surf is always high and alas is not suitable as a beach for swimming, particularly for people with young children.
That said the journey by bike gives you the freedom to stop and admire all that is beautiful along this stretch of unspoiled coastline.

title: Location !!!!!
text:
Cool Beach!! Water of the Ocean, Surfers, great sand, Parking and above all the view!
Thanks to Hotel's staff I got the tip to this Beach - Much better than other located in the village
Go there, not far and Recommended

title: Beautiful beach, very windy
text: We had a lovely stay near this beach. All sorts of water sports.. Kite surfing , wind surfing, surfing on offer. It's a bit too windy for sunbathing, unless you find a sheltered spot near the rocks at the far end of the beach. Lovely sunsets.

title: Surfer deam
text: One of the best surfing beaches in Portugal. Very wide but somewhat rough due to high prevailing winds.

title: Awesome day!
text:
Rented a SUP to surf at the surf school, hung out at the bar, sat on the beach.  What more can you ask for.  Nice easy waves.  
Good foot at the bar.
A great day!!!

title: Super
text: Personally I loved it although it is not your typical beach experience because of the wind which is very strong, but it is very beautiful, I would recommend to walk a bit around the area.

title: Great spot. Get there early or prepare to be hot and bothered parking
text:
Great beaches. Very clean and good for swimming and surfing. Parking is free in many places, but it does get very busy. We had a tiny hire car so could put it anywhere, bigger cars were a problem. 

The sand is moderate coarseness. Made of ground up shells but pounded so much by surf the bits are very small. 
Lots of restaurants within easy reach, but all quite expensive because of location. Ie main course 25 - 59 euros. We took our own picnic. 
If you leave or arrive at the wrong time prepare to queue.

title: Surfing beach
text: Great beach, great view, but too windy to do anything else than surf. Be prepared for the wind otherwise you won't be able to stay too much on this beach.

title: Cool(er) on a hot day
text: We consciously chose to come here when 37c was predicted in the Lisbon area. The beach is accessed by wooden steps but the last step down can be difficult to negotiate being so high above the sandy beach. Because we got there early we found a vantage point atop a little ridge of sand. We walked or sat and watched surfers come and go, some learners, some more experienced. It was reassuring to see that lots of lifeguards were keeping a watchful eye.The surf looked inviting but there's a warning sign about rip tides.

title: Day out surfing
text: My daughter and her friend came here twice for surfing. It’s best to go in the mornings. They cycled to here from Cascais and had a great surf!

title: Day trip
text: We decided to hit the beach on a Monday as the weekend looked crowded as we drove past a couple of times. What a gorgeous beach with beautiful sand and surf. Not too crowded. Surf lessons were plentiful with lots of students. Not many swimmers though as the water was quite cold!

title: Busy and no shade!
text: There's no shade without paying! Sand is scorching hot and burns feet and you have to pay to use any shaded area or place to lie/sit down!! It's also very busy and cramped, difficult to find space for everyone!

title: Great beach and restaurant
text: If you are a surfer this is the beach for you. The restaurant is beach bar type but wow is the menu wide and the food quality excellent. It’s a great place to chill out

title: Guincho beach
text: Guincho beach is a magical place and a playground for water and wind related sports.  Also one of the most fascinating locations for strikingly beautiful sunsets all year round.  A must see when in Portugal

title: The best beach close to Lisbon
text: This is the greatest beach close to Lisbon. Good waves, large beach, you can rent surf boards. There is only one bar at the far end of the beach. So to buy a drink, you have to walk a bit from the place were the surfing happens.

title: Long walk from Estoril
text: We knew it would be but were prepared for it. Well worth it as the beach(es) are lovely. Sloping sand dunes down to the sea front. It wasn't busy so after a really good snack at the beach bar we found a very private area for a bathe. Lovely.

title: Nice beach to enjoy!
text: Nice beach where the kids can enjoy the sand and water.  There were beach volleyball games in progress while we were there...watch or join them.  Close to the downtown area and hotels.

title: Nice place to watch sunset
text: Very windy.  But surfers and kite surfers provide tons of interest plus nice bar and restaurant on far side of beach.  Beautiful sunset over the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Beautiful Unspoiled Beach
text: Guincho Beach was beautiful. Well worth a visit. We loved the huge dunes and watching the surfers. Not a great beach for swimming as the surf is rough. But this beach is a treasure.

title: Surf city
text: Ok I don’t surf but my kid and I had the best time jumping CAREFULLY in the waves. Top restaurant beside or great beach bars. Hit

title: Magdalena
text: Unique, magic place. Advisable to protect oneself against the wind at times, e.g. when eating or drinking or when one has sensitive ears or skin. The wind really massages the body with high quality, bright, pure crystals of sand. The surfers fly in the air and the shows are completely free. Can be cold later in the afternoon, when sun goes down and the wind still plays its whistles.

title: The Journey to the Beach
text: We took 2 electric bikes given by Cascais Council (next to casa da guia) and took the 8km road to guincho. Best road to heaven, this beach, specially if you are lucky to have day without wind! Definitely one of the top 10 things you should do in Cascais!

title: Beautiful views
text: As part of our holiday, we went to Guincho three times, and the views and the weather were perfect. The sand was warm and the waves created an authentic, inviting beach environment. Several restaurants within walking distance and the beach was considerably less crowded, making it perfect for a relaxing day.

title: Pick your day
text: We went to guincho when the day was a bit cloudy so the place wasn’t really buzzing. Even though we picked the wrong day there were still plenty of surfer cutting it up in the basic surf giving good entertainment. We got dropped off by Uber at guincho bar - strolled up the beach and back then 2 sangrias between the 4 of us.

title: Rode our bikes to this beach
text: We rode our rental bikes to this beach from Cascais. It was about a 30 minute ride. We enjoyed a drink at the Surf Academy beach shack. The waves were a bit too strong and the water too cold to fully enjoy the beach, but we had a nice time with our drinks and the view.

title: Dramatic coastline, beautiful beach
text: Lovely bike ride from Cascais. Dramatic clifftop views. Worth the trip. Just go! It’ll be worth it. Enjoyed some delicious Mateus Rose at the beach cafe.

title: Hire a bike and cycle from Cascais 8km on a cycle path
text:
Well worth a visit and going on a bike was a really good way to go as there is a simple cycle path all the way there.
On arrival there is a huge open beach with plenty of things to watch from the windsurfers, kite surfers or just people watching!
Kick your shoes off and walk in the sand and go for a paddle in the sea and kill an hour or so in the sunshine, before you cycle back!

title: Great
text:
The waves on these beaches a tall and fun to jump in. They can be dangerous for small kids, especially the undercurrent that can be very strong! But our kids (4 and 6) also liked to play where the waves just touched them. Teenagers and adults will like to jump in the waves a bit further out but make sure you don’t get over confident as the current (especially when the flags are red or black) can be very strong and if you get knocked by a wave at the same time (talking from personal experience from last time I was here when I was a teen) it will pull you out!

We stayed for half an hour. The kids were having a ball so we could easily have stayed longer but needed to get to our hotel up north.

title: Beautiful
text: This is our favourite beach in Cascais. It’s just beautiful and not as crowded as the others in the centre. Its just a shame sometimes it’s a little too windy.

title: Never changes but always vhanging
text: Our favourite surfing beach in the world.  The southern end hotel and bar undergoing major refurbishment so the northern end is best with a great bar and restaurant grouping as well as a smaller surf shack beach bar.  You’ll never be bored here - have surfing lessons - at least try body boarding and take a camera to catch the kite surfers.

title: Vast beach & sand dunes
text: Came here for a walk as weather not great, although some blue sky peeked through. Several sections to the beach, lots of surfers and walkways onto san dunes behind. Nice beach to visit.

title: Amazing Sunsets
text: A definite must see. The dunes are incredible but the most amazing sunsets. Great to see all the surfers.

title: Nice Cozy Beach Attraction
text: Nice beach, with some pretty cozy cafe and restaurants along the coast.  Price on the high side, but not outrageous.  Good place to experience the beach culture

title: Best beach on Hainan.
text: People are super relaxed and friendly here. We took a Surfing class at Jalenboo Surf School with Kidd and it was great. We came back one month later to take another class with him. The water is clear, the waves are good for beginners and there are many restaurants and cafes where you can hang out. The most chilled place in China!

title: Busy and surfy type cool
text: The beach is accessible from a board walk over a stream.  It's big and deeply shelving.  The surf is apparently the best on the island.  Lots of surf schools and cool looking people.  Behind the beach is a strip of restaurants and cafes and a cool little bar with the only gin and tonic we could find in the area.  It's not 4 star but excellent for the beach lover types.

title: Great surfing beach very laid back
text: Had a great surfing coach for my daughter called Psycho. Really nice place. Waves weren't big while we were there which was good for her. A little underdeveloped but I think that's the nice part of it. You'll need to get a rental car to get there

title: Relaxing and chilled
text: Less touristy, few beautiful beach and sea. Few good options for staying over eg the forest inn. Most people are here for surfing but we were just passing through for the day/night and were happy to chill on the beach, go swimming and try a spot of fishing. Would be difficult to get to without a private car though.

title: Will return, and will stay in Riyue Bay
text:
Visited twice in two days. Had three great swims, caught plenty of waves and chilled out by the Forest Inn pool. My son had a two hour surf lesson, and caught plenty of waves. Yes, surf can be fickle, but if anywhere is going to get waves, I reckon this would be the place.

There are at least 3 surf clubs here. We went to the original (Surfing Hainan/Jalenboo/Riyue Bay Surf Club). They rent boogie boards and surf boards and provide lessons. My son had a one-on-one two hour lesson and caught waves and professed himself to be not afraid anymorevof padding for waves! Good lesson.

I would have liked to have walked to the Northern point where the best waves would be, but it wasn’t working. That also looks lovely and natural. The beachfront architecture is hotch potch and despite the huge development to the South, there is still a village vibe. There’s enough going on to stay the night. The Forest Inn looked basic but fine.

I stayed in Xinglong, but next time I’d stay in Riyue Bay. Also, water temp was good - not too hot.

title: Disappointing
text:
I had heard about this place as a surf haven, and when I came there were about 5 guys attempting to surf, but the waves just weren't big enough.

If you're not coming for the surfing, there's little to see or do. There are a couple of restaurants and plenty of stalls

title: OK surf spot but not much else
text:
Stayed 3 nights at hotel near riyue wan in december. Had initially planned a longer stay but wind/waves/current was too strong due to offshore typhoon so left early since literally nothing else to do or eat when not surfing. the only hotel here did not have wifi in room and i couldn't watch TV either bc it was blurry and only 6 channels all in chinese. 

so the beach is like any typical beach youll find in australia or america. nothing to write home about but it was uncrowded which was nice. they are building some resort with large cranes over the ocean when i was there so that did kill the scenic beach vibe for me and it is really big so you can see it when youre sitting in the line up or really anytime you look over the horizon out to see, so that was minus. 

the main left break is a far paddle out and definitely tiring when the swells are pumping. you also need to watch out for the reefs as they are all over and under where the main surf breaks. i wore my hard bottom reef shoes and would recommend same for you unless you are experienced surfing shallow reef breaks (i do not, having mainly surfed in california where we dont have many reef breaks). soft bottom booties wouldnt protect you as these reefs felt pretty hard. first day there, i bumped into a local kid that got the underside of his foot torn up bc he was surfing barefoot. many locals do it tho but they are very experienced with this break and surfing over this particular reef. also if you are a taller surfer then the more reason to wear hard reef shoes. 

now the wave... best part, its uncrowded, just handful of locals and beginners usually. unless its pumping and/or overhead, i suspect this wave is more fattish and mellow other than the first section where it hits the shallow reef and throws a bit but then immediately mellows out some with fattish shoulder to play with so overall seems like a fun wave but i only really surfed it once and it was 3-5ft that day. you can def use a funboard or longboard here even when its pumping. they host longboard contests yearly here past couple years i think. shortboard would also work but it is a long paddle out and looked like too much work unless surf is at least 4/5 ft. fish would prob be lot of fun at 3-4ft. 

PRO: good break for more experienced surfers to practice, esp reg footers like myself can work on backhand. the wave seems rippable and is not overly fast with open face available for vertical surfing. would not recommend for beginners bc of the reef. also, the local surf shop is great and super friendly with decent selection of boards for rent. book hotel room through surf shop for better rates or stay at their hostel if solo. 

CON: reef all over and long paddle out; nothing else to do or anywhere else to go when not surfing; lack of food options; lack of public transportation (need to cab it to and from train station)

Overall: if you are here just to surf and you want to surf in china specifically, unless the swells conditions happen to be ideal when you're here, i prob wouldnt come down here just for the swell, in part, bc the other amentiies and infrastructure around the area are really lacking (and you need a wetsuit during the prime season, i.e. winter). if you havent surf traveled much then you can try riyuewan but if you have ever surfed in hawaii, taiwan, california, costa rica, or australia (esp australia which has the best and most consistent glassy surf ive ever surfed) then you may be disappointed unless you time your riyuewan just right to match the right swells (in which case, some great surf sessions can thep trump the fact that there is nothing else to do nearby)

title: Nice Landscape, Friendly People, but...
text: When we were there bad waves for surfing: no one to blame for that but hardly anything else to do. Still the surf lesson I got from the guys at surfinghainan.com was pretty good. And people spoke English there and are friendly and helpful. 100 RMB to hire a board. The village itself offers some roadside shops for tourist needs but nothing fancy, it's all very worn down and basic. No ATM, no Family Mart, no pharmacy, no... Don't expect any kind of European comfort. Difficult to find shadow to just sit on the beach. Beach not 100% clean but we've seen worse on Hainan. Water is nice. There's a public bus which we did not use, looks adventurous but without Chinese language skill I guess arranging a car service is the way to get here.

title: Surf day!
text: Beautiful white sandy beach. We mainly experienced the surf shop. Super chill and relaxing place. Workers are welcoming and very friendly. Rented boards for a reasonable price. Comes with free locker. Awesome pizza from the restaurant! Super fresh & good size. Definitely can share! Can't wait to go back!

title: My first time surfing
text: Stayed here two nights and two days. At one end of the beach there are some statues for the tourists to pose by. At the other end there is a rocky granite reef. I saw two men snorkeling there and there were sea urchins and crabs around. Half way along the beach there is a surf club where there is a bar and you can hire surf boards. I was there with a school group and we hired some instructors to teach us to surf. The waves were not enormous, but were great for beginners like ourselves.The water was beautiful to be in. Overall the beach was not particularly crowded, except in the late afternoons when tour buses would roll in for a short time. There are some hotels and restaurants nearby.

title: Surfing
text:
We have been Here now, And first It Is a little difficult to arrive from the highway Or Wanning By bus. 
Once You get Here It Is everything very simple , You can get a room in a hotel very cheap 60¥ per bed And night. There Are Two parts of the Surfing club, one next yo the hotel Where You check in And one at the beach.
Rent a surf Board Is very cheap 100¥ per day And You have clothes too. And if You Are hungry the restaurant is very good, specially the hamburger And the pizza.
It Is a good experience.

title: The Best Beach of China
text:
We went around the whole Hainan Island, and once we got to Riyue Bay, it was paradise on Earth, or at least that is if you like waves and interaction with the ocean, without the crowds. Although everyone in China rushes to Sanya, with their lake like still waters, Riyue allows you to experience a more raw, natural, authentic experience. Facilities are scarce, since it's more a place for Chinese tour groups that stop to eat and take pictures, but don't get wet. So, you have only 4 restaurants, and 3 options for sleeping. During summer the waters are calm and you can go snorkeling. From November to March, it is mostly good for surfing. The beach is calm and clean, compared to other places. There were two camels roaming.
We go as a family, the kids love it. It s the 3rd time, and am sure we ll keep going there as long as we live in China.

title: Amazing
text: Simply amazing! For everyone who likes unspoiled nature, beautiful beaches, surfing and photography. Surfing lesson is my top experience. People are friendly and welcoming. If you decide to stay more than one day, hostel at the surf club is great option. At this place, all problems disappear, it makes you relaxed and positive.

title: Great bay, but it has a trash problem
text:
The bay is beautiful. The surfing is excellent for beginners. The local hotels and hostel are nice. 

But the area has a trash problem. Trash is strewn about the northern end of the beach and up to the point. People have been using the area as a dump.

Moreover, there are a large number of abandoned houses nearby. They're a blight on the land. That's why I didn't come back.

To the local government raking in tourist grants from Beijing: Restore Riyue Bay to its natural beauty. Only then will you see a tourism boom.

title: Not enough to be put on the world surfing map
text:
The left hand point is a nice fun wave and generally protected from the wind all day for round the clock sessions. A half decent length ride best for long boards unit it gets 3-4ft plus. Tides are small and have little effect. The beach has more size and power but while I was there very square with no banks to form peaks, its was just 50m shore break close outs. One day a few guys on boards were out playing it. If you plan staying a while watch for national and international competition times to avoid competing with a packs of pro surfers. I cut my trip short because of this.

A little difficult to get to unless you pay top dollar for a taxi otherwise get to Wanning and try for a bus that will take about 40-60min and could be packed with locals and school kids. Unless you are serious for a surf I would't bother as there is almost nothing else going on here. There's a large shed structure in which you'll find a surf shop (Surfing Hainan) with a surprising selection of boards to rent, and a basic restaurant that specialises in local seafood for day tripper groups of Chinese. Meat and fish dishes are on the pricey side but are OK and several staff speak OK english. After dark a few other basic places spring up.

There is really only one hotel (Hotel 21) in town for an extended stay, I couldn't find it online to book or read reviews. Rooms are reasonably priced, breakfast is rather basic and little english is spoken. A US teacher from Haikou just pitched his tent next to the surf club!

The surf may be OK if thats all you came for otherwise its just a underdeveloped empty beach.

title: Quiet oasis today - future surfing Mecca tomorrow
text:
A little difficult to get to if you are travelling to Hainan, however its well worth the visit as a day trip or overnight.
Clean beach, clear waters and best of all good surfing from Sept-April.  Currently international surfing tournaments are held during the fall/winter, but outside of that you'll have the beach to yourselves.  Makes for very quiet and peaceful times, can enjoy camping next to or on the beach, and a nighttime bonfire.

title: Enjoy the blue waters
text:
Really liked the beach. Neat and clean.
The water is very clear. Do spend some time there. Good place for photography as well.

title: Surfing!!!
text: Not developed (good thing) with good restaurant on beach (Fat Mamas) and a surf shop!  check the website

title: Huntington State Beach
text: There is a lot of stuff in the sand. Wish it was a little cleaner

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Nice open spaces, but be prepared to pay for parking, the earlier you get there the better, there are also fire pits for the evenings.  They are open till 10pm.  Overall a great beach and plenty of space and great life guards.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Best water

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
Most of the parking lots were closed even thou they were only half full... im guessing due to holiday weekend
good for a california beach thou, nothing special but solid

title: Huntington State Beach
text: The beach is always a great spot to go to relax and enjoy the sea air

title: Huntington State Beach
text: I don't like that there's no soap at the wash stations, also, no dogs allowed on the beach. Even with leash before 10 am like Newport. I don't like that.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Great long stretch of beach for walking…. But globs of tar the last few days.   You can get it off easily enough with mineral oil or something similar…. But a mess.    Waves were greenish gray even in the sun today.   No one in the water today.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Had a fun night with family for Memorial Day weekend.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: amazing beach! you can have a fire, set up a tent, and enjoy the water all at the same time

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
Best Biggest Beach
Sehr lebendig
Nur die Wellen sind halt sehr Stark

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Big waves and surfboard, bike, boogie board rentals everywhere. There's a lot of people but that's to be expected.

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
We visited Huntington Beach twice, both on weekends, one was Memorial Day weekend.
The beach was busy but not crowded. Even though there were a lot of people there was plenty of space.
There were lifeguards on duty, a craft fair both times, numerous volleyball nets, bikes to rent, a paved walking/biking path, street musicians, sprinklers for washing sand off your feet, and food stands.
There are a great many restaurants on the opposite side of the road from the beach, with menus to fit different budgets, as well as some shops.
Parking Price is very widely. It is $20 parking to get into the state park, parking lots on the beach. One parking area wanted $1.50 for every 15 minutes! We will grateful we stumbled into the underground parking garage with entrance on 6th Street, one block away from the beach. We were parked there for 1 hour and 51 minutes and it cost us $3 on Memorial Day weekend.
I was surprised at how many chewed up bits of plastic there were washed up on the beach from the tide. Part of a plastic bag here, a bottle cap there... The pieces were small, but there were lots of them. That has nothing to do with Huntington Beach I am sure, rather all the beaches and the area are probably the same.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: State beach in HB.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: A large parking lot, a large beach, there is a place to ride a bike , skates and with a beautiful landscape

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Has waves and sand. Beach for sure.

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
Baptize California was a great day on the beach and good music.
Food truck lines were long and so was the wait. Better to prepare food and snacks  ahead of time.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Pentecost Sunday 2024 at Huntington State Beach was a day to go down in history. We baptized over 12,000 this day and had a worship event like no other on this beach. Check out the pictures

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Stepped on Tar.......took like an hour to scrub off.  you can see the oil rigs off in the distance, no doubt where its from.  the waters gross,  smells, sand is somewhat decent. Laguna Beach was much more enjoyable for wanting to go INTO the water.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Big waves, we saw a family of dolphins and I swear I saw a shark inside a wave. Bon fire pits for the win. Only downside is the bathrooms have no light

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Occasionally littered and dirty, but overall, I enjoy my time. I'm so glad they have fire pits and volleyball nets and lots of space on the sand.

title: Huntington State Beach

title: Huntington State Beach

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
Bajha steak tacos were super good. Server was friendly
The view of the ocean is absolutely stunning.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: The beach offers volleyball courts, bonfire pits and of course Huntington Beach Pier. It is open from 5am to 10pm. There is no entrance fee but have to pay for the parking $15. You can also reach the beach by bike via Huntington Beach Bike Trail.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Nice and warm

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Sushi restaurant right down the street and had a great time out in the sun.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Born & raised in HB, I grew up playing on these beaches and loved every minute of it. But I've noticed in recent years (since the pandemic ) that the homeless population has slightly increased, which brought on more dirty restrooms and some public sitting areas were strewn with clothes or personal items from someone who was displaced and living out there on the beach. It looks like Parks and Recreation are stepping up their maintenance of all facilities by having their restrooms and all other public facilities checked and/or cleaned every few hours. Other than that, everything else was great! Clean beaches and water. Very family friendly. And beautiful sunsets! (My camera could not do it justice)

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Unfortunately the beach has been contaminated with oil on the south end. The oil is awful! Don’t take my word for it just Google tar balls, Huntington Beach and click on news. It’s all over the news.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: The kids enjoy the fire pits south of the pier. Although you sometimes have to wait to get in the paid parking lot, there's always plenty of spaces and you can't beat parking right on the boardwalk.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Nice, clean and kid friendly beach, easy to park.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: My daughter and I visited the beach and some dude offered my daughter (3) black tar heroin. We accepted his offer but refused to pay. Due to the poor terrain of sand, we were not able to run away. She’s dead now. I’m so sorry Rebeckah.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Beautiful

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Huntington Beach is always a great spot. Brookhurst is a great location away from the pier. Make sure to get there early if you want to grab a fire pit.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: We came from GA for an event-Don' be afraid to dance, your with family, Introduce  yourself, Bring a sweater, allow time to park, make sure you are at the correct beach, (GPS)& don't get burned(Bonfore embers),  and enjoy the Cali vibes with the JW fam (oh-Use the rest room before or after you come its the beach)

title: Huntington State Beach
text: HB now a major tourist attraction with various concerts, conventions, airshow, pro surf/volleyball tournaments and normal weekend festivities. City does a great job of keeping it clean. Boardwalk/bike path can get congested on the weekends and ebikers can get out of control. Lots of restaurants, shops and hotels.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Shouldn’t cost $15 to go to the beach and Laguna Beach has just as good of a view. However, it is less crowded and lots of space.  Sunset views were beautiful.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Went to Huntington state beach to celebrate a birthday it was a great place to get together with friends and family. We had a fire pit going food and an alover great day here will definitely be on our summer trip list.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Weather was perfect, beach was clean and all the visitors were very well behaved. Everyone needs to spend at least one day there!

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Clean beach, good walk to get down to the ocean. Might be a challenge for seniors or people with disabilities. Electric bikes, as well as regular bikes move at a fast rate of speed. Could be dangerous for children or seniors. Need to review criteria for Veterans receiving free parking, too strenuous. Maybe have a discount rate for veterans, who might just want to visit the State Park to just sit and take in the site. Those with PSTD could really benefit from a day at the beach. I'm a senior and Veteran, but still had to pay $14 for parking, yikes . Thank you for your service, sounds nice but no substance to the saying. I'm not so concerned for me but for my fellow Veterans who might not be able to afford the rates

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
Beach is always clean, well maintained and best part: hardly anyone around from November through late March

Main Street/pch right by the Pier gets crowded so plan on leaving early to find parking (usually a few spots along pch that is pay on meter).

Weather is pretty much the same year round

*Pro-tip: grab a sandwich and a drink on your way down to the beach at Massimos on the corner of Brookhurst and Bushard st.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Love the beach and catch a quick sunset every now and then. Highly recommend the annual parking pass if you come often.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Parking is available at a rate of $15. Please note that American Express is not accepted here. Despite being slightly chilly, the beach boasts stunning views and remains relatively uncrowded, even on a Sunday afternoon, offering a peaceful retreat.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Wonderful beach. Endless shoreline. Nice for walking with your feet in the water or reading a book by the sea.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Best beach on the west coast!

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Nice big beach. Lot of fun watching big waves during a break in the storms.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Great place to walk and do some exercise on a clear morning. Even on cloudy day it is a treat.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Nice beach. I've been going here for years

title: Huntington State Beach
text: The beach and surrounding areas are just beautiful. In addition to regular parking, I noticed there is an RV park area as well. The sunset has a great view. You may sit on the benches and watch the sunset or you can walk on the Pier and enjoy the view.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: I've been riding my bike here down the SART for about 35 years. The facilities at the beach are in terrible shape. Multiple restroom areas have been torn down and those that remain have most of the doors locked shut. The snack area near Brookhurst has been under construction for 2 years and it doesn't look like any restrooms will be rebuilt.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Summer bonfires, sand, and surf. Winter more equals less people more solitude.

title: Huntington State Beach

title: Huntington State Beach
text: The sunset was BEAUTIFUL!! The weather was perfect, it wasn't crowded and the bathroom was clean.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: One of my favorite beaches to go to. Well maintained, beautiful views, fire pits, volleyball courts, restaurants/dining…the list is never ending!

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
Great place to park and enjoy what the beach has to offer, away from the busier pier and eatery & shopping areas. Picnic areas is just a short walk away! Plenty of restrooms and open air shower heads.

Parking is operated by state park, this is a fair walk away from the pier but if you plan to spend the whole day here, cost of parking might work out.

title: Huntington State Beach
text:
I suggest city side the state side police have much to be desired. The over the top abuse and lack of training with the position. These men are an insult to the title of police officer. They are Park and Rec. Over glorified security that as a 50 yr old having no record got forearmed and slammed  to the ground for a belated 50th Birthday present.when I asked why I was told I looked the wrong way!
Keep your family safe from these animals go North of state beach!
Your well being simply isn't worth the risk.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Beautiful beach ⛱️️ and the architecture of the surrounding buildings is amazing and terracotta was lovely and the sun set from the Pier was one of utmost beauty and magnificence with alot of fun  things for the family to do and the barefoot bar is an awesome spot to wet your whistle

title: Huntington State Beach
text: Love this place, great shore fishing and they have bathrooms pretty much at every parking lot.

title: Huntington State Beach
text: What! this is one of the best beaches in orange County, in my opinion. I love the life and energy of Huntington Beach. I love Huntington Beach beach more than other beach near it. It is accessible for every one. The beach offers volleyball fields, á pier for better view over the beach. People at the beach are very friendly.
The beach and the habitants bring a very positive, healthy vibe which inspires me a lot. I’m practicing yoga at the beach with beautiful view and mindful atmosphere.
There are public restrooms and showers available I guess every 500ft. It has a playground for kids near the 10th.
It has lots of parking possibilities. I normally don’t park at the PHW because of the traffic, I park at side way (13th- 20th) and walk a block down to the beach.

It wasn't crowded at all the Sunday afternoon we visited. I wish the waves were a little bigger so the kiddos could better play with their boogie boards, but overall it was alright. Sand castles were built, kids were buried, and we had a great time. This is my second trip to this particular beach and my experience was the same (though less crowded this time) both times.

My only complaint would be that we didn't have a bathroom with showers bear us, just individual stalls on the outside of the building and of the 2 two showers outside, 1 was very high pressure and was slightly painful.

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text: Beautiful spot overlooking the cove. Long idyllic walk along a few sheer drops hidden by brush and treetops so beware. Don’t drive unless you have a 4x4 with at least 10inches of clearance.  Big ruts in some spots will bury a car and flip a standard SUV.  If you have off road experience, then proceed with the usual caution using a spotter to clear a drop before committing. Really fun bumping along if you can though!

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text:
This review might be a little contentious. It's not that I think this is a bad spot, it's just overhyped for most of the year. If you're not there when Peahi is breaking, don't bother.

In May 2017, there was no break (obviously), but I really wanted to see this famous spot anyway. The road conditions were terrible. Even in a light 4x4, I was concerned that any rain would trap us at the bottom of the road, unable to drive out. Tons of washouts, junked/burned cars, and a couple of grades that will be very challenging in the wet.

The problem is that the sections with the steepest grades have become extremely washed out and lumpy. You can't carry much speed, so you have to pull your way up. On road tires, you can end up in trouble with any amount of rain.

To put it in perspective, we drove nearly everywhere (including Polihale) on Kauai, which was a cake walk by comparison. In short, the view is nice, but it's not any better than the 100 other cliff views in Maui. Only go out if there is a break. There will be plenty of locals to bail you out for $20 if you get stuck.

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text: Had a unique experience that we'll remember forever.
