title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text: Incredible view, incredible waves. Even with a 4x4 Jeep in 4x4 low, this was a difficult drive that I STRONGLY RECOMMEND WALKING. Many stuck abandoned and trashed cars, and one AWD stuck and flooded in a deep puddle. Walk it, no tow trucks.

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text:
It was great off road trail. We stopped after the sign, and i’m glad we did- there was a truck stuck closer to the end, it was risky to even try to get to the point where he was. Fair to mention he did not have 4x4. We could have potentially go through, but the last trench was really deep.
Walk from the sign was about 15-20 minutes all the way to the bottom.  Last part of the hike( descending), was a bit steep, but nothing extreme. It’s more slippery on a clay road. The beach was empty and there were no surfers that morning, so we enjoyed absolute solitude and beauty of this spot. On our way back we already met few hikers. It was around 10-11am

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break

Nice views at the end but the road in
should be taken seriously. The clay turns to ice with now traction and the road has many deep water sections and wash outs. A good 4x4 with ground clearance is the way.

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text: This is an off-roading trail, if there is a surf break you will have a very difficult time getting there even with 4 wheel drive. Not sure I can recommend this trail to nowhere.

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text:
1st Logistics -- if you have a car, stop on the paid parking on left (don't drive it) off the main road.  If you have an SUV, you can only go 1/2 way & there's really no place to park.  If you have a 4x4, you can only go about another 500ft because the ONLY vehicle that can drive this is a Hawaiian 4x4 (jacked up ground clearance + oversized super mud whumper tires).  Finally if you hike in, give yourself time and bring water (+snack)...take all your trash out, too!

2nd Time of Day & Conditions -- 40' wave is high tide, peak wind.  If you're coming any other time, you can see just as good waves in Ho'okipa.  I still had fun, but it's hard to tell size over distance w/o a reference.

Update: Locals said moon cycle helps -- come daytime of a full moon and October is seasonally best

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text: We followed Google maps and then all the sudden there was no paved road to follow.  Some local lady offered us to park by her house for $10 and we decided to walk the remaining 1.5 miles up and 1.5 miles up.  Well, it was a huge waste of time and energy.  The lookout ain't worth the effort... the lady just wanted the $10 and told us it was a great view... not so,  at least when we went.  We highly discourage people from going... but if you decide to go... don't pay the $10 to the home owners because even though the road ain't paved you can drive a few hundred yards down to an opening where you can park and then walk less and save ten bucks.

title: Pe'ahi Jaws Surf Break
text: This place is difficult to reach. Do not attempt without four wheel drive. On busy days there is a $10 shuttle that takes you down the old pineapple dirt road to the viewpoint. If visiting, I recommend this option. Many people walk down the dirt road, but prepare for a long, hot, dusty or muddy walk. The view from the cliff is best if you have a powerful zoom lense because the action is pretty far away. The last time I visited it had rained and the road was so muddy that many cars got stuck in the mud. Everyone viewing the waves also left covered in mud just from walking out to the point from the parking area. Definitely avoid this place if it has recently rained.

title: Peahi
text: Worth the hike in! Especially if the waves are high, carefully some parts of slippery, I fell and enjoyed a mud bath but still worth it! If you are lucky you may even be offered a ride back up the tough terrain! Mahalo to the awesome pair that brought us back to our car! So worth seeing.

title: Peahi
text:
This is a hit and miss spot, because the waves are often not big, and there are easier beaches to visit. On a normal day just hit ho'okipa. The forecast was for 25'+ for a few days on our trip so we wandered down. We found a spot at the start of the road immediately off the highway and walked the whole way. Its maybe a mile to the upper lookout and there are a bunch of trails that take you to the rocky beach. The road is not driveable in a car or minivan. A truck with 4wd and AT tires will have no problem. There was a little mud and some nig puddles but the road was easy to walk, and not that steep. The trails down to the beach were steeper and more slippery, but easy in good trail runners or light hikers.

There is a river and lush jungle that I would like to explore next time!

title: Peahi
text: A natural wonder of the world. Absolutely take your breath away. Many thanks go out to the surfers who risk everything when this place is charging!! Without the worldwide interest in this beautiful, but dangerous sport, Peahi has become a world spectacle for all to see and enjoy. It's  a challenge of major proportions to the producer, Handsome Buggah Productions to have the preparations ready on a 6 day window for a contest that lasts 1 week in a 2 month period, when the waves start coming from the N Pacific. Rain, wind, mud all conditions for the competitors and the production and water safety crews.

title: Peahi

title: Peahi
text:
BEAUTIFUL stop. Unfortunately there wasn't that much activity going on with the waves, but it was a great stop to check out this legendary place.

BEWARE, people weren't kidding when they said that there's a dirt road. We asked the cashier in the shop before the road to Jaws and she helped us locate the place. However, she did not say how intense this road was. It felt like we went off roading - dirt road, only one lane (hope that no one is going the opposite way), holes everywhere, alot of trash, trenches.... Probably took us about 30minutes of slow driving since we were in a sedan. I would highly recommend ensuring you have a SUV when driving these roads.

Would I recommend this place? It's only worth the drive if you're a HUGE FAN of Jaws and MUST SEE the place even if the waves aren't massive. Then check it out. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend it. The drive, the sight of trash and lack of activity wasn't worth the drive.

You can see the same view in other areas.

title: Peahi
text: I drove back here a week ago while on vacation. First off have the proper vehicle. SUV/trucks are the ONLY way to drive back here. You can drive a regular car  however I highly recommend you park and 'walk-in' and the road (dirt) tends to 'gully' and 'washout' after any decent rainfall. Once you reach the roads end (maybe two miles at best) you come to a cliff. Watch the edge! There is some vegetation overgrowth and then just straight down to the rocks. To actually get to the beachhead you have to hike down a small single back trail probably 200'-300' in elevation thru dense rain forest. As someone who has never even held a surfboard it is a lot to ponder why someone would risk life and limb to surf such a fierce and rocky break? Whatever it's still cool to see and take pictures. Safety first!

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful, calm, and peaceful black sand beach in the Gianyar area. Came in the late afternoon on a weekend and was surprised it was fairly empty, except for a few other tourists and fishermen. title: Keramas Beach
text: One of the best long Black sand beaches with strong waves (check Tide Table & weather apps before you visit) Recommended for a morning visit, easy to reach via Gojek, but to leave with Gojek, you need to avoid local taxi mafia by leaving till the main road junction, beyond the paddy field (not ideal for sunset / night travel) The beach is clean, if not overlapping with weekends or festival crowds, so no complaints if you visit during non-peak season morning with no crowd. Not recommended for swimming alone as there is no safe guard, you are dealing with Pacific Ocean waves and undercurrent.

title: Keramas Beach

Swimming was not recommended due to the coral and possible injuries. But the hotel has a swimming pool, so that compensates. You have to spend at least 300K to sit on the poolside sun loungers. A good option for surfers‍♀️ By the way, if you plan to go there with Grab, be careful about the return if you are staying in Ubud or far from the beach. They take you there, but then no cars arrive at the beach for the return. We tried, and no driver accepted the trip. Finally, we returned to Ubud with a taxi (it will be marked on the way to the beach).

There is a choice of accommodation in all budgets within a stroll of the beach. Great for a few days of relaxing and getting away from the crowds and good choice for surfers

title: Scored some Keramas tubes
text: Took my 16 year old out here early the other morning for the famous wave and we were lucky to score it on a good day. Punchy 3 foot tube ride and about 15 others out there ripping it. Definite must for the surfers out there. Black sand beach glittered in the sun.

title: QUIET, CALM SERENE - in the shoulder season
text: Keramas Beach was recommended by friends... during the shoulder season, it was a laid-back, serene, clean beach.  There is an ‘international cuisine’ restaurant, and villas right on the beach-front. In the late afternoon, there were a few folks fishing, and children playing on the beach. Very relaxing !

title: It's ok! Nothing special
text:
Vast black sand beach 20mins NE of Sanur popular for surfing although there were only one or two boards out when I was there. Not sure about swimming as there were no signs up or flags on safe parts of the beach to swim. I would say not for children or non confident swimmers. You can see more of the coast and across to Nusa Penida. 
There is not much going on, minimal facilities.. accommodation, places to eat etc.

title: International surf competition!
text: One wave from the best surfeurs in the world! Thank you Keramas & Corona Bali Protected! Thank you Kanoa Igarashi for the dreamy show! Thank you Kelly Slater & Stephanie Gilmore for the surf lesson just watching you!

title: My favorite beach on Bali
text: I will admit that I had given up on Bali's beaches (excluding the smaller islands) but on my last day I was able to visit Keramas and very happy I did. The black sand was beautiful that day, and the strong sun helped it gleam and shine against the blue water, making it a very dramatic sight. A handful of little cafes (excellently priced) and nice resorts make it an easy beach to go to for any budget. Would love to stay on the beach next time.

title: Surf paradise
text:
watch so many young man surf in this beach is make me fell want to learn how to surf , with good wafe

when I was enjoy my self watch the waves rooling down to the beach make me realize why the like to surf in this beach, big waves & not too crowd thats why they comr here to surf.

.

title: Looking for surf place
text: Less tourist, good spot for surf. I heart this places has nice wave for people doing surf, specially at night house they have big light.

title: worth the visit
text: amazing to see jet black natural volcanic beach. great surf beach but also great to explore with the many natural objects that are washed up from the ocean floor.

title: Black is the new white
text:
Do you like white sandy beaches? Have you visit a black sand beach?
Black sand shimmers in a way white can't. It's beautiful and magical. 

But this is not a beach to lay and relax. It's very empty and have just a few places to eat and no chairs. Also black sand does stick everywhere. :-)

But if you want a bit alone time on a beach, this is perfect.

title: really awesome
text: great for surfing, black sand beaches! really awesome place if youre a surfer... its world famous! we dont surf but enjoyed the area around and took cars to get to other restaurants nearby!

title: Volcanic beach great for surfing
text: Lovely beach with high waves, sand was too dark and the view was spectacular. It isnt safe to swim due to the high waves though.

title: Amazing black sparkly sand
text: You need to see the black sparkly sand on this beach to believe how amazing it is. The beach isnt the best for swimming, but great for surfing. Good for wetting your legs or a quick dip at high tide. A beautiful outlook and place to watch the surfers from the Komune Resort.

title: Wild water, good for surfers, not for swinmming
text: We lived in the Diamond Villas at Keramas Beach. Unfortunately we are not surfer and weren't aware that the beach is not good for swimming so we couldn't use it. We walked some tours and dined at Timor Kitchen (very recommendable) and the Swan Restaurant (nice place). The beach is ok clean and if you like big waves it is nice to sit and look over the wild ocean.

title: Black sand beach
text: This is a black sand beach with great sunset views and good surf. The beach is not so clean but still nice for a relaxing walk.

title: Amazing Beach with black sparkling sand and incredible sunset!
text: An Amazing Beach with black sparkling sand that shines like glitter and incredible sunsets every day! Great surf spot or place to relax!

title: Could be beautiful.
text: This beach is could be so beautiful, but there is so much litter everywhere it's a real shame. It's worth the visit regardless.

title: Good for Surfing
text: good for surfing, otherwise not very pretty beach, dark sand. But you can enjoy at the resort infant of the beach

title: Worth a visit
text:
For visitors such as myself coming from Australia, I am used to white sandy beaches. Keramas does not have that. It has black sand, which is due to the volcanoes of Bali and the black sand shimmers in the sunlight.

The beach itself would be picture perfect if were were not for rubbish left strewn around, which certainly lessens its beauty. However, the rubbish is less than is regularly sighted on Kuta Beach.

Keramas Beach is only 45  minutes drive from Kuta and is worth the visit for a walk along the black sand or to catch to some good sized waves.

title: Walking in the beach with black sands
text: This beach with black sands collection. You can play surfing here of playing with sands. Around this beach, many restaurant and hotel.

title: For surf
text: This is a great beach for surf. Have good waves but the water is not so clean and have a lot of trash. Just surf not swim....

title: Take a long walk on this Keramas black sand!
text:
You will not be able to swim on this beach, but you will definitely love a long beach walk on this black sand while enjoying the warm water of Indian Ocean. 
There is a wooden bar at the entrance from the road, where you can enjoy your Coconut with only 15 000,00 idr while listening to the ocean. 
The place is not crowded at all, so if you need a momentous of quietness this is a place for you!

title: Keramas beach
text:
Nice Place , 
Swim with dolphin 
For sunset View 
Very nice Place 
Nice music with bar side of beach 
Beautiful Wave

title: Best for surfing
text: pretty good distance from us. but it paid off with a very beautiful waves for surfing, you better go with the local guide drivers gede +62 878-6136-8555

title: Great for surfers, otherwise very dirty
text: The beach itself is lovely - black volcano sand that sparkles on the sand, great waves and few nice spots to have a drink. Apart from that, unless you're staying at Komuna Resort & Beach Club (which has a small pool with some sunbeds around), you wouldn't want to put your towel on the beach itself. It's literally covered in garbage..

title: Bali's must visit place
text: Wonderful spot. In a shiny day the black volcanic sand looks like filled with diamond powder. It shines. Huge waves and lotta surfers.

title: a nice empty beach
text: i loved this beach because there was almost no one! and more important my boyfriend had a really good surf!

title: Keramas beach is that exotic beauty with dark kohl eyes and long shimmery jet black hair
text:
If u are seeking a slightly different experience from white sandy beaches, mojitos and beach club pounding loud house music, u may want to explore the keramas black beach
I was looking for something different from a the perfectly manicured gardens and palm trees swaying and keramas beach situated on the south eastern side of Bali is a delightful gem.

There's something introspective and mystical about the black beach that can only be experienced if u do a lone  beach walk,  listening to the symphony of the Indian Ocean and let your imagination reach  the far depths of the oceans trenches. You watch unrelenting waves satisfying the adrenalin  of  surfers, you observe the foamy sea water caressing every black stone that is a little piece of art from the stone carver call the Ocean. You can also spot locals flying kites, Balinese ladies  offering canang to the spirits of the seas, and a smattering of vacationers on the beautiful  beach front villas. 

Komune beach club  is a must visit, they have beautiful Nasi goreng and a good piña colada. 
Do nothing except to breath, soak up the delicious saltiness of the ocean breeze, and catch the sunrise emerging from the distant mount Agung every morning 
If the white sandy beach is that sexy perfectly tanned blond babe,Then the black beach of keramas must surely be that exotic beauty with dark kohl eyes and shimmery black hair

title: Hot sand...
text: This is a great to surf when the wind is blowing onshore on Uluwatu. There is a beck break with lots of fun peaks and a reef brake in front of the Komune hotel. Great surf! just be sure to bring sandals ... the sand is really hot

title: Black sandy beach - amazing to see
text: What's all the secretness about where the black sandy beaches in Bali are?  There are kilometres and kilometres of them.  Many are very easy to reach and one is Keramas beach about half an hours taxi drive from Kuta.  My wife and I will come back and stay at the nearest resort/hotel next time.  This is a wonderful Balinese beach to visit and see black sand.  It has its own beauty.

title: Without nighttime structure
text: We were in Maresias in May (off-season), rough sea, but very beautiful! Light, soft, and clean sand. We felt safe; however, unfortunately, the city does not offer nightlife structure. Either you consume in the most 'famous' and consequently expensive places, or there are few alternative options for food. The streets are in a precarious situation, without lighting and potholed. Especially on the first days of the week (Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday), we found most establishments closed, leaving us to have dinner at a bakery.

title: Maresias Beach
text: Good extension beach, with a reasonable and quite uneven sand strip. I traveled in April 2024, and the sea was very rough, with several danger signs in various points. Good water temperature.

title: Very good
text: Very beautiful, good beach to enjoy the sea, stay relaxed without people looking you up and down, you can bring your cooler and have fun. We loved it!

title: First visit to Maresias
text: The beach has a long extension of light sand, and its grains are not so fine. The water was clear and not cold. When the sea is calm, it's possible to enter with children and elderly without problems. When it's not, the lifeguards are on duty and guide the swimmers. Many surfers can be seen along its extension. The presence of human dirt on the sand was noted, and with that, we observed dogs and numerous pigeons. This could be solved by the kiosks themselves, passing a rake daily and collecting straws, toothpicks, salt packets, among others, as, even though they provide trash cans for these, some still end up flying. There is a presence of street vendors and can collectors. On Friday morning, someone appeared every 5 minutes. On other days during the week, there were also some, but much fewer. The security impressed us, a calm place.

title: Maresias paradise!
text: Loved Maresias, beautiful and attentive people. Stayed in 2 hotels and enjoyed the beach of Maresias and the Maresias Tour. Thank you, Maresias.

title: Beach
text: Love São Sebastião Maresias, but the last visit was a bit dirty and abandoned in the area near the central small church.

title: Great beach! Very beautiful!
text: White sand, transparent sea! Very beautiful! Great waves for those who like, without major risks, and with lifeguards all along the shore. With children under 5 years, go in the morning when the tide is low, and it's very good for them to play in the water, in the afternoon the tide rises. Repellent is mandatory as soon as you get out of the car; the welcome comes quickly haha.

title: Beautiful beach, rough sea in Jan. 2024
text: Beautiful beach, but the tide was a bit rough (I think it was due to the excess rain days in January). Not very suitable for children. When we sat in the chairs of a kiosk, they charged a minimum consumption fee of 70 reais per person. We didn't accept, as it is abusive, not to mention illegal.

title: Impossible to rest
text: Beautiful beach, but impossible to rest. Everyone wants to listen to their music at maximum volume. Strong waves, not recommended for children.

title: Discomfort of the sound boxes!
text: Wonderful beach. One of the most interesting in the northern coast of São Paulo! Pity that the enforcement is not active regarding the abuse of sound systems. Truly a pity! For those who want to relax on the beach, this is definitely not the place!

title: Don't create expectations.
text: I confess I expected much more from such a popular place. Too disappointing... most beaches are steep, but that's okay, as we already knew... What we didn't find in any comment, and is very important, is that except for the main avenue leading to the beach, the surroundings are horrible... narrow streets, no sidewalks... some even with sewage (a horror), the downtown is ugly and small alternating some nice and some very precarious businesses... of course, beachfront hotels and inns are great, but be careful when choosing places within the neighborhood... in the north coast there are much quieter and beautiful beaches both in terms of nature and service offerings that meet expectations. It's really incomprehensible that it's so talked about and at the same time so precarious.

title: Very bad
text: No sidewalks on the street. Motorcyclists ride very fast and popping wheelies. Nothing special in place...

title: One of the most famous in São Sebastião
text: Beach with a good structure of stalls, vendors, and restaurants, a bit busy, but within what it can handle, worth spending the day...

title: Very tasty
text: We went at the beginning of December and midweek, so it was very peaceful, few people, all very clean and quiet. I recommend!

title: Merchants exploitative and rude
text: The place is beautiful, but totally unprepared to receive tourists. At the beach, to rent a broken umbrella, you have a minimum consumption fee. The rental persons are extremely rude. If you bring your own umbrella, they create problems to serve you. Rude people, no manners, they don't know how to deal with tourists. A place to never look for again. Not even on Google.

title: Queen Beach
text: I saw the name of Maresias since I was a child, spent holidays in a vacation camp in Caraguatatuba and saw signs for Maresias, and the people who went there. The arrival of asphalt in 1989 changed things, and the surfing village became synonymous with glamour in the area, with the most valued properties in the region. The years, decades pass, and it remains different.

title: Maresias
text: Incredible, I'm biased to talk about this beach that ever since I was a child, we stayed at the best hotel in Maresias! My cousin's wedding.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful beach, although very rough sea, not recommended for bathing. It has a great infrastructure.

title: Really nice
text: Beautiful beach. Beautiful sunset. Steep beach. Strong current. Not very suitable for children. Has surfers. Good structure and clean beach.

title: Excellent place to relax
text: Excellent place to rest… Peaceful beach, beautiful, and beautiful sea with clean waters... especially at the beginning of the week.

title: Indescribable sunset
text: Beach with clear waters and strong waves. Watching a stunning sunset at Maresias Beach, to the sound of the strong waves, was undoubtedly a great privilege.

title: Bad
text: The main street that is at the exit of the beach is filthy, with open cesspools. The sidewalk is small and potholed, including part of the sidewalk being invaded by the local commerce, leaving little space for pedestrians to circulate. The impression given is that the city has abandoned the place.

title: Great beach
text: Beautiful beach, great for swimming and lounging on the sand. Safety! Every 100m there is a lifeguard always guiding the swimmers.

title: Best beach in São Paulo
text: Without a doubt, it is the best beach in the entire state of São Paulo, an extremely clean beach with water quality not easily found in SP. The problem is that the city hall should invest more in the infrastructure of the city and the Orla street.

title: Loved the beach!!
text: Clean beach, good stalls, easy access, I liked it a lot. We will return in the near future. That's it...

title: Excellent
text: Certainly an unforgettable part of our trip. Well-structured place, clean beach, wonderful sea with good waves as well. The city itself also helps with interesting options.

title: Ok
text: Clean beach, excellent structure, but prices are very abusive even being in high season. For example, a gallon of water costs 15 reais; the same gallon in Ubatuba I paid 8 reais 2 days ago, kiosks minimum consumption of 70 reais per person, and so on. I came, I saw, I enjoyed, but I won't return.

title: Clean beach with lifeguards
text: Very inviting and safe beach, lifeguards all around, very clean, some kiosks with drinks and food, and several seaside restaurants.

title: Recommend
text: The beach is clean, with white sand and beautiful sea. It's very lively, with kiosks and several shopping options.

title: Beautiful beach with good structure
text: Being honest, the coast of São Paulo is not easy. Before going, check the weather forecast and the tide table. If you like waves, you'll go crazy if they're flat, if you're afraid of waves, the beach can be very agitated and dangerous for the unwary. If it's a holiday, it can be crowded, and all kinds of services in the region overloaded. Not to mention the traffic to go to and from the capital. If you have time, don't go on Friday or come back on Sunday; it's guaranteed to get stuck in traffic. It sounds funny, but it requires more planning than it seems...

title: Clean beach
text: Very clean beach, you can see fish swimming at your feet on days with low tide, very nice to stay there.

title: Maresias
text: Maresias Beach: a very beautiful beach but extremely dangerous due to the waves. Despite the good structure, I found the prices very abusive.

title: Great beach!
text: You can't bathe as the slope is steep, but it's very spacious and very good. The infrastructure is also very nice.

title: Disappointing vacation
text: I scheduled my vacation in Maresias based on YouTube videos made by people who have been here and internet reviews. I regretted it so much! From what they said, I thought it was a "Búzios of São Paulo," big mistake! As soon as we arrived at the Airbnb, the owner said we should walk to the middle of the beach because in the corner where we stayed, bathers got a lot of viruses due to the Maresias River full of sewage flowing there. Beach with no lighting at night, no infrastructure, sand full of seaweed and pigeons. Very strong sea, and worst of all: it RAINED EVERY DAY we were there! But it was not a common rain... it was torrential, and we were literally locked in because there's no Uber in the neighborhood either! São Paulo coast never again!

title: Amazing beach
text: Maresias is a beach hidden by a wall of houses, inns, and hotels, unfortunately, but you can access the beach through some entrances. What pleased me the most was the beach being firm on the bottom avoiding holes. We stayed in the late afternoon, and the sunset is beautiful. I recommend it!!

title: Maresias never disappoints
text: This beach never disappoints. The sand and sea are always clean. I feel some security in the area. And there are options of beach stands to eat.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Beautiful and clean beach!! Very strong sea!! Great for surfers! Great restaurants, but with a high price! Worth knowing.

title: The beach is very beautiful with clean water, but...
text: The beach is very beautiful with clean water, but the absurd amount of pets on the sand surprised me. Despite the municipal law that does not allow it. I saw firefighters passing by and doing nothing, nothing against their feet, however, on the beach...

title: Maresias I love you!
text: I have always been and still am a lover of Maresias for many years, this is the fourth time I visited with my family. I live in the Midwest and consider this one of the most beautiful beaches on the São Paulo coast! Unfortunately, I have some negative points to observe: The municipality insists on not placing enough trash cans, I suggest concrete manholes with a diameter of 60 cm (vandal-proof) in the middle of the way (width of the sand strip), as close to the water as possible, to make it easier for people to dispose of their trash, which will also facilitate cleaning and the municipality's collection after; They should prohibit the use of loud sound, it takes away the relaxing and pleasant environment of just listening to the sea noise and nature, when very crowded it becomes a real Bahian carnival; People from the stalls often consider themselves owners of the sand strip, not allowing tourists who do not consume drinks and others to stay in "their space," I suffered this intimidation in 2020, very unpleasant. There is also a need for removable public toilets, as e...

title: Excellent!
text: Very beautiful beach, with fine sand and good vibe! The water temperature was great, very warm. I recommend staying in the central part of the beach, from point 8 upwards, as the left corner (for those facing the sea) tends to get very crowded.

title: Beautiful beach, streets and sidewalks neglected.
text: The problem in the entire region is the lack of care from the municipality with public walkways. The sidewalks practically do not exist, when there is any pavement, it is broken or too narrow. It is impossible to get around without watching where you step. Those with mobility issues have no way to move. I did not witness or have problems with safety on the streets, even during quieter times.

title: Good for surfing!
text: Maresias Beach is located in the city of São Sebastião. The trendy beach is a haunt for surfers as it has a sea suitable for "catching a wave." Beautiful, surrounded by vegetation, it offers excellent infrastructure, but those looking for tranquility should seek another beach.

title: "Burnt Out" Week
text: Very peaceful beach, exudes a lot of security and familiarity, easy access, great gastronomic structure.

title: Quiet beach
text: Beach with weak waves until noon, after the tide rises, it becomes a surfing beach, it has great stalls with merchandise at affordable prices and with polite and courteous staff.

title: Beach
text: Wonderful beach, beautiful sunset, but the sea is not for children, the sea is very dangerous despite having lifeguards.

title: Delicious beach
text: Super clean beach! Well supplied with lifeguards and other services. Peaceful in terms of visitors. Great for walking.

title: On the brink of decadence
text: I have been a beachgoer for a long time. I have been to Maresias a few times over 25 years. The beach is clean, but it is heading towards the same fate as other destinations. Privatized sand space, "shoe" visitors, people wearing makeup, crowds, abusive prices with no quality at all, people parading by car (many clearly with their parents' cars).. More like Guarujá than São Sebastião. It was nice because I love the beach, but I don't plan on returning anymore... If you like to enjoy the beach, I recommend the tip near the river... but I think it's better to go to another destination if you seek a peaceful beachgoer.…

title: Very Good Beach
text: Very good water quality, beach was crowded, the only downside is the high price they charge for chair rentals, having to end up consuming at the kiosk to avoid it becoming even more expensive.

title: High energy, a feast for the eyes!
text: We spent the end of the year in Caraguatatuba, and one of the options was to visit Maresias Beach in São Sebastião. A distance of a little over 30 km between the 2 cities, with a travel time of around 1 hour, but it was worth it. The beach is very beautiful, excellent structure, with high energy. An excellent trip that was worth it, next time we will choose to stay longer. In addition to the good structure of the kiosks, there are excellent restaurant options. Very good!

title: Did not meet my expectations
text: Steep beach, no chance for those going with children or the elderly. Mostly frequented by the younger crowd. Strong smell of marijuana everywhere. The neighborhood has a precarious structure. I observed a lot of trash on the streets. In my opinion, there are better beaches in São Sebastião.

title: Big waves, crowded and expensive
text: This is not a beach for people looking for a clam place. The water is very rough, great for surfers, I did not feel very safe in the main street, nothing special about this place, this is a famous beach, things here are very expensive, but as I don't surf, this is not the place for me.

title: Peace at last!
text: The beach is clean and quiet. No boom boxes and only a few restaurants with beach service at the far end in town. The modern houses and small hotel have some foliage so you are not as aware that their are low buildings that border the beach. Of the beaches that I have visited during my 20 years of Brazil travel, without driving extra hours from my destination, I enjoy it here with the rolling green mountain vistas and clean soft sand.

title: Super Waves
text: very nice an clean beach. high and breathtaking waves. You can rent a surf board at the beach. Lovely bars to have small food or some beers.

title: One of the most beautiful beaches
text: Amazingly beautiful beach with big waves. Not possible to swim with really small kids but enjoy the surfers and incredible ocean. One of my favorites places in the world.

title: Loved the beach!
text: Really nice beach, soft sand and smaller waves. Restaurants and shops near by. Good place to spend the day!

title: Busy - great food - amaizing waves
text: Probably the busiest beach I have ever been to!  The waves are super strong, and huge, make sure not to go too deep in the water, as you will be without support in a second.  If you stay in the low waters, you will have a great time though.  I appreciated the service on the beach, including a lot of (bar-)food options.

title: nice place
text: Nice beach well served with all you could need as drinks and food. Although some parts of the beach were labelled dangerous for swimming.

title: Nice beach
text: A very nice beach, in a less populated village. When we arrived there were not so many people here either. But when Easter started, it became a lot more people

title: simply the best
text: this beach is great, not so crowded, beautiful beach to walk in peace and enjoy the wonderful scenery, loved it!

title: Horrible!
text: This is the worse hotel that I’ve ever been. Totally overpriced for a poor service, basic and old rooms and really bad food. On top of that management doesn’t care about anything. We have waited more than one hour for some fried shrimps and fries. We asked three times for our food and the waiter rolled his eyes on us. Sad!

title: The hot point beach of Sao Paulo
text: The most talked about beach for the north coast of Sao Paulo. It's not my favourite, but it's the coolest place for the rich and famous.

title: Nice beach, beautiful people at the sand and good waves to surf
text:
This is a place to go and spend the day at the beach and you can have a meal at a fine restaurant close to the road.
There is the place where the world surf champion Gabriel Medina grown up and learned to surf, he has the Institute Gabriel Medina to support the local population and evolve the surf at the region.

title: Had a blast
text:
So on a day off from work this is the beach we visited. I took a hire car and left early. It was so good we went back again on another day off but with more colleagues. 
It was my first experience of a warm sea so I had a great time. The sand can get very hot so take suitable foot wear. If you fancy a go of paddle board then like us lot you will enjoy it here, most of us tried it for the first time and left confident boarders. It's hot this time of year so we preferred it when there is slight cloud cover. 
Restaurants are great and plentiful, a small convenience store is nearby if you need to bulk buy water.

title: Amazing
text: This beach is just amazing! Clean sand, warm water and great waves for surfing! They sell hamburgers and beers on the beach. Comforting with lots of lifeguards.

title: Gorgeous but dangerous
text: Beware of rip tides and strong waves. People drown here all the time.  When pulled into the ocean by a rip time be sure NOT to swim back against the current, but instead to swim paralel to the beach in order to escape from the gripe of the current. This is a wonderful beach but being that it is not flat it is not a good place for walks.  For children I recommend Praia da Baleia or Juquehy.

title: Good for surfing and a perfect Holliday
text: Maresias is a very cozy place. The beach has a green clear water and the sea can vary from rough waves to a very good surfing condition. Sand is white, soft and clean and I also found the beach very good for kids. Two supermarkets and one good grocery serve the city. Lots of restaurants in front of the beach were you can eat a nice meal with sea food, meat or just a pizza. Parking near the beach is not a easy task.

title: One of the best of Sao Sebastiao
text: Beach have 3.5 km of extension. Small waves. Ideal for playing with kids. Lots of food carts around.

title: Days by the beach
text: Great beach to unwind at. Beer service to the beach chairs and plenty of choices to eat. Safe environment and really beautiful beach to play football or go for a walk on.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful and clean beach surrounded by lush mountains.  Nice food options and great beach service. Great for surfing and skateboarding!

title: Standard Brazilian beach. Nice views, nice weather, and nice location.
text: Maresias is known for its beaches and nightlife, so if those are two things you are interested in, it is definitely a place you need to make a stop.

title: Great beach with awesome waves
text: Really beautiful beach in the north coast of são Paulo. Took us 3 hrs drive from sp but is with it. Great white sand clear water and awesome waves.

title: Perfect getaway
text: Maresias is very near Sao Pablo. To get there you can take a bus from Guarullos airport in the Litoralenha stand just outside the airport or rent a car. Remember the roads in Brazil are not aesy to ride because of the morros and thats why it takes 4 hours to get there. The town is quiet during the week and on thursdays you can begin to see the sao pablo citizens getting there for the weekend. This is great because during the week most restaurant and stores close al 8 pm. The beach is huge and beautifull.

title: Nice beach
text: Known as one of the most famous beach in litoral. Not sure honestly... all the entrances are dirty and smelly and the left part is dirty because of the river going diretly to the see. When going to the right side of the beach is less crowded and more natural and beautiful. Who likes the waves its perfect!

title: Fashionable beach
text:
This is a fashionable and very extensive beach, about 30 min by car from the center of São Sebastião. 
As with other beaches in the northern coast of São Paulo State, this has clear green-blue waters and moderate surf. Unlike most other beaches in the area, it also has night life, if that is what you are looking for.

title: The beach of the surfing.
text: Be careful with children. A good place for practice surfing!!! I recommend this place to young people and who likes surfing. The tide is high almost every day for children.

title: Nice!
text: Brazil is one of the best places to enjoy beach life. Fun and exciting adventure, variety of activities and freedom. I would love to explore more shore sides of this country.

title: Beware of Sand fleas
text: The beach was really nice and relaxing but we were bitten by something like a sand flea, the itching has been horrendous for 4 days.

title: Beautiful beach!
text: Small beach town with great seafood restaurants, amazing beach with nice bars. Definitely  coming back!

title: Nice beach, good for surfers and the ones also searching for a nightlife
text:
Nice and clean beach. Water is not so cold and the sand is kept clean.
Plenty lifeguards and warning signs to avoid accidents (especially as the beach often receives families with children).

The city has lots of stores, restaurants, hotels and nightclubs, so finding a place to stay, eat and hangout is not a problem. It is usually visited by younger travelers due to its nightlife (more interesting for young people than other close beaches).

As it is a trending beach among the northern ones in São Paulo, prices are usually higher than other locations and beaches around. But the staying is certainly enjoyable.

It is famous for their surfing contests (as the sea waves are particularly attractive to surfers) and for their nightclub Sirena.

title: Beautiful beach
text: In my opinion one of the best beaches for those who live in São Paulo. Besides being close to SP, the beach is blue clean and the night life is really nice!

title: really nice and clean beach
text: really nice and clean beach - surfer paradise - be careful with kids the waves are quite strong so it is impossible to swim in the sea but to play or refresh your self perfect - nice fine and white sand

title: BEAUTIFUL BEACH
text: Clean & pleasant on the eyes. Great for walking. Surfers paradise, but too rough for casual swimming. Poor mosquito control results in lots of bites--common to beaches in Brazil. Tranquil in the off season.

title: Too busy for my sort of beach time ;)
text: Too busy for my sort of beach time ;) Not quiet or relaxing. Didn't stay for very long since is not my style of beach time. with loads of stores and facilities.

title: Nothing special!
text: Beach full of young married Brazilian couples with young kids. We'd expect a bit more "life". Full of stray dogs leaving their drops on the beach or getting closer to us while eating. Sushi restaurants were amazing though ;)

title: Very nice
text: It's not very long but you can do an 1 h walk. The water is very clean. Lots of surfers. On weekends you will have a full beach. Lots of brazilians trying to sell stuff but they won't keep trying to sell, you just say no and that's it.

title: Nice beach, lots of stuff going on
text: Maresias is a trendy popular beach. I saw lots of surfers in the water.  There are plenty of restaurants and a few little shops.  The hippie fair is also nice.

title: sufers love it!
text: this is the best beach at north shore of São Paulo State where you can find tubes waves for surf and big waves also! Try this!!!

title: Old world meets new.
text: Beautiful little town, with more Pausada, restaurants and shops than locals!! I visited from Monday to Wednesday so missed the crazy Weekends. Found it nice and relaxed, after reading on here to rather skip the weekends if you are after a chilled time out. Great beach with warm water and PLENTY of lifeguards and warning signs. Also good beach service and vendors that offer their services, without annoying you. I will love to come back and be better prepared in Brazilian Portuguese. I travel by bus from Sao Paulo and back and it was effortless and the bus drivers help you if they realize you don't speak the local language. Also bus service dropped me at Airport doors so very easy if you do not speak Portuguese. Great little BIG town with awesome pizza spots and beach bars. My only negative is the litter around town and the lack of refuse bins for public use. Also the beach is littered with napkins and beer cups from beach users that the wind blow away.

title: Awesome Beach
text: I loved that it was empty during the week. The food vendors were polite and cheap. You must watch the sunrise and sunset they were absolutely beautiful.

title: Good place to spend some quiet time
text:
Nice small town, beach is 4km long, good for swimming in some places and surf in others.
There are restaurants on the beach and quiet remote places for families.
In case of looking for a more peaceful beach there are buses every half an hour to other places around.
Hotels in Maresias are cheaper that surrounding villages.

title: Weekend in Maresias
text: Nice beach just one hour and a half away from Sao Paulo. It has also an amazing night life near the beach and in the weekends there's a lot of people emigrating from Sao Paulo and nearby. Just be careful with traffic jam when you return.

title: great place
text:
Great place with beautiful people!

It´s a clean beach, with great food. Good nightclubs and hostages

title: Fine sand
text: This beach has a fine and white sand and a beautiful landscape. There are some restaurants in front of the beach. You can eat and have a drink while looking to the sea.

title: Good beach if you don't have a car
text: Lovely sand, water a little rough for young children. Plenty of places to get chairs and parasols and a number of places to buy food.

title: Trendy
text:
Maresias is the teendiest Beach in the Region. Great for
Surf, not too Good for bathing as it is quite dangerous. Excelent for stroling around, seeing the people and having lunch in one of the Beach front restaurantes.

title: Think daytona beach at spring break
text:
Dirty, not sure of the hype, not a place to go if u want peace and quiet.  We went on a Monday, not too crowded but certainly has the making for a weekend gathering spot. Drinking on the beach is rampant. Be mindful if u seek a family environment. Better off around the cove at TTgrande. Beware of the bugs that bite, all day long!!

Apparently the best view for a sunset experience though! Avoid holiday weekends in this area...... Traffic is ungodly and the locals take the curves of the roads like that are race car drivers.... Its sick and foolish

title: Beachhh!!!
text: Worth to see of course, you are going for the beach... you will also need to learn some portuguese if you go there or going with someone who speaks.

title: Best Beach in the State of São Paulo
text: Beautiful white sanded beach, great surfing spot, cool crowd.... Awesome nightlife (Go to Sirena or Morocco) good restaurants  Personal fav....

title: Nice, but...
text: If you're going up and down the coast of Serra do Mar this isn't anything special.  Loads of big hotels blocking the views and at the end of the day there's plenty more beaches just around the corner - including all those on Ilhabela!

title: beautiful clean beach
text: Fantastic location. Clean white sandy beach. Water is also clean. Nice place to surf. Many good restaurants on the beach. stunning views with mountain back drop. Drive is very scenic.

title: Wonderful beach
text: Great place for surfing but a bit crowded in the best spots. The beach is clean and safe try the door 20 for best surfing spots.

title: Great Beach! Careful of the undercurrents...
text: The beach was very scenic, good restaurants, and huge waves. The waves and undercurrents can be a little daunting. I was caught off guard and had to get dragged back by the lifeguard on his waverunner. Pretty scary. But if you stay near by, you'll be fine, which is what I did the next day. Would definitely come back.

title: Great beach and restaurants
text: Maresias is definitely a surfers resort but it looks like it is moving upmarket as some developments were taking place whilst we were there - but not much construction noise which was a good thing. The beach is beautiful and there are good waves if you are a surfer. Found it to be more based for the younger traveller and not families but it still caters for all. Locals were helpful and no sellers on the beach which was nice.  Very scenic beach with the mountains in the background and very quiet when we were there but I have seen photos online when surfing competitions are on and it looks good fun.

title: Very nice beach
text: Long beach, white sand, not so crowded, good for surf. You can  buy bear, natural juices or sweet corn from the kiosk, they will not charge you for the use of umbrellas or chairs.

title: Limited Services
text:
Beautiful beach... beautiful rain forest... beautiful and young people all around...

But as usual in Brazil, services are limited. Although it is one of the most famous beaches at the richest state in Brazil, Sao Paulo, it lacks infrastructure.

title: Good times
text: Maresias is a great beach for hanging out, surfing, and playing volleyball or futvolley (BR volleyball played with your feet). On a Sunday, if you wake up early (before 10 AM), you will have the beach to yourself. Most people go out partying on Saturday evening, so Sunday mornings are hangover time for most

title: paradise
text: only polite people, no garbage, no animals, greenish sea, so clean that there are tiny fish, ideal for surf, but when flat it´s like a transparent swimming pool. unfortunately some hotels try to "own" the sand, so go early! rich people circulates there, and the beach has an helicopter point for those ones. Eating there is very expensive, so try "Monduba restaurant" near the hostel. After the beach you can go for a walk in the beautiful avenue full of mansions.

title: Used to be a charming place
text: Too many houses on the beach, most of them closing the access to the beach. Beach is very crowded during the day and the same crowd fills the streets and restaurants from the village. Go if you are young and want to see a lot of people.

title: Home to the Annual Margaret River Surf Classic. Great viewing area.
text:
The Point has a good parking area, good change room facilities and landscaped viewing areas and lookouts where you get a great view of the beach and, of course, any surfing going on.

The Surf Classic has been held at this site since 1978. There are three different areas Main Break, Surfside and The Box.

I would not swim here though when there is a great beach at Gnarabup a short distance away.

title: Easy access
text: Beautiful beach with plenty of facilities and ample parking. Popular spot for sunset. Nearby Sea Garden restaurant worth a visit but it closes in the afternoon.

title: Best location to watch the wave
text: Went to this view point so many times during our stay in Margaret River. The view is awesome and there are many parking lots to just park and enjoy some lunch or even a drink. Its great to walk around as well and even head down to the beach.

title: Great view opf the Surf and Whale Watching
text: We were just at Surfers Point a couple of weeks ago.Luckily the sun was shinning and we had a great view of the ocean and were lucky enough to catch a glimpse of some whales in the distance.Lots of people there surfing(does anyone work midweek?) and the car park was quite full.We have been there before on a weekend and there is a coffee van there that makes a great cuppa.Probably the best part of the beach at Prevelly

title: Great Amenities for Surfers & Visitors
text: The overcast conditions, rain and winds were a bit of a damper. If I was to select a favourite beach area, this would probably be it although unlikely to ever get me on a beach nowadays. Great improvements over the years with grassed areas, walking tracks, parking and allied amenities to cater for surfers and visitors. A few brave, or foolhardy, surfers on the beach, boards in hand and contemplating the swells. Didn't see any of them venture into the water while we were there.

title: Awesome views, great spot.
text: Absolutely loved our time here, beautiful views, lots of surfers and even some seals. Love grassed areas to sit, clean toilets and lots of parking. Unfortunately a bit to cloudy for a good sunset but I bet it’s spectacular.

title: Surf
text:
We visited this beach area on a windy day but apparently that's how it always is.  It's very well organised with very good car parking, toilets and boardwalk and viewing areas for those who want to enjoy watching the surfers, sailboarders and the like.  Great to be able to avoid sand!

When we were there we saw sailboarders and kite surfers.  All very experienced judging by their skill levels.  The sea was certainly making them work.

Worth a visit.

title: Always windy always beautiful
text: Todays trip was our second time in 2 years at this location. Always fresh breeze and stunning beaches. Finally we got a time to catch up on some suntan. Chillax at its best

title: Absolute must see when at Margaret river region
text: We are not surfers but we always enjoy visiting prevelley surfers point every time we are in the area . About 10 minutes drive from Margaret river township , it has stunning views of the ocean . Its very well set up for families with barbecues, benches and stairs all the way to the beach . Dog friendly beach. Toilets and showers too. Great place to catch the sunset and go for long walks .

title: Stunning beach view with strong waves
text: Stunning beach view with strong waves. I was so amazed to see such a beautiful beach that is used for surfing competitions in Australia. I came in march 2020, thus the weather is a bit weird with little rains, cold strong wind, and most of time sunshine. But the view is simply breathtaking, nothing in my experience comes close to this.

title: Quintessential Beach Experience
text:
Home to Margaret River Pro competition and the international surfing circuit this beach has you covered. From parking to walking trails and from pavilions with picnic tables to grassy lawns, there’s room to enjoy a sunset, launch your board, or be a bystander. Popular among locals and visiting tourists this beach is on the top ten for Margaret River. 

Beware the Surfers Pro is a media circus.

title: Great place to chill and relax.
text: Nice cooling breeze on the beach. A great place to watch the surfers and wind surfers. Clean toilets at the car park, plus grassed areas to sit on if you don’t want to go on the beach.

title: A must do in Margaret River area
text: Fantastic view.  Lovely lawn. Great for the active or less active. Beautiful walk paths to River Mouth.

title: Margarets
text: Mate, if u want to watch the surfers in the morning, or kite surfers, and sailboarding in the arvo, this is it in Margaret River. Without to much ado, this is the el primo spot for surfing and surf watching. Enjoy

title: Sunset and surf watching
text: Nice place to enjoy the beautiful sunset and watch the experienced surfers in action. Probably wouldn’t bother with the heavily battered fish n chips from the on site van though.

title: Great at sunrise
text: Western Australian beaches are famed for the sunset over the ocean, however an early morning trip to watch the sunrise here showed a serene and alternative view of this picturesque location. A must see if in the region and worth exploring the rocks next to the point

title: Amazing views
text:
Amazing views from the place overlooking the ocean. 
Ample parking and also has viewing deck and steps even to go down to the beach.
Also an amazing cafe right on the beach which is another highlight

title: Wow
text: Visited on Tuesday 26th November. Wow what a great beach for the surfers and all those who what a great view of the coastline here. Plenty of parking spots and so close to Margaret River as well.

title: At The Mouth Of Margaret River
text: Located adjacent to the mouth of the Margaret River this is a pretty and interesting rocky beach and surfing point  with great scenery on a rugged coastline. The park and amenities are well set up and this is a nice part of the coast which is generally very beautiful.

title: Great views
text: Visiting vineyards and stopped to check out town and catch quick lunch. The place is easy to find and the views are amazing. We did need to spend a lot of time.  Surfing not active that day.  One of the many outstanding vistas around the area.

title: A mecca for surfers
text: The community / council has done a really good job developing a wide cement walkway along the foreshore dotted with steel sculptures and information panels adding interest. A true surfer has to at least stop and have a look; nice spot for a walk; plenty of joggers and walkers taking advantage of the pathway.

title: Beautiful
text: Another beautiful beach where the surfers all go. Beautiful sand and the sea very clear with little pools where you can go for a swim .Walked all along the beach to the mouth of the river.Then walked back and sat whatching the sea and the surfers lovely way to pass some time you will feel very chilled following a visit here

title: Easy to lose time
text: I just love this beach for the interesting bay, white sand, exciting ocean and surfing and rugged landscape. A great place to chill on the beach or watch the ocean from the boardwalk and picnic on the grass it even has a bbq. Amazing sunsets too. We stayed until everyone was gone, so relaxing.

title: Beautiful beaches scenery and wild flowers
text:
Went to Surfers Point which is very scenic and obviously a surfers hot spot. The pod of Dolphins we saw too abviously love surfing there too! 
You can spend hours watching the breakers etc and its every changing.
Going in October is Western Australias Spring so the flowers were out and looked amazing

title: So beautiful
text:
Good spot to catch the sunset, as long as there was no cloud cover. 
It’s very windy and chilly too. So make sure you rug up. Parking is very convenient
I am certain it would make an excellent picnic spot, again as long as you rug up and keep warm 
One could watch waves coming in for hours

title: Views
text: This is a great spot to see some awesome waves and maybe catch a hardy surfer or two trying their luck.

title: Great vantage spot to watch the surf
text:
We went there mid afternoon and a reasonable wave was breaking. Some skilled surfers were out putting on a show. 
The car park and viewing area is well maintained and there were were some reasonably detailed displays providing some information on the history and  surfing locations. I’d like to see these better maintained as they getting s little rust stained but overall I got a good impression of an iconic Australian surfing location.

title: Lovely views
text: We always drive out here to watch the surfers. This particular afternoon the surf was not great but the view from the car park was wonderful, with the beautiful blue sky reflected in the water. The car park is well maintained and nicely landscaped, with board walks protecting the dunes.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Gorgeous beach. Full of families, surfers & couples. Would definitely recommend a visit to the area. Amazing scenery

title: Beatiful Scenery @ Surfers Point
text: Very beautiful scenery at Surfers Point.  Stunning coastline with huge waves.  Stood there for a long while to just starring at the sea and the skyline.  I enjoyed every minutes there.

title: Spectacular beach, giant waves, surfing culture
text: Surfers Point is a highlight of the Margaret River region. The coastline is magnificent. Amazing to watch the huge waves (often over 6 metres high), rolling across the sea from South Africa to this point. And mesmerising to gape at the surfers catching those huge waves. Enjoyed the 10 min walk along the path from the main car park to the point where Margaret River empties into the sea. Boardwalks and lookouts in both places. Beautiful sunset- watched with plenty of local surfers commenting on the skill of those still out there catching the last waves of the day!

title: Amazing
text: Great views. Watched a few surfers for about an hour mid to late afternoon. Drove a few minutes to the mouth of Margaret River. Also amazing. Go at sunset.

title: Wild seas and mad surfers
text: Exciting views of surfers sweeping in on huge waves.  this serious surfing country with names of completion winners on plaques along the pathways. Fascinating to watch the action and a great place for a stroll. Worth the detour.

title: Great place to unwind and relax
text: Awesome place to see sunset and just relax. It isnt too crowded. The beach is also nice and calm on most days. Surely visit if you are in margaret river region!

title: Road trip with girlfriends
text: A great day out from our Dragonfly Escape Air BnB at Bramley we travelled by car to see the cute town of Cowaramup, then a 3.5k walk from Naturaliste to Sugarloaf bay, next Surfers Point and finally Boranup Forest.

title: Good stop
text: What a fun place to stop to watch the waves and surfers.  You can get out and walk the paths or watch the surfers and or/kite surfers.   Beautiful!

title: Windy !
text: Great at sunset!  Very windy so take a jacket. Awesome coastal views and fun to watch the wind surfers!

title: Parachute surfers
text:
We had a good time admiring the skills of the parachute surfers. Strong wind and blinding sun.

We also saw one surfer gearing up, and another gearing down. It was very interesting for us.

A pair of binoculars is useful.

title: One of Australia’s iconic surf beaches
text: This is a must see if you are in Margaret River. Generations of surfers have honed their skills here. And the scenery is beautiful. Just walking on the river mouth beach and watching the kite surfers as the sun sets is fantastic

title: Beautiful spot to watch sunset
text: Surfer's Point is worth a visit. It has great views of the ocean and it's a good place to watch the surfers tackle the huge waves. The carpark is a good size and it's was busy when we were there.  There's good access to the beach below with modern stairs and a seated/viewing area is also provided. It's great for photographs. Will return.

title: Spectacular sunsets, with informative walking trails of indigenous culture and beliefs
text:
My photos really do not do justice to the magnificience of this landscape and sunset. You should go and enjoy the experience for yourself. 

It being September, I'd advice you to wrap up warmly because when the cold wind blows ...  we did enjoy a bracing stroll along the boardwalk though.  There were lots of murals to surfers past, super educational plaques about the natives six seasons, sculptures and poems etc.  I thought it was very well setup. 

Another reviewer here said s/he found this place spiritual, and I concur.

title: Beautiful beach
text: All I can say is wow went for a drive here and the surf was amazing (I don’t surf) would recommend any traveller to take the trip even though it was raining I still got some great pics

title: Great lookout and picnic spot
text: Great spot ro checkout the coastline, the surf and a grassed area for having a picnic.  During Summer months most nights there is a food truck.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Just spectacular. Great pathes for walking the dogs. Clean facilities and well maintained decking. Spectacular for sunsets

title: Unbelievable views
text: Visited here for the surfing championship in April but this was cancelled due to reported Shark attacks a couple of days before. ( beached whales). The views and area are fantastic and need to be seen if visiting Margaret's River W.A. Fantastic time spent here and my wife and I will definitely return.

title: Impressive views
text: Lovely to watch the surfers & kite surfers working hard below us, we had the vantage point on the newly restored boardwalk / headland & could sea for miles.  As with everywhere along this stretch of coast, it's breezy but that adds to awesome nature of the place

title: Best lookout to watch the surfers
text: Drive up the hill to the top of the road and park up, it's the best spot to stand and watch some fantastic surfers do their thing. Amazing view of the whole coast and it also has access down to the beach.

title: Great Scenery
text: I'm too old to be a surfer but I can recognise the attraction of this location and enjoy watching the surfers and kite boarders. The beach area has been totally renewed since our last visit, and there is little evidence of the destruction wrought by the bushfires.  It is regarded as the number one surfing location in Margaret River, the waves are great, easily accessible and reliable. Large carparks and tiered grassy areas make this a wonderful place to visit and view the scenery, the waves and the dunes curving around the sandy beach area. Great facilities to enjoy and then a short stroll or drive to the Rivermouth.

title: cool view
text: It was December, too cold to dive in. However, the view from the cliff was spectacular. I'd like to visit here again when it's hot.

title: Fantastic
text:
This is a really well set up viewing spot.  It would be heaven out you were a surfer. 

I would recommend a stroll on the boardwalk and some time watching the surfers. Not sure it would be good for a swim!

Plenty of parking.

title: Beautiful view
text: Similar to the Great Ocean Road in Melbourne, Surfers Point in Margaret River Perth has a beautiful view, blue skies and golden beaches, littered with small pockets of surfers along the beach.

title: Spiritual place
text: I went at dusk/sunset and was struck by the electric energy of the beach, it felt like a special place where spirits come home.  Surfers Point is a world class break (surf comps are held here) and there are gobsmacking views out to the water over the cliffs with boardwalks and plenty of great vantage points. Surfers Point is at the Northern the end of Gnarabup Beach and if you follow the road along a short way south you come to an old jetty with a pleasant coastal walking track right beside beachside cafe (White Elephant cafe) well worth a look. Surfers Point was a wonderful surprise and I recommend you come here, listen to the waves at dusk and let the seabreeze feed your soul. And to think people only come to Margaret River for the wineries!?

title: Great views
text: This place is great to visit. Many go for the sunset, but if you are lucky in the day time you will also see kite surfing and sail boards out. You can also go a little further to swim at a nice beach or in the Margaret river.

title: Super to watch surfers etc
text: A wide beach with currents which are good for surfers.  Grassed area to sit & watch the sunset.  Seats at top of wooden steps, useful for picnic lunch.

title: Stunning views and sunset!
text: Amazing vistas of the sea, surf and beach. Drive along the road, park the car. Have a picnic and watch the sunset. Wind can be chilly, so wear a jacket, even in summer.

title: Nice views and access to the beach
text: Probably the most famous place for surfers or beach lovers. A must see. Magnificent views, you can walk around, barbecues, toilets and showers.

title: Great spot
text: The local council have put in some great roads amenities and parking facilities.   Not enough parking at the Margaret River entrance car park though on a weekend.

title: First Time Travellers To WA
text: Can get windy but excellent views & sunsets.  Good for a romantic wine, cheese & bikkies - others enjoyed the fish.

title: Amazing view
text: After the cave and wineries, Surfer point and River Mouth is perfect ending to a great day. The weather is rough so the swell was big and very cold. However it is very scenic. Amazing place

title: Great End to the Day
text: If you want to wind down and watch a famous West Australian sunset come here with some snacks and local wine and enjoy surfers point. Ive travelled the globe and this place is one of my faves

title: Just Brilliant
text:
This is a must visit when you are touring around the Margaret River Area. What awesome views over the coastline and when we were there the ocean swell was rolling in the we were lucky enough to watch some very skilful kite surfers. I had a fabulous time photographing these guys while they were having a ball.
Surfers Point is really nicely set up with great amenities, huge parking area, nice information boards highlighting surfing history of the point.
Definitely worth a visit if you are a surfer or not.

title: Amazing view - do not miss this!
text:
Drive down to Surfers Point. There is a big car park, toilet facilities and a BBQ. You get a beautiful view of the waves rolling in, surfers if you are lucky and can see all the way down the coast.

A perfect place to sit and watch the sun set (it is elevated).

title: Awesome view
text: The place was just awesome to sit back and enjoy the sunset. There was nice grass patches to sit back... Pathways to walk along to enjoy the breeze and waves and always in amaze how the surfers can surf in such cold windy weather! Beautiful place to visit!

title: Great views
text:
This is a great location to watch the sea and surfers or even have a picnic. The beaches are good and there are some good walks. the parking can ge busy at the end of the day as people come to watch  the sunset.
Theere is a mobile fish and chip food truck so you can get food and watch the sunset if you haven't got a picnic.
Great spot to spend the end of the day.

title: Surfers Paradise
text: Good for surfing fishing swimming toilets handy.Great sea views of the sea crashing over the rocks and sunbathing.

title: Amazing surf comp
text: The views to watch the surfers was amazing. The extra lengths they went to for the surf competition was great. Seating and food and beverage.

title: Awesome picnic spot by the beach
text:
We arrived after an event so it was calm and less crowded. 
It was a scenic drive going to the location. We passed by a few vineyards and specialty local stores and when we finally arrived, there were enough parking spots nearby, saving us from walking too long under the scorching mid-day sun.
We set up our small sun shade tent on a quiet spot by the shore and had a little picnic. 
We watched the giant waves and had the best view of talented surfers. 
There were a few birds around but not enough to disturb our relaxing picnic lunch. 
We'll definitely come back for the sunset experience people rave about on Surfer's Point!

title: The perfect location for amazing sunsets ...
text:
A stunning place to watch the sunset - best on an evening when there are a few clouds - with a relaxed vibe as people gather on the area overlooking the beach. Don't miss the statue of the surfer at the entrance to the car park.

Easily walked from Prevelly and only a short distance by car from the town of Margaret River. However, for those with mobility issues, there are quite a few steps down to the beach itself, though there are some relatively sheltered benches where you can sit on the way.

I am not a surfer but I love the atmosphere!

title: Amazing
text: Visited this location when the sea was high. We don't surf but it was wonderful to visit and view the amazing surf.

title: An iconic surfing area for the experienced surfer
text: This point has become quite famous for the large waves that build up off the point. The local council has developed the area with lookouts, paths, toilets, carparks and landscaping. The beach is accessible but has sharp limestone rocks.

title: Amazing location
text: This must be one of the most beautiful beaches in Australia. We enjoyed every bit of our visit. A must when you come to Margaret River.

title: My kind of lifestyle!
text:
Best place in Western Australia to view lots of water activities, all happening at once. Wind surfing, kite surfing and body surfing. 

Pack a picnic basket, grab a blanket and settle down whilst enjoying some local wine and taking in the spectacular diversity of this absolutely fantastic little spot.  

Wonderfull welcoming vibe! Oh!! and don't forget to mingle with the locals, they have lots to tell.

title: Magnificent ocean, sunset and surfer point
text: Surfers Point is the best place to gaze at the ocean whilst watching the surfers catch a wave. Its a great spot to view the sunset, enjoying a wine or beer and settling down your afternoon. Though make sure to come early, as parking can get filled up really quickly. Its the ideal place to meet the locals.

title: THE POINT!!!!!!!
text:
If you're an ocean-loving-wave-hunting-wind-inspired appreciator of Mother Nature in all her majesty, then Surfer's Point is a must for any visitor to the South West.  

A sublimely crafted carpark atop one of Australia's most famous surf breaks, Surfer's Point is a viewing platform from which to absorb 365 different takes on where the Southern Ocean, Indian Ocean and SW corner of Australia collide.  

The panorama, north, south and west, is unprecedented.  The ocean state, always varied and inspiring.  The fact that you can park up here, at no cost, sit out on the lawn and chill and watch world class surfing, windsurfing, kitesurfing and just plain spectacular natural scenery, makes Surfers Point a magnet for all the great energy in this world.  

I'm sure there must be a ley line running through that place. 

Also, the public toilets.  I don't normally comment on such things, but the Surfer's Point public toilets would have to be a contender for the world's most environmentally sensitive designed dunnies.  Someone buy the architect for those ablutions a beer please.  Bravo.

Anyways, as you can see, Surfer's Point. . . . IMO. . . is the place to check out.

title: Great place - even for non-surfers
text:
We came here when searching out a coffee legend, but went away thrilled with what we saw. Neither of us have ever surfed, but it was intriguing to watch - and the beauty of the sea & beaches was quite mesmerising. It was also great to see that good money has been well invested in the layout and facilities in the area, enhancing the natural beauty.
Well worth a visit by all travellers.

title: Great view
text:
My partner and I wanted to see the beaches of Margaret river the view did not disappoint. 
An awesome place for a surfing 
Worth the drive for the view

title: Sunsets, Surf, Food Trucks.  A must visit on a balmy summer evening.
text:
I just love this spot.  Most summer evenings there is at least one food truck so grab a picnic blanket, a bottle of rose and a 6 pack of Colonial Draft (all can be bought from the Prevelly general store, they'll give you a couple of plastic cups for wine if you need it) and head up there to watch the sun go down.  

Take a warm top with you as it can get chilly or windy in the evenings.

title: Perfect spot to watch the sunset
text: Came down the Surfers Point on a warm summers day. Sand and sea were lovely conditions and enjoyed a swim. Also a great spot to watch surfers catch some waves. We decided to stay back and watch the sunset - as did many others! We parked ourselves up on the grassy hill, with a rug and some snacks until the sunset. Beautiful spot to do so as you get a full view of a horizon - Surfers points is not too far from the centre of town and is definitely worth a visit!

title: Beatiful beach
text: Very dangerous if not a good swimmer. Go around end towards river mouth wgere it is flatter to get away from possible rips. Lovely pristine waters. Some parts very steep so that part not the best for kids. Can drive around further thru the town to what appears a safer beach

title: Best Holiday ever
text:
We stayed in Surfers Point, Margaret River, and all I can say is it was one of the best holidays we have ever had! We arrived and we were delighted to see a modern, beautiful holiday home overlooking an amazing view of a beach. We had 2 houses as there were 12 of us and it worked perfectly! We had a coffee machine with unlimited free coffee pods and a pool right across from our accomodation. We had beaches galore and there was never a dull moment. The kitchen had all the appliances you would need and they were all clean! The bedrooms all had a spa and an on-suite. The fold out bed was very comfortable and perfect for sharing. There was a Tv in every room and the sitting room Tv had YouTube and Netflix! Great for night time entertainment. It was great for a big family! There was also a balcony in every house! This house is worth every penny we spent and...
We DEFINITELY recommend you to stay in it!!!!

title: Awesome place from just about every viewpoint
text:
Of all the places i have been to surf in the world this has to be in the top 3 !!
The way it has been looked after and built as a road approach, walkways, car park, facilities, beach, rivermouth, scenery is just fantastic with lots of information, lovely sculptures, plaques etc.
I would just ask that everyone that goes respects the flora, grass and work put into it by also not abusing it or littering - keep it so for everyone !!

title: Breathtaking view
text:
When we were there, the sky was very grey, but the view was still pretty spectacular.

There were many lovely rockpools and a great boardwalk above the beach to make the most of the views. 

Looks like a pretty weird place to surf – get thrown the wrong way and you’d end up straight in a bunch of rocks. 

Lots of very interesting interpretive boards with information about the local surfing history as well as the Aboriginal heritage of the area.

There were heaps of wildflowers around, even at the end of the season.

title: Check it out
text: This is a surfers Mecca which means - many surfers there to watch (surfing and preparing to surf and wrapping up) and incredible breaking waves. A great lookout spot - easy parking, steps down to the beach, dog friendly, clean bathrooms.. But, most of all, tranquil ocean beauty.. Stop by and enjoy it for a few... You won't be sorry!

title: Great spot
text: Great little spot if you're learning to surf as its right near the rivermouth and its sort of enclosed by rocks. Not saying theres no breaks there because there is. There are also toilets and showers and teeny tiny car spaces and they fill up quick! Up the road a bit is a great lookout. Ok for dogs too.

title: Surf Views on Steroids
text: Some people may think that the Margaret River region is all about wine tasting and chilling out. But you have to make the journey to Surfers Point.  Even if you've never strapped on a legrope, paddled out into the lineup,  or botched a late take off and gone over the falls,  you'll appreciate the beautiful scenery,  the well set out park and the buzz in the air as surfers head out and return from Mainbreak. If you have a surfing history,  like me,  then it will also be a spiritual experience,  even if you couldn't fit a board in your carry-on luggage.

title: Another Beautiful Sunset
text:
I am retired and looking to find as many beautiful sunsets as I can. This one is a new addition to the top of my list. 

Getting to this location is easy. The countryside is beautiful. The roads are paved and well taken care of right up to the parking lot. There are clean public restrooms on hand. There were a number of people there watching with us. I am told it is always busy.
