Pokemon Go characters everywhere along with a couple of stops. 

The sea was wonderful for my eyes, my ears, and my emotions. It was cold as the dickens, but, the second evening we were better prepared. 

I recommend this location. You have the option to view the sunset from your car with an unobstructed view, but, of course, I recommend braving the cold [or heat, I am sure it gets hot as hell here in summer] to see this sunset from the grassy area. Oh, you can take the sturdy stairs down to the beach, but, I was too tired from the days touring.

title: great views
text: Haven't been there for donkeys years and was very impressed with the way it has been set out with balconies, steps and paths. Awesome spot for a photo op.

title: Excellent to watch the sunset
text:
It's a short drive from Margaret River town, approximately 8km. A must visit for the sunset.
There is ample parking at Surfers point, and as the name suggests it's for the Surf buffs.
Quite a few wind and kite surfers were out that day. Winds were amazing.
Plenty of small groups were there, most had their dogs with them. Very happy environment.

Would be a shame to miss this.

title: Fantastic sun set
text:
It's very windy and we got the choice to get down our car to snap some photos. And then we literally sit in our car, and appreciate the sun setting down. 

We were here at 6.10pm, 30 mins before the sun set.

title: Dramatic Windy beautiful beach
text:
We were there for the sunset at 6, the setting was dramatic and scenery beautiful. Stairs/steps lead down to the beach and You can see wooden Long chair dedicated to those who lost their life's to their last wave. 

There's plenty history and information, on well designed signalés. You can read that the Macaulay family having won many of the surf completion. Starting with Mike, Dave and current women's winner Laura.  

Ample safe parking with lawns for sitting down to watch surfs and surfers.  Safe for Swimming too.

title: fabulous coast line
text: Boy what fabulous views of the coast with an occasional whale. If you drive a little further north you can see the mouth of the Margaret river. Great place for a dip. The boardies loved the area as the waves were large.

title: Worth a stop even just for viewing
text: Had never been to Prevelly despite multiple trips per year to the region.  Stopped in at the top of Surfers point and it was lovely.  Even though it was a windy rainy day I wish I had spent more time just enjoying the view but had to duck back to the car due to the cold.  I was there in the early morning when hardly anyone was about, best time to go.  There was a coffee van setting up as I left, a hot chocolate might have helped for me to stay longer!

title: lot of money spent on this
text: as what is actually just a car park, then this car park is something special.  It's been designed as a viewing point of all the surfers out there in a the sea.  A great place to sit, relax and watch.

title: spectacular spot
text: Beautiful views of the ocean and fantastic board walks, an amazing and spectacular place to be. Great for the whole family not just the beach goers.

title: WOW stunning views
text: This was the final stop on our road trip to Margaret River and it was such a beautiful sight. We arrived in the late afternoon and the sun was setting.. It really was stunning, took my breath away!

title: Awesome views during winter of the waves
text: Beautiful picture card view.There were a few surfers and the waves were strong and it was just awesome. The blue waters, white waves and sandy golden beaches make you feel at awe of this great surfing region.

title: Strong swells and waves
text: Site of surfing competition - very strong waves and swells. We were there to enjoy the view and sunshine. Water only for skilled swimmers and surfers. Quick drive from Margaret River town.

title: Great place to soak in the strong breeze
text: It's only on our second visit to Margaret River did it sink in that there was a world class surfing beach here. It has a really beautiful landscape and white surf. But there's something about beaches that magnetise and relax you . Must visit if you are here

title: Nice views during winter
text: Strong waves. The view is amazing. Very windy. Hardly anyone surf during winter (spotted 1) as the waves are super strong.

title: Best Surf viewing location in south west
text: the elevated position here at the car park gives you the best position you could imagine for watching the surfers in one of the best breaks around.

title: Could sit here all day
text: An amazing bit of coast. You could sit there all day sunshine or rain. nice grassed areas to watch surfers out in the water. bit of history to read also.

title: Margaret River Pro 2016
text:
Now that the Margaret River Pro has been awarded World Championship Tour status, its long-held reputation as a surfing mecca has been confirmed. The event sees 32 of the top men and 18 of the top women surfers hitting some of the best surfing conditions in the world on one of the most beautiful parts of the Australian coastline. 

We come here every year to meet and watch all the world champ surfers.  Great event and amazing spot.  I am not a surfer but love this spot.  It is absolutely beautiful.  Even if you are just in Yallingup, Dunsborough or Margaret River it is absolutely worth coming down here!!

title: Super seaside
text: Plate for championship surfing. If you are not good enough to surf then it is great fun watching. Lovely coastal views. Houses hidden in the flora. Stunning.

title: Well worth a visit if down that way
text: Magnificent views and walking paths with plenty to see. Prevelly is a nice place to stay for a few days rather than in Margaret River itself. When the surf is up it can get quite busy but normally this area is very quiet and serene.

title: Surfers paradise!
text: Spectacular!  I could sit here all day and watch the surfers.  The view is stunning, the water clear and clean.  The stairs to the beach are well maintained and so are the facilities in the area.  Makes me want to go and get my surf back on!

title: Favourite place on the coast in Prevelly
text:
This is an amazing place to visit, especially if the waves are big, and there are people out on the water.  Fantastic viewpoint for watching surfers, and if the wind comes up, there will be a lot of windsurfers and kitesurfers as well.  The folks who hit the water here are usually very experienced, so you'll see some high class manoeuvres, spins, and flips happening.  Very fun and amazing to watch. There are great views, but you may want to take some binoculars to get even closer to the action.  

It's also a lovely place to watch the sunset.  There's a lovely grassed area, and it's very popular place for people to chill out and relax as the day draws to a close.

Facilities here include a massive parking area, good toilets, and a gas BBQ (under a shelter).

There are stairs going down to the beach, and it's a fun place to explore and look around.  I'd recommend doing the short walk along the beach to the river mouth - you'll see reef, rock pools, and more.

You can also take a short walk from here on a paved path to the nearby River Mouth.  

The main break here at Surfers Point helped make Margaret River famous, so it's definitely a must visit if you're in the area.

title: Beautiful, clear waters
text: Our Airbnb place was just a couple of steps away, the view was memorizing - very windy as well and will definitely return when I come by Marg River again.

title: Watch the surfers
text:
If conditions are right this is a spot to watch the surfers.

It also works for sunset and on wilder days is quite elemental and exposed. In any event, Prevelly has a wild weather beaten feel to it.

There are newish boardwalks, picnic areas and BBQs etc, and steps down to beaches with interesting rock pools etc.

title: Amazing place to watch the surf and sunset
text: You could sit here for hours watching the waves roll in and then the sun set. it does get quite windy up there. But its a very beautiful spot and the locals seem to be very friendly and keen for a chat if approached. There is wild rosemary that grows all around the hills which you can smell in the wind. Even if you don't surf, I recommend checking this place out.

title: Beautiful
text: A wonderful place to watch the sun set , its so beautiful. Windy too with good waves for surfing and kite surfing !

title: Stunning Place, Stunning Architecture
text: What a great example of public architecture. Well done Chris and David! You have transformed a surf magnet into an international venue.

title: Gorgeous
text: Perfect spot to have a sundowner. Sit back and watch the kitesurfers or nip round the corner and catch the groms

title: Beautiful
text: A beautiful place to see the sunset/rise and watch the surfers adn wind surfers. There nice little features and view points about the place.

title: Wow!
text:
Beautiful sunsets! Can get quiet packed up there because of it! Everyone love to bring dinner & or wine down there, watch the surfers, kitesurfers & windsurfers. 

Great toilet facilities day & night! 

The only thing that dissapointed me was when the car park was near full a car parked in the walk way area & another had parked in the disabled car park next to it with no acrod sticker. If they had waited 5 more seconds or looked with they're eyes there we spots available/ becoming available. 

Once again praising Josh&Sarah palmalteers surf school near the rivermouth, Awesome people, lots of knowlege & recommended to all ages & stages! 

Love it! Hope to visit soon!

title: Panoramic
text: If you're into surfing, taking photo's, going for a walk along the beach, this is definitely the spot to do it when you go down south.

title: Magical
text:
Whether you surf or not, this place is magical, and definitely worth a visit. I was mesmerised by the surf riders on the waves. We went back twice just to sit and watch . Stunning views. Nice area to sit on lawn if you wish and steps down to the beach. 
As it was winter we were happy to sit in the car, after picking up coffe from the combined van at the bottom of the hill, and watching the amazing waves and riders.

title: We will miss this place
text: We made our X-Mas Break at Margaret River. We rented a lovely Beach House at Prevelly. We loved to go to this place to watch the surfers fighting against the big waves crushing. Some days we shared the Beach with Seals. It is one of these places on earth I will always think back with a smile on my face....

title: Sunset over the ocean
text: Went to Surfers Point to see the largest waves in 10 years and the surf was impressive. The whole area has been landscaped with boardwalks, viewing platforms and information boards. The best part was sitting above the beach, having a drink and watching the sun set over the ocean....one of those chilled moments in life.

title: Surf at it's best
text: Some of the biggest wave I have seen, plenty taking advantage of the big surf. 20 degrees in June, absolutely glorious day.

title: Beautiful Sunset
text: Prevelly beach is a must see. It was great watching numerous surfers surfing the real high waves! The sunset was absolutely beautiful amidst the roaring waves. It was a wonderful experience.

title: Excellent surfing beach
text: We visited the Prevelly and stated for a few days on our way to Margaret River and was a pleasant stop off point. Craven park and beach are fantastic!

title: watching surfers and one man and his dog in grass area
text: to watch surfing in the horseshoe bay was amazing.the sunsets were breath taking.the sculpture on the grass behind the bay was great,a whole new meaning to one man and his dog.a holiday to remember.

title: Great views of kite surfers
text: Beautiful location, quite windy but well worth the spectacle of surfers including kite. Lovely spot to watch sunsets too

title: Neat place to sit and view surfers
text: We visited this place a couple of times as it had a great view with plenty of action. Plenty of seating to sit and watch the surfers or even go for a swim.

title: sunset kangaroo safari
text: Our family had a great time, in the back of the Bedford truck hunting for roo's, Neil was a great host and had loads of stories to tell and our kids had a ball feeding the beautiful horses and the Billy tea and orange cake where delicious, hope to visit the farm stay when your all set up ☺

title: Relaxed NYE at Surfers Point
text: Nowhere is more suited to soaking in the ambiance of the Margaret River area then lazy upon the grassy banks at Surfers Point with some local cheese and fresh produce with numerous other like minded people. This area is great for families, couples, locals or visitors to the area and allows you to take in the spectacular sight of the waves on display right in front of you or to enjoy the abundance of warm afternoon sunlight coupled with copious amounts of fresh air. Perking is more than ample and there is a definite relaxed vibe where people from all walks of life can mingle and enjoy nature at its best. A definite way to ease into New Years Eve before hitting Settlers Tavern or the MR Hotel or one of the numerous quality eateries that line the main street.

title: Sunset
text: I stayed in Margaret River since 2 months. Surfers point in Prevelly is absolutely my favourite place here around. There's always someone who enjoy the landscape or preparing to surf or take some picture. In particular at the sunset is amazing.

title: Great Views, Big Waves
text:
We had a quick stop here with not enough time to really explore the area. The views were great and the name lived up to expectations with large surfing waves crashing. 

The road from the carpark goes on to where the river meets the sea. Great swimming spot for kids too in the river. 

There is also a great view of the river and the ocean from a high vantage point on the way back towards caves road. There is a small stop off area on the side of the road for this.

title: Bautiful
text: Great spot for a picnic or just to watch the sunset. Grab some wine/beer, takeaway and enjoy :) Definitely worth a visit if you're in Margaret River as it is a short drive away.

title: Awesome
text: Surfers point on prevelly beach was great. There was a lot of parking and easy access to the beach down the stairs. There were picnic areas and many tiers to watch the surfers and kite surfers. Close to the beach is pretty shallow and good for swimming. Farther out looked like there were plenty of waves. And the views were wonderful as well.

title: Upgrades have made great changes to one of the most popular surf beaches in the South West
text: We were last here 2 years ago and the changes are great. We now have changing rooms and a beautiful boardwalk to enjoy a picnic dinner watching sun go down. Though the night we were there a windy, we wrapped up together making it a little more romantic. Great work by the local shire and staff.

title: Place to see so many kangaroos
text: This is a place where we can see so many kangaroos jumping and playing with their family. This is along the drive so a must see place by stopping in between drive.

title: Beautiful area, a favourite of ours
text: This area is just beautiful, a lot of work and money has been put into the area along the coastline, lovely park, walks and of course stunning scenery.  We were staying in Gracetown but went to Prevelly every day for a walk through this lovely area.

title: River meets ocean
text: This is where the Margaret River meets the ocean. It's got huge surfers waves on the beach and in the inside it's quiet and peaceful with people kayaking and trekking

title: Great view and great spot for lunch
text: Definitely recommend a stop to Prevelly Park for anybody in the Margaret River area. Nice lunch spot and easy hiking along the Cape to Cape Trail. Amazing views of the ocean.

title: Great view
text: A superb place where the river meets the sea. With newly made decks which are wheelchair friendly we had a pleasant time watching the sunset.

title: Surfs Up !
text: Lovely spot, amazing views and the water looked very inviting .. a few surfers sunbathing when we visited but the waves looked good !

title: Rivermouth Point- excellent place
text: The end point of Rivermouth road is a place where the ocean and the river meet. It is a nice place beside the surfer point. You may swimming in the shallow river water.

title: Arty Park
text: LOVED the arty mural and sculptures! We took photos and felt inspired, as adults, but also enjoyed watching kids ride their bikes and scooters around.

title: Spectacular and well thought out
text:
We discovered Surfers Point by accident. We dropped in at sunset after a day of sightseeing, and discovered that it's a meeting point for locals at that time. The very ample car park had about 50 vehicles in it in the middle of winter. This was more cars than we'd seen since leaving Sydney.

The headland has been superbly landscaped with steel, rock and wood and has an extraordinary architect-designed facility for public loos, build into the rock. The ambience, view and design of the whole area are exceptional. I'd imagine watching surfing contest here would be incredible. Top marks from me.

title: If you mean Surfers Point - spectacular
text: We visited Surfers Point at sunset, not knowing it is a local ritual. A very beautiful natural location enhanced with thoughtful and stylish facilities - a tribute to the stunning natural environment. We also walked from the river mouth to Gnarabup via Surfers Point by day which was wild.

title: Dont Miss This
text: What a beautiful place to see ...the Greek Orthodox Church with it's amazing history and  what a view of the Indian Ocean !

title: What amazing views...
text: Loved it here. Bought a takeaway coffee from Dome in Margaret River and earlier in the day we bought delicious Italian made biscuits from the market and we brought the coffee and biscuits to Prevelly park and enjoyed the sun set .. the weather was pretty bad at the time which made the views even more spectacular! Spent an hour here!

title: Excellent view and weather
text: We liked it very much... The place is awesome. We were there in the afternoon and enjoyed the sunset over there. There is a park where children can play and you just seat to take tea/ coffee with you.

title: MR Pro
text: Very busy but extremely clean and tidy. well done MR on a very well run 2014 Surf Pro. great range of healthy foods.

title: great rugged natural beauty
text: rugged beauty and great beaches. coffee shop onsite sells great coffee. we visited on a wild and stormy day but the beauty of the place was still there

title: Great Place to watch the surfers
text: I watched large waves bringing in the surfers at Surfers Point for ages. The colour of the sea, a mix of bright turquoises and dark blues, makes it a very pretty destination to spend a few hours standing and staring or wandering the paths.

title: Superb area of the coastline
text: Such a beautiful are. Beaches and cafés very clean. Spectacular views of the Indian Ocean.  Parking free and available.

title: Great coastline
text:
My daughter and I had a great time at the beach, one of the more popular beaches nearer to Margret river. 

A must do...snorkel to the nearest atoll and see school of fishes....wave are pretty strong but still OK for young children to run up and down from sand to water.

No food or water point, do remember to bring your picnic basket and heaps of sunblock!

title: Amazing Coastline
text:
Spectacular coastline between the Margaret River mouth and the White Elephant Cafe (great breakfast).  Includes secluded coves and a heavy reef break that attracts surf addicts from along the coast when it works.

Easy access, perhaps two-minutes west of Caves Road and top spot to photograph late afternoon and into sunset!!

title: Lovely spot for a walk
text:
A lovely beach to visit in Newcastle. It was very choppy the day we visited but it was still spectacular to see the surfers do their thing and see the powerful waves crash to shore.
The bluff near the baths have interesting rocks to look at if you are interested in geology. Observed a few fossils and the rock pool great for kids.

title: Lovely beach
text: A couple of parking spaces in the parking and along the street. Clean beach with a cafe at the edge and also lifeguards and surfers. Perfect to just sit and watch or to wet your feet.

title: Worth a visit
text: What a stunning location - we loved the look out with the faux grass perfect for picnics - parking is more challenging but definitely worth  a visit

title: Not worth it
text: I lived here in 2022. This beach was really horrible. Superficial people, a beach destroyed by a disgusting beach club and a pub across the road full of superficial tossers.

title: Heavy Shore Breaking Waves made it Difficult to Enjoy the Surf
text: We visited this beach every day for a week. The shore break made it dangerous for anyone who was not good swimmer. Relief came from splashing in the wash. The facilities at the beach precinct are vey good, so a reasonably pleasant hour or two could be had here, but not so much in the water.

title: Oar sum
text: Excellent place for a walk and a swim. Was surprised there was so much parking available. Scenic and serene. One of the best parts of Newy

title: Such a beautiful spot
text: Bought lunch from Swell Kiosks and spent a few hours Merewether Beach watching our daughter playing with sand building. Such a beautiful spot.

title: Best beach
text: I love this beach as do my family, beautiful clean beach and friendly locals. Def a must visit attraction and the bathes,

title: Parking is a nightmare!
text: Don’t expect to come down here on a sunny weekend day and expect to park. Took us almost an hour to find a space. And that was just down to luck as we saw someone leaving. But the beach....wow.....it’s incredible.

title: Great beach section
text: Very busy beach area. The facilities were very busy as it was a nice day, but lots of toilets and showers. Still room on the beach. Stunning coastal walk along from Nobbys head

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Visited Merewether Beach recently for the first time & it was lovely.  It is patrolled by life guards.  Parking isn't that great, there is no car park so need to find street parking.  The surf club is amazing with a restaurant and a cafe down on beach level.  Easy to stay for the whole day.

title: Summer Australian Style
text:
Merewether beach is a great example of a typical Australian beach. The water is clean and bracing and it is never really that crowded.

There is also a large ocean pool.

title: Excellent
text: Easy to get a park, and the ocean baths were fantastic. Great for walking, swimming or dining. Scenic place

title: Stunning views and great food
text: Lovely lunch at Merewether Surf House today, prawn pizza and a cocktail in the sunshine. Nothing better!

title: Walk the promenade and enjoy the view
text: There are actually 3 beaches here with one long promenade, Merewether, Bar & Dixon Park beach. Views of the headland are spectacular as you want the promenade. Plenty of places to stop for coffee or brunch as you watch the surfers.

title: One of the beat beaches in Australia!
text: From the beach to the wonderful ocean baths, Merewether Beach is amazing all times of the year. We’ve smashed out fitness goals in winter with that long set of stairs and cold water swims, to cooling off in Summer with a splash in the waves. Great to watch the coal ships go past and we always seem to see at least 2 aircraft. A busy and friendly place that we’d recommended visiting if you’re looking for a beach along the Newcastle coastline.

title: Such a Beautiful Beach and Ocean View
text: A visit to Merewether Beach is must if you are visiting Newcastle - around 2kms away from the CBD it is a lovely beach. Long stretch of beach and an amazing ocean bath and pools. Paved so you can walk on a path or better if you want to walk along the sand or along the water. Great place for families and the ocean baths have lots of spaces suitable for toddlers, little kids, youth and adult. Such a nice atmosphere and lovely cafe with good food selection and coffee. Can sit and enjoy the views all day here.

title: One of the best views on the East Coast
text: This has to be one of the best beaches on the east coast, great views, great surf and great coffee from the Blue Door Kiosk, Coffee with a View!

title: Nice beach for a visit
text: Enjoyed viewing the Baths and the beach was lovely, very crowded so very popular.  We had a lovely day in Newcastle and this beach added to our joy.  Enjoy

title: Beautiful views
text: From Dixon Park to the other side of Merewether beach is  an easy walk with great views and two popular places to buy food and drinks.  Watching the morning sunrise on the waves is breathtaking.

title: Beautiful, clean sandy beach
text: Merewether Beach is awesome.  Well patrolled, clean and great for families as well as surfers.  It's home to some international surfing stars and locals love it too.

title: Wonderful 24hour 7 day swim
text: Merewether Beach wonderful. The baths more wonderful. Access 24 hours a day. Every day during hot days.

title: Lovely
text: This is the best surf beach in Newcastle in my opinion,  free parking, restaurants and change rooms and great surf,  also great for dog walking

title: Group visit
text: Combo of Merewether beach and bar beach are very nice. There’s some rock pools at the northern end. A cafe kiosk on the bar beach end and the mere weather surf house at southern end. Lots of parking (but does fill up) and a skate park across the road in the middle. Lots of families and it’s patrolled.

title: A great place for a swim
text: The Merewether Ocean Baths are a great place to swim.  Yep I am here again. They have an area for laps and a ramp for disability access. Ocean water fills the baths. They are pumped out and cleaned regularly. There is parking, public transport, a nice walking path, places to eat. A good place to visit.

title: Scenic & good for kids
text: Nice sand. There’s a pool spot for kids. Facilities available. Short walk into town for food.pretty beach.

title: gorgeous views at a popular summer beach for swimming
text: Part of a cruise ship shore excursion, this beach is popular with the locals,too. Dramatic backdrops for photo taking. Lovely  for strolling. expect high temperatures in December. Has places to eat, too.

title: Popular beach, great seaside walk too
text: Beautiful patrolled beach with lots of nearby parking. great place to take the family for a fun time. Lots of cafes nearby too.

title: A must do beach
text:
I will keep it simple.. Merewether beach is a MUST DO if you are in Newcastle 

Clean, patrolled, lots to do and see and good food. Go here and make good memories.

title: The Bondi of Newcastle
text: Awesome beach, great boardwalk that goes for miles. Much hype and activity, uphill walk, skating, cycling, dogs, kids, couples - parks and playgrounds.

title: Great place for a swim on a hot day
text: Easy parking nearby, clean beach for swimming, good coffee nearby, a bit of whale watching and general people watching.

title: Stunning beach and rock pools.
text: Had a beautiful evening swim in the rock pools after a long walk on the beach. Some very nice shells on the beach.

title: Great Beach
text: Very popular beach in Newcastle. The beach stretches from Merewether to Bar Beach with Dixon Park Beach in between. Great for walking or running along the beach.  Great location. Close to Merewether Ocean Baths, Cafes and a very popular pub across the road. What more could you ask for.

title: Nice promenade
text: I didn't go into the water as I'd got to Newcastle too late; but my host and I walked up and down the beach, and along the promenade. It's a nice beach for sure at dusk. Not far from the centre of town and its cafes and restaurants.

title: Simply stunning !
text: What more could you ask for than sitting on merewether beach having a fantastic lunch watching the board riders doing their thing in the waves A great safe beach and a amazing beach to walk along .Showers and toilet facilities are available .

title: Beautiful beach, cafes, parking, surfing - awesome
text: On a wonderful stretch of beaches from merewether up to Bar Beach, there is clear / clean water and plenty of parking. Two cafes and a restaurant right on the beach, with good facilities. Known for some good surfing and never crowded (unlike Sydney beaches).

title: Lovely !
text: Beautiful beach, lots of surf lifesaving, great coastal walks and if you add in the Memorial Walk too, you could walk for ages. Baths looked good but we didn't go in.

title: Newcastle Drive 2019
text: We drove along the coastal drive to Mereweather beach, great views of the ocean and rock formations, parking available, the ocean baths were not in use as the council was removing sand and cleaning them.

title: Stunning beach
text: Great food at the Surf club with wonderful views. The enclosed ocean baths are safe and great to swim in.

title: Fantasic beach
text: Spectacular Beach! Perfect waves. Always clean and tidy shore with friendly people enjoying hassle free lifestyle.

title: Quick drive to beach
text: I drove down on Sunday.  The sun was out. There was surf about 3 to 5 foot. Was quite large. Nice breeze and lots of parks in the car park..Good place one of the best beaches in Australia

title: Showing off Newcastle to international visitors
text: Newcastle has the most beautiful beaches in a relaxed country town environment it’s a must see destination for all travellers

title: Merewether Beach
text:
Beautiful beach, great walkway and the baths are a safe place for young kids to swim
One of the nicest beaches in Newcastle

title: Wonderful Beach
text:
Love Mereweather beach one of the best around .
All facilities available including great eating and coffee options very close by so need to worry about getting thirsty or hungry whilst enjoying a day here 
Like most beaches parking can be a bit hard at times but worth a little walk if you cannot find any on the esplanade

title: Iconic surfbeach and headland.
text: Great place to visit. Scenic views, bathing, great restaurant with amazing views suspended over the busy hub of activity on the boardwalk. Easily accessible.

title: One of the most popular..
text: One of if not the most popular beach in Newie! A bit of something for everyone, apart from finding a parking spot on a busy day!!

title: Why travel overseas when Newcastle provides the best beaches
text: Merewether Beach, Bar Beach Nobbys and Newcastle provide so many opportunities to enjoy safe and relaxing experiences . They are unquestionably some of the great beaches of the world and as well provide great food and drink facilities to sit back and enjoy the view . Forget the south of France and instead spend your time in Newcastle... the beaches are free

title: Not really for young kids
text: Beach lols nice but very rough swell and not really suitable for toddlers and young kids. Getting dunked a lot an perhaps good for strong swimmers and surfers but seen better beaches around Australia. Can get good coffees around the place.

title: One of the best beaches in Australia
text: White sand, cliffs in the background, surfers in the water, what else could you ask for on a bright sunny day.

title: Merewether Beach - The best!!!!
text: A great beach, good waves, great walks, the best castle views, watch the dolphins surfing the waves, why would you want to go anywhere else. Check it out for yourself.

title: Nice, clean beach
text: I came here to stretch my legs after a bit of a drive. Not too many people here, plenty of parking around, lovely spot!

title: Great spot
text: Fantastic spot, has a great beach, ocean baths, resturants and pub, walking paths, recommend getting their early to get a park.

title: Excellent beach with beautiful blue water and yellow sand
text: A great beach - definitely a must see - highly recommend a trip here with or without the family! Easy access and okay to park etc.

title: Beach is a life
text: Great beach caters for the whole family. Body surfing board riding, swimming.is a patrolled beach. Food out let great food.

title: Merewether beach.
text: Great swimming beach, patrolled majority of time.  Plenty of parking . Take away food and coffee etc with seating and amenities / toilets Showers change rooms.

title: Mrs
text: We live very close to Merewether beach and it is absolutely beautiful and there are coffee places there so it is so nice to have a coffee and take in the view of the ocean

title: Merewether Beach
text:
Great beach, great swimming, great surf. The cafe has loads options for snacks, coffee is good.
The surf house has great $10 pizza options for the kids.
Great views to just sit a relax.

title: Merewether Beach
text: Visited on Thursday 14th February. This is one of the better beaches in Newcastle with plenty of parking available.

title: Full moon meditation
text: Awesome beach, great place for the free Full Moon Meditation, 100's of people gather and proceed to be mesmerised by the sound of the ocean and guided meditation, such a peaceful place on earth

title: Beautiful Place
text: merewether = good sandy beach , most times really good surf conditions. caters to the body surfers, boardies and adjacent is 2 open pools... 1 for littlies and the main pool for anyone which is flushed by ocean swell and also emptied Mechanically weekly...merewether has a boardwalk cafe which is most adequate...For up market dining you Merewether Surf House close by...then across the road we have the iconic Beaches Hotel.....if this is not enough further along on the same strip of beach you have Dixon Park surf club

title: Beach walk
text: Absolutely love this beach. Lovely easy walk,  lots to see and do. Oven baths to swim in,  rock pools for the kids,  great surfing,  upmarket dining or casual beach cafes on the promenade. Clean water and beach. Watch the whales and dolphins. The home of Surfest. Plenty of parking.

title: Beautiful location!
text: Waves, Beach, Surf & Sand. A lovely beach to cool off all year round. The kiosk  opens early for coffee & a snack, plenty of seats & tables. Very clean eating facilities. You can walk down to the beach or sit near Café & watch the surfers & the waves. Bucketlist!

title: Surfer Beach
text: This is Newcastle’s beach known for great surfing.  A surfing competition called Surfest is held at this beach.  We saw the preparations being done while we walked the boardwalk.

title: Cool off
text: One off the classic beaches to visit has cafes ,restaurant and a beach bathe . Guards on duty change rooms clean and seats to rest. Parking limited

title: Excellent beach like all in the area.
text: Pools are seawater, free but grubby unless recently cleaned (not so often by the look of it). Newcastle Beach baths are better looked after.

title: Enormous and safe fresh saltwater pool, sandy beach, cafe and rough surf.
text: For average swimmers, the fresh saltwater pool is the way to go when the surf is rough. The pool is emptied and cleaned on a regular published schedule.The surf club pavilion has a cafe and restaurant with great food. Early evening is a great time at the pavilion overlooking the blue ocean.

title: Great Beach in the heart of Newcastle
text: Merewether Beach forms part of the Bar Beach, Dixon Park stretch & has a lot of facilities. Cafe's, Ocean Baths and Surf House are all nearby. Great spot to spend a day or an evening!

title: Something for Everyone
text:
Watch pink tipped waves break over the huge ocean baths at sunset. Walk along the beach promenade and watch the surfers. Stop at Merewether Surf House for a $10 pizza and beer, or go upstairs for a bar meal or dine in the restaurant.

The little ones love making sandcastles by the safe kids’ ocean pool, wash off under the outdoor showers and there are tables and chairs ideal for family picnics.

Or join the Icebergs who swim at dawn all year round.

What more could you want?

title: Beautiful beach
text: I can be biased considering local, but I am sure any one visiting this beach will be enchanted. The baths are fabulous. Very clean beach and patrolled. I don't surf but it is great for surfing I am told.

title: Beautiful beach
text: This is just one of Newcastle's beautiful beaches and its also one of the best surfing beaches around.

title: Ocean baths, patrolled beach and great facilities
text: Love the ocean baths and rock pools.  Plenty of seating around the pools and in front of the surf club. Surf beach was patrolled, water clear and beautiful.  Adequate parking but still very busy during peak times.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Merewether Beach is my favourite beach. Beautiful headland and Merewether Ocean Baths is the perfect place to cool off with plenty of shaded areas to sit and take in the spectacular view.

title: Very good beach
text: Clean and well maintained beach. Excellent concrete walking path. Food and drink options also available close by. Can get busy in peak times.

title: Beautiful
text: The beach is great & the baths there are even better for families as the water is calm & shallow. Very relaxing compared to sitting by the beach & having to stand by the waves.

title: Heaven
text: What can you say a piece of paradise in the heart of paradise family friendly has lifeguards what more could you want absolutely stunning Beach

title: gorgeous beach with pools as a 2nd option
text: On the water in a boat Cruise XP Dominic's tour.Great swell 26 Dec 2018. Highly recommended for children and family.

title: Fantastic
text: WOW what a great beach it has surfing and a great place for a swim, it had lifeguards on duty as well. It was very over case and still heaps of people enjoying the beach. 10/10 Would go back.

title: Stunning views
text:
What a Beach... Easily the Best
It has Everything.... Waves, Rockpool,Food,Pavilion,Walkway,Ocean Baths!! ENJOY

title: One of the best we've been too
text:
Wow! What a beach! Great area for everyone. Has the surf, also has rockpools - plus baths, and a kids beach.
Cannot fault it!
Bonus is there's a cafe/restaurant close by (which overlooks the beach). Great for fries for lunch or a popsicle.

title: a lovely coastal experience
text: on a fine day it was great to see this excellent stretch of coast with such a suitable walking path.

title: Went running at Merewether Beach.
text: Very scenic beach. All the coast in the vicinity is stunning. Close to Merewether ocean Baths. Lots of facilities ie toilet, shower, kiosk/cafe. Life saving club and patrolled water.

title: Home front
text: Great spot for a tinnie after a Kong day at work! Beautiful beach for a swim or surf , has an annual surf festival in February

title: Home to world champion surfers
text: Training ground for many of the world surfing champions. This beach has a wonderful coastline, great restaurant/cafes and family friendly.

title: Wonderful long Clean Sandy Surf Beach.
text:
Handy to Newcastle City , WonderfulBeach ; Home of World 

Surfing CHAMPION ,Mark RICHARDS .

long Beach , good for All Family . Surf Club Patrolled Beach.

Hotel and Restaurants and Cafes across road.

Safe Beach, large Car park.  Public amenities ,showers , rooms.

title: Lovely place
text: Beautiful beach and great for a walk. It has a very welcoming vibe. I have friends living in Newcastle and this is the favourite beach to go to.

title: Windy but wonderful
text: Day was recovering from constant rain. Refreshing gale and clearing sky made this a spectacular view, the surf being whipped up, swirling its way to the beach.

title: Weekly walk
text: A lovely walk along the esplanade from Merewether beach to Bar Beach then a good coffee at either the Blue Door or further along at Surf House.

title: Baths, beach and food!
text: Had a drink and some food from the SLSC, amazing! Reasonably priced and tasty . The baths are lovely to swim in and there is even a seperate area for small kiddies. We also walked along the beach collecting shells. Perfect weather and a perfect day!!

title: Perfect place to visit
text: Ideal spot for families, couples and individuals to spend much needed r and r time.  Lots of eateries, both casual and formal. Swim at the beach, wander through the rock pools or swim in the baths.  One of my favourite places.

title: Merewether beach the relaxing hub
text: Not just a beach but an environment where entertainment is what you make of it! From the local pub (Beach Hotel) with its breathtaking views up and down the coast line to the boardwalk cafes and restaurants for your dining requirements. Then we also have the walkways and cycle ways that follow the coastline for a relaxing walk or cycle with the sea breeze to cool you on those long hot summer days, and then why not finish off with a dip in the ocean baths or a surf on the majestic waves off Merewether.

title: Great breakfast with beautiful views.
text: Had a huge and satisfying breakfast while looking out at one of the best beaches in Australia - truly lucky to live here.

title: Best beach in NSW
text: Beautiful beach ,great walk around to the connecting beaches. Childrens pool available. Clean ,safe environment. Walk to the Merewether Surfhouse for coffee or a meal. I spend my summer here!!

title: Great Beach one of the best on the east coast of Australia
text: Frequently swim at Merewether Beach and visit cafes which have a variety of great food wonderful ambience and there is always something to see eg....whale watching

title: Follow on from Memorial Drive
text: Mereweather Beach is such an icon and a must for visitors to see.great in the summer for swimming but equally nice to walk along in the winter

title: Nice Beach
text: This is a nice beach yo visit it has good facilities . The beach is nice to swim In and walk along. A few coffee shops and also baths yo swim in.

title: Surfer's challenge
text: Amazing surf beach. The times that I have been there the waves have been not for the faint hearted. Great place however to watch the surfers catch waves and whales pass by.

title: great views
text: had a nice lunch with friends at the bar that overlooks the beach was a nice sunny day and the view and the water colour was sensational we toped it off by a nice walk along the boardwalk.

title: Lots of water and surf
text: There's often surf, rock-pools, an ocean baths, a carpark, seabirds, whales, dolphins and beach towels. I saw my first dead person here floating face down in the kiddies' pool when i was 10.

title: Best beach in Newcastle
text: This is the best beach in Newcastle - it’s suitable for surfers, swimmers, and people of all ages. It is serviced by a surf club as well so swim between the flags. There are also a number of options to eat at the venues along its foreshore.

title: weekly run
text: great beach for fun and excersise.. Restraunts and pools plus miles of top beach. Parking was easy and mainly close to the beach and services

title: One of the best
text: if you want to visit a beach or go for stroll or eat great food this has it all within walking distance. the scenic walk is great the walkway along the beach is easy and plenty of rest spots to sit and watch the waves or cross the road and watch the action at the skate park. The best is to walk up to the Beach house and have a cold beer and look at all the action and views while enjoying a relaxing drink

title: suburbia meets surf
text: Merewether Beach has something to offer everyone irrespective of age or desire. Merewether Beach is situated at the southern end of an uninterupted stretch of golden sand commencing at Bar Beach and including Dixon Park Beach. All three beaches have surf clubs with licensed premises. To the south of Merewether Beach you will find Merewether Ocean Baths which comprises two pools. The smaller pool is intended for families with toddlers. The larger pool measures 100 x 50 metres. The area off the adjacent rock platform is suitable for the experienced snorkler and the more adventurous and confident swimmer. The baths were recently renovated and the amenities have hot (warm) showers. Merewether Beach (like Bar Beach and Dixon Park Beach) are patrolled by Council Life Guards on weekdays and Surf Life Saving Australia Life Savers on weekends. Swimming conditions can vary significantly depending upon tides and wind direction. Merewether Beach hosts "Surfest" , a international surfing competition, annually and is the home break for seven-times world surfing champion Mark Richards and NRL legend Andrew Johns. There is plenty of parking close to the beach, but very limited parking for the disabled. Surf House located between Merewether Beach and Merewether Ocean Baths has a variety of venues serving alcohol and meals for different budgets. The views are spectacular from any of these venues.

title: Gorgeous part of the World
text: The esplanade is full of activity! Runners, walkers, dogs, strollers-& such a beautiful view! Perfect place to grab a coffee, stroll along the beach or sit and watch the waves roll in

title: Mother’s Day venue
text: This cafe is a special place that my family take me to for my birthday & Mother’s Day every time the view is spectacular and the meals are delicious a favourite for everyone

title: Always Great to see.
text: Great sized Carpark and the traffic has been rerouted to have one way streets that make it more enjoyable.

title: So lovely
text: We had pizza and ice cream on the esplanade on a July evening and it was beautiful. I can't wait to come back and do it again in summer, glorious location.

title: Social, relaxed, area to watch the surfers
text: Stopped here on our way out of town to grab a juice from the cafe and wander along the esplanade to the Merewether Baths. Could have sat here for hours watching the surfers and the passing crowd. Plenty of free parking (4hr limit)

title: Good waves, great sand  and trendy cafes
text: Merewether beach is a great place for families and also experienced surfers.  Good facilities and  several cafes and a restaurant are close by.  It is also the site of Newcastle’s Surfest event.   Free Parking abounds

title: Merewether beach
text: This is the best spot in Newcastle. Great waves if your a keen surfer. Easy parking and access to cafes and pubs and also has the Merewether ocean baths if the seas are rough.

title: Worth visiting!
text: Great beach with a highly accessible walkway and carpark. Very social area.Coffee shops and cafes, family activities, a great concourse for walking, bike riding etc

title: Lovely!
text: My favourite beach in Newcastle. I love running from Merewether beach to Bar Beach surfhouse and back, and then take a dip in the Merewether Baths (which are right next to the beach!). Adequate parking unless it's a particularly busy weekend, and there's some decent food and drink options available.

title: My favorite beach in Newcastle
text: Just near Merewether baths, this beach is not overly crowded and the view is amazing. Parking is available and way less crowded than all of the other beach. The waves might be a bit big for inexperienced swimmers, so to swim I always go to Bar Beach.

title: One of the best beaches on the East Coast of Australia
text: I lived across the road from Merewether Beach for many years and I really love this place. It has everything you can possibly want. Great surf, friendly people, a fantastic cafe that being Surf House with friendly staff, and clean ocean water. I love coming back here whenever I am in Australia.

title: One of the most beautiful beaches :)
text: Beautiful beach, great surf and a perfect place for families.  Lifeguard services, change room facilities, cafe/kiosks available, sheltered picnic areas and amazing restaurants.

title: Merewether Beach must see when in Newcastle
text:
Great beach and great food establishments. Walk from Merewther to Newcastle is great via memorial walkway.

Get there.

title: Wow.  Wonderful Views
text: I don't recall ever being in Merewether in perfect weather until last Saturday.  The water was very clear.  Absolutely stunning.

title: New Baths are brilliant.
text: Growing up in Newcastle I am proud to see the wonderful additions and improvements in t.he area since I was young

title: Breathtaking Beach
text: We are from Bondi and this beach was breathtaking, Great for young families we used the ocean baths and the rockpools it was a beautiful day! We stayed at Rydges it was a 5 minute drive around the coastline

title: Amazing clean beach
text: This beach is beautiful. Clean beach. it is flagged with life guards. Also has near by ocean bars. multiples cafes with coffee and food - cheap $10 pizzas available.

title: The Active Beach
text:
This beach was busy. Some were surfing, others were swimming and others were sunbathing. 

Nearby people could order drinks and watch the activities on the beach.

I liked that beach! The waves were a bit stronger in this part of Newcastle. I like that!

Worthwhile to see!

title: Picture of beauty
text: Absolutely amazing. Very clean. Even if you don't want to go on the beach it is a beautiful walk. Sit swim or just watch.

title: Great beach
text:
What a pleasant surprise! Went for a day trip to Mereweather beach... parking can get a little busy, but we were able to park within a short walking distance.

From the beach with room for kites, surfers on the waves, saltwater bath pools for swimming, rock pools with plenty of sea snails and hermit crabs ... my boys had a great day here! 

Scenic views if you like to walk along the stretch of the coastline. 

Would visit again!

title: Beautiful
text: One of the best views in the area to sit back and enjoy a wine! Strongly recommend visiting the beach after a lovely day wine tasting.

title: Getaway
text:
Lovely aspect overlooking the sea.
Fine cafe with some good breakfast food , always busy as it’s so popular
Have to be early as the parking is difficult

title: Beautiful Beach
text: we visited when the Surfest was taking place. A good buzz to the area. Beautiful beach where our friends regularly swim and surf. A lovely place to walk around and enjoy the views. Very easy to get food as a selection of eateries by the side of the beach

title: Beautiful beach, stunning views!
text: We visited Merewether Beach on our way back to Sydney as we had not been to Newcastle. We were glad we did as we had such a great time strolling along the beach and taking in the view. It has lots of benches and there is a cafe facing the sea. We were there in late morning and there were many people there, jogging or walking their dogs. The parking lots are free and convenient,and the beach is quite similar to Bondi. Highly recommended.

title: Just a beautiful beach
text:
Walk along the beach promenade from Dixon Park Beach to Merewether Beach and you'll see why this beach got voted Australia's No 1 city beach. A beautiful stretch of sand, often great surf, and always a spot to park - for free.
It's a favourite and my wife and I are here nearly every morning walking our 2 dachshunds and having a coffee at Blue Door cafe.

title: Gorgeous baths!
text: I could have stayed in the lovely ocean baths all day long. Covered in beautiful shells and pebbles!

title: Best beach !
text: Bar beach is one of the best beaches in Australia. Blue and clean water with spot for kids to play. Very clean and scenic beach. I would strongly recommend visiting with family or alone if visiting Newcastle

title: Fun, Uncrowded Surf Spot
text: This stretch of beach is very cool. Beautiful blue water, clean beach, and fun waves. The vibe in the water and on the beach was very relaxed and the locals are super friendly and welcoming. My son and I caught some fish surf fishing of the beach. There are really nice spots to eat on the path just above the beach. Great beach. Very similar to my local beach, Huntington Beach, CA.

title: Stunning beach
text: Merewether beach is stunning. Definitely worth the trip to swim in, walk along and just enjoy the scenery!

title: Terrific Little Beach in the Heart of Newcastle
text: Newcastle is spoilt for choice with many beaches dotted along the coast but Merewether Beach is a stand out for me. Parking can be hectic but well worth the hunt - toilet & change facilities are next to the beach & nearby pub & cafes make it an easy choice. Great for all the locals as well as tourists - an eclectic mix of families, joggers & tourists make it popular all around.

title: Lunch with family
text: Great food with reasonable prices and a good variety on menu, friendly staff great view over mrerweather beach front covered outdoor area.

title: Lovely Newcastle beach
text: Great beach, among very many, in Newcastle. Ocean baths, expansive coastline, pathed walkway and a beach cafe. NSW at its finest. Free parking for the organised!

title: Merewether Beach Southern End
text: Great spot for a day at the beach with the family. Nice sheltered area to the South near the Baths which is great for kids. Good break a bit North with consistently good small to medium surf. Surfclub Kiosk right behind if you need lunch and a great coffee also. Parking can be hard to find when busy due to the limited amount directly near the beach. You can park across the road and link to the beach via the road underpass walkway. No surprise that Merewether was voted the best beach in the country. Something a local Novocastrian has known for years.

title: Breakfast on the Beach
text: Great coffee shop here for Breakfast and right on the beach, food and coffee was great. Service great as well. Surf was huge and surfers having a ball.

title: worth a look
text: its a nice beach but the parking situation is kind of crazy and its hard to get in on a weekend that said very pretty worth a look

title: Merewether Beach
text: Voted as Newcastle's Best Beach and offers everything for the beach lover.  Ocean baths, surf, Merewhether Surf House, cafes, parks that are all family friendly.  Rivals Bondi any day.

title: Iconic
text: Take your pick - surf, ocean baths, the Surf Club, the Beaches Hotel, open parklands, lots of golden sand. A great all-round beach, popular for decades.

title: Awesome Position.
text: Close to my mates which is good but there is a club,pub,pizza place all close to the beach. Beach itself is excellent.

title: Nice to enjoy the waves and chill
text: Merewether is a great spot to chill and watch the waves and the paragliding from the headland. Parking is easy and there is a cafe if you would like nibbles...

title: Merewether beach
text:
The beach is closed to popular pubs, restaurants and hotels. 
Ideal for young families. It has good facilities available.

title: Great place
text: really enjoyed our time at Mereweather Beach & Baths, swimming in the salt water baths and then the surf before grabbing some lunch on the beach, wished we could have spent more time

title: Just beautiful
text: Merewether Beach is so beautiful. Handy to restaurants. The coastline is so picturesque. Short distance to the harbour foreshore. $15 in a taxi.

title: Great views at sunrise
text: A short drive or walk down to the beach is worth it. What a view! Popular with surfers and fishers but enjoyed by all.

title: Beautiful beach
text: This beach is clean, and has a kiosk with lots of choices, the staff is helpful and friently, the facilities are very clean

title: summer retreat
text: Beautiful beach located centrally. The amazing free swimming pool is a summer blessing. Just close to many other beaches, this is probably the best of Newcastle. Ideal place for coffee lovers, bystanders and children. Place not to be missed ....visit it for yourself and fill in the blanks .....

title: Busy but not packed
text:
Last time I was here 2 years ago, Merewether Beach was overcrowded.

Surprisingly, not today. It was busy, but not packed like sardines like last time. Not sure if it's the time of day I visited today or if it's just not as packed as it used to be.

The baths are great and the beach is quite clean and spacious - one of the best in Newcastle.

title: Best beach.
text: I lived close to this beach for quite a few years.Their are actually three beaches that form one big beach,they are Bar beach,Cooks hill beach and Merewether.They are well pro trolled beaches and safe for regular and good swimmers.The beach is flat and close proximity to Newcastle city.

title: Top surf
text: In my youth I surfed this south point after southerly storms,really liked the winter groundswells.Home surf of Mark Richards

title: Nice beach but be careful
text: Beautiful beach and very long so it is ideal for long walks. On both sides of the beach there are saltwater pools. Pay attention to the signs as there are dangerous currents and it is always full of Portuguese man o' war jellyfish.

title: Endless views of the ocean
text: Beautiful beach and great sunset views, and if you are lucky you can spot whales during mating season, endless views of the ocean.

title: Beautiful beach, lagoon, walks and rock pool
text: Narrabeen beach has so much to offer. Including exposed rocks during low tide, a lagoon that is located next to the rock pool. Long sandy beach to go on a nice long walk or bi-centennial coastal walk up the coast to Warriewood beach and further.

title: A Mecca for surfers
text:
North Narrabeen has long been renowned for having some of the best, most consistent waves on the East Coast and along the way the area has produced some of Australia's most famous surfers. From the lookout on the point at the northern end of the beach you can see the current crop ply their skills. (Just look for the crowd of onlookers with cameras.)
If you are not a red-hot surfer North Narrabeen still has plenty to offer. There are very good ocean baths also at the north end that attract families and serious lap swimmers. The beach is also very long, extending several kms to Collaroy Beach in the south. Very good for a long beach walk and there are plenty of uncrowded (though also unpatrolled) sections along the way too.

title: Beautiful beach  ‍♂️‍♀️
text:
North Narrabeen beach is nestled bedside Narrabeen lagoon and has a stunning Rockpool and a long sandy beach which is fabulous for surfing . 

Walking around the lagoon is also excellent for all age groups with a dedicated pathway for bicycles and pedestrians. The lagoon also has several beautiful spots for swimming, fishing or canoeing . 

North Narrabeen beach is located on the northern beaches 25km north of the CBD.

title: Lovely Beach
text: Swimming in our oceans with life guards and on North Narrabeen is a gr888t day out at the beach for anyone

title: Perfect place
text: Absolutely beautiful spot. Love the ocean rockpool, which is excellent for recreational or lap swimming. The headland and inlet are fantastic

title: Beautiful Beach for walking or Surfing
text: Fabulous beach, with excellent waves for surfing. Clean and picturesque.  Has a great rock pool for swimming as well, and the lagoon, but this needs to be open to the surf, for optimum water quality.

title: North Narrabeen Surf Life Saving Club. Has a hideaway cafe/restaurant, that is not mentioned in Trip Adviser.
text: With “eat in or alfresco” on the balcony overlooking the surf & sand. My daughters & I had a delicious meal, and great coffee. It is so good we often eat there, . Prices reasonable. Casual dress. So relaxing watching the waves roll in! Hidden gem!

title: Amazing Beach
text: A very nice beach, wasn't busy when we were there but we were told by locals that it does get very busy in Summer. Most public car parking is paid parking and actively monitored by Council.

title: Great beach
text: Maybe I shouldn't tell people as I love this place. Great for taking photos at sunrise or sunset, as you can see both East and West. You can swim in the surf or in the rock pool.

title: breathtaking
text: great beach, was very quiet when I went there, we had a great time. it's a sandy beach with great sunset view

title: Lovely ocean pool
text: North Narrabeen Rockpool: this is an ocean pool on a point so it has a good view on three sides. The path from the car park is flat and not too long. The pool bottom is sandy and it has a nice wooden boardwalk where you can leave your stuff. Would be better at high tide with waves crashing all around.

title: Surfs up
text: Like all the Northern Beaches crashing waves and sand. Make sure you swim between the flags there can be a significant sweep.

title: One of the best beaches in Sydney
text: I grew up around here and love this beach, go there most weekends in Summer for a walk and/or a swim

title: North Narra has everything!
text: A beautiful patrolled beach on the Northern Beaches of Sydney. Glorious rockpool for pottering and looking at the lcoal rock life plus for the kids the opening of the Lagoon comes in from the sea and there is a wonderfully safe and clean Lagoon area to swim. Plenty of Cafes are close by and the North Narrabeen Surf Club has a functioning Bar Friday, Saturday and Sunday afternoon/evenings where you can sit on the balcony overlooking the azure beachfront and enjoy a cold one or two. PARADISE!

title: Great beach
text: Love Nth Narrabeen. Never over the top busy with people and huge beach area. Add to that the lake and pool at the northern end and you can’t ask for more.

title: Great at sunrise & Sunset
text:
Enjoy your time at the beach & then enjoy great coffee & food at the local cafe opposite the beach.

Great for an early walk & dip in the ocean.

title: For Experienced Surfers only
text: Great surf spot.  Swell magnetic.  Orangish sand.  Very localised / heavy crew. Intermediate level wave.  Don't bother surfing here unless you're experienced and an expert.  Others won't get waves. Body boarders sre not made welcome. Surfing royalty are out in the line up most good days

title: Narrabeen - Not a good place to visit
text: An very undeveloped area. Internet is still ADSL1 which is very out-of-dated (even using Telstra network). You will find it hard to surf the internet sometimes. Limited shops and cafe, nothing much to do except the beach. Foods in Narrabeen are terrible. Not recommend unless you grew up from bush.

title: Beautiful beach
text: What a fabulous beach with a lake as well (great for younger children). There is surf patrol too so it is safe if you want to go body surfing (or surfing).

title: Great lunch and very good coffee
text:
Been here a couple of times , sometimes for a coffee ,  or breakfast and others for lunch . 

Very friendly team , fresh ingredients, and again great coffee . Location is also one of the nicest hangouts on North Narrabeen

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text:
A slice of heaven on the northern beaches.
The beach is great for surfing with a right to left break from the point.
the beach can be a bit rough for swimming but the lagoon that can be accessed from the road or the beach is just perfict

title: Great location and beach
text: This place is superb all year long. It is more than just a summer destination, and a lot of walking all over the place. The surf can get hectic sometimes so beware. And enjoy!!

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text: One of the longest beaches in Sydney, North Narrabeen is a great place to visit. The Northern End has cafes, is near the caravan park and has a beach pool. It can get rough at times but the lagoon just behind the dunes is a great place for young families when the water mouth is open to the sea. Remember to always swim between the flags.

title: best place on earth.
text: What more can you say about the best beach on earth. when the lake is open and the sun is out where else would you rather be.

title: Classic Northern Beaches destination
text: Good sea water pool if the sea is too rough or you just want a leisurely swim, but a great beach for surfing or just diving through the waves. Good loo with changing facilities, car park about 150 yds from pool, with small cafe nearby. Life guards on duty with flagged areas most of the time, never seen it too busy.

title: A week in Narrabeen
text:
North Narrabeen  Narabeen is a great beach , can stroll along the sand there is a park and playground at one end and the rock pool and park at the other 
If you are a surfer it looks good , certainly good for a swim but like all the Northern Beaches swim in the flags and ask the locals for advice on where is best to swim
Quite a few cafes close to the beach 
Just a good beach for lots of activities , parking around the area is both metered and free

title: Three in one.
text: Narrabeen beach offers you three places in one. If you have some small children with you, the Narrabeen lagoon or the rock pool is for you. If you’re a surfer or just prefer the ocean, go to the beach. All the three of them are next to each other.

title: great for sunrise photography
text: stunning ocean bath and beautiful long beach to walk along.classic Australian beach with bright sand and curling waves..depending on weather off course. lots of walking to be done.

title: Great spot with cafe. Parking is a hassle
text:
As with all good beaches in Sydney parking is the main hassle. 
Helps if you have a Warringah parking permit so you can park for a couple of hours for free. It is one of the better beaches for finding a parking spot. On a hot day get there before 9/10am to find a spot. 
Life saving club at Narrabeen beach is great for refreshments such as smoothies and coffee or a light bite to eat. 
Well patrolled along the beach. Not as crowded as Manly or Bondi.

title: Lovely beach with many places to explore
text:
Beach had much to offer and less crowded compared to Manly. Parking could be expensive for $8 per hour and $28 for a day. 
Walk along beach to north or south; or dip in the rock pool.

title: Love the rockpool
text: Great spot! The rockpool is a perfect oasis to enjoy a swim. Lights come on around sunset as well so it is delightful into the evening

title: Great most of the year round, the pool gets dirty in peak summer
text: Recently renovated lakeside picnic area  just up from the main car park makes it a great place to have a swim and chill out all day. A good place to take a beach walk from Narrabeen to Collaroy. In summer the ocean pool can get dirty and doesn't flush often enough

title: Wonderful Beach
text: This was my first visit and I was very impressed! Lovely views and golden sand! We visited in the winter and water was warm when we paddled our feet. We spoke to a local surfer and he commented how warm the water was although the temperature out of the water was a lot colder. I'll certainly be back in the summer!

title: Great local beach with a long sea frontage
text:
Right near the Narrabeen lakes entry the beach is nice and long with plenty of room for everyone. 
Top of the beach (Northern End) has the small channel leading to the lakes. This creates a large shallow area for families especially young kids to play safely and enjoy the water without the waves. The beach front has lots of access and good swimming as well as surfing . 
Clean sand, attracts a lot of people while having space for everyone and close by access to shops for takeaway and general groceries to stay happy and entertained on or near the beach.

title: Nice Quiet Beach
text: Northern beaches are quite nice.  This once was not over crowed, peaceful and I enjoyed the lovely views.

title: Great beach
text: Nice beach - I especially enjoyed the rock pools to the north end. Beware of the inlet - it was roaring along.

title: Great beach
text: This is one of the traditional beaches of Australia. BE WARNED, Rips are frequent on this beach so be careful and always, always swim between the flags

title: A beach for everybody
text:
The beach is beautiful and ideal for surfing and to the north the small, tidal creek is an ideal, safe area for children to play. It is the connection between the Narrabeen Lakes and the ocean and at low tide the water flows seawards leaving little islands which at high tide are covered in water.
Also to the north there are two tidal swimming pools, both of them quite shallow but ideal for safe swimming. There are also showers and public toilets. There is also a walkway, up stairs on the Coastal path from which there are great views down the coast to Long Reef.

title: Legendary surfing beach
text: Location of the best and most consistent surfing beaches in Sydney if not nsw, given a mention in Beach Boys classic Surfin USA . Patrolled beach , parking a problem on sunny days , ok for kids with an adult

title: Great beach for surfing or swimming
text: Known locally as an excellent surfing beach, North Narrabeen beach is also a great place for families as the beach is patrolled and there is a large ocean swimming pool with dedicated swimmers lanes as well as a pool ranging from shallow to deeper to suit all ages and abilities. The are also toilets, showers and a cafe to hand. Parking is limited but there is street parking in the area.  Feel like some exercise? You can walk up Narrabeen Headland to Turimetta, Warriewood or Mona Vale Headlands - all the way up the coast to Palm Beach for the serious trekkers. Great for an hour or spend the day

title: Lovely beach
text: Visited here on saturday 12th November. It was a bit rough due to the surf but lovely beach, also near lagoon where we were and also had ocean baths. Beautiful.

title: Fantastic Location
text: Beautiful beach, very quiet with cracking waves for surfing.  So good it was mentioned in the Beach Boys Surfin' USA song.  There's a great swimming pool at the end of the beach near to the brilliant surf club.  The Hit Cafe inside serves tremendous food.  Don't bother going anywhere else.  It's tremendous value for money and the quality is great.  The staff are very polite and helpful.  It really added to our time at the beach.  The kids loved their time on the beach and the surf club, happy kids means happy parents!

title: " relaxing day out at the beach"
text: North Narrabeen is our most favourite place to visit. We have been going there for many years with our children as they were growing up and now they visit with their families. Narrabeen is such a relaxing place for the whole family with lots to do. The rock pool is quite popular but I really enjoy a walk along the uncrowded beach.

title: Just gorgeous
text: Where else can you walk along a beach and be able to enjoy a good degree of solitude and only half an hour from the centre of Sydney.  During the week from North Narrabeen to Collaroy I'm lucky to bump into a couple of people - on the weekends in warmer weather it can be a different story.  At the North Narrabeen end, there's two rock pools, the lagoon and the surf to choose from for a swim.  If you feel more energetic you can walk up the stairs then through the bush to Turrimetta Beach or if you feel lazy and hungry, there's a café on the surf club roof with great coffee and by the looks of it - pretty good food!

title: great uncrowded beach
text: North Narrabeen Beach is great for surfers and anybody just looking for an uncrowded beach to lounge on or swim in,theres a great sea pool to swim in at the northern end of the beach and a beach club and facilities near by.  The lake entrance is a good place for kids to spash around in a safely.

title: Another beautiful northern beach
text:
North Narrabeen Beach is another example of a beautiful Sydney northern beach.
Plenty to do, simply walk the beach, surf or enjoy the rock pool.

title: Great clubhouse
text: Great family beach, the clubhouse Friday night is good fun as well. The lake empties into the sea at the northern end and means good fishing and great wave catching for kids when tide running in, totally safe.

title: Morning walk
text: Great walk from the nearby caravan park. There are two swimming pools, that are used a lot by the locals. God walk alone the beach, and watch the surfers.

title: At the end of the Lagoon
text: Another of the beautiful Northern Beaches. This beach is bounded on the north by the headland and also the inlet of the Narrabeen lakes. From there it stretches south down towards Colloroy.

title: Loved this beach
text: Sydney, your beaches rock! This was such beautiful place to swim and body surf. It was great when the tide went out for the kids but beware of the rips and currents if you are not swimming in the flags. The ocean pools are so lovely and the rock pools around it kept the kids entertained for hours.

title: Great Walk
text:
I walked from the Sands Hotel to North Narrabeen, great exercise regime. Such a beautiful location, quiet and relaxing.
make sure your have your bathers. hat, water and sunscreen.
Great for walkers of any experience.

title: love
text: Narrabeen beach is really nice for swimming and surfing and its just a generally lovely place I love it

title: The beach is amazing and so clean and relaxing.
text: We have been to quite a few beaches in the world and this one is one of the nicest. It was groomed and clean and not crowded at all. Simply beautiful.

title: Awesome Aussie Beach
text:
Walking from North Narrabeen to Collary is just Heavan. The Narrabeen beaches are awesome Aussie surfbeach and a must for every travler to experience.  Come on a warm sunny day and the ocean sound and cleanliness of the water will be an experience you wont forget. Feels like paradise yet so close to Sydney
Better than Bondi or Manly beaches although don't expect a lot of choices for cafes or eateries.
Its the beach your coming for!

title: Better then Bondi
text:
First time to this beautiful beach with friends who live local.Plenty of parking & space on the beach.
Everyone was just enjoying themselves on the first day of 2016.
I definitely will  be going again.

title: One of the best surfing beaches in Sydney
text:
Situated on the Northern Beaches of Sydney, North Narrabeen sits at the entrance of the Narrabeen Lake, a tidal lake which is generally opened to the sea.
The area offers parks, playgrounds, cafe's and restaurants all in close proximity.

The Surf Life Saving Club has a café and bar and you can sit out on the deck and enjoy coffee or a beer.
The Big 4 Caravan park is close by offering cabins and campsite - very popular throughout summer as it fronts the lake.

title: Scenic but also a top surfing competition beach
text: I've lived nearby to this beach for nearly 40 years.  Major (meaning international) surf competitions and at least one rock concert have been held here but its fun just to walk to the rock pool or go for a swim in the ocean.  If you like beach photos dawn is the best time and there are pelicans on the Narrabeen Lagoon where it empties into the ocean which are especially good photo subjects.  Its a great family outing place.

title: The Best beach on Northern Beaches
text: Beautiful beach for a swimming and very famous for surfing. The oceanic pool it's one of the biggest on the area and try to watch the sunrise from there, it's just a life time experience.

title: Wonderful sight and wonderful walking
text: Wonderful for strong swimmers too - I played safe and used the lagoon and rock pools nearby - wonderful - see adjoining review

title: Good for kids
text:
Great spot with the ocean pool and inlet for the kids to use if needed. 

Downside is that the parking can be atrocious on a popular day.

title: Great walk
text: Beautiful beach and ocean baths can walk along beach forever all the way to Manly so the sign says, a,so trail walks,very picturesque. And can have stop over at surf club for refreshments.

title: Relaxed and watched waves, did a lot of eating and walking.
text: Such a lovely place some excellent places to eat and relax. Would love to go back and try more places to eat. Beach was so clean and also had lifeguards if you wanted to swim safely.

title: great beach
text: beautiful beach, great walking along the sand, beach stretches along for miles, it is  a very friendly place, people say hello as you walk pass, great place to visit.

title: Great Experience
text: We had great weather to visit the beach. Plenty of space to walk, swim and laze around without feeling too crowded.

title: lovely !
text:
North Narrabeen is apart of Narrabeen Beach &  includes Birdwood Park and Narrabeen Lagoon located on the Northern Peninsula. If wanting a secluded private beach North Narrabeen has plenty of space & is not crowded like Manly or Dee Why. 

 Narrabeen Lakes, which is a very popular spot for families and water sports, such as rowing, fishing, boating, windsurfing, canoeing, sailing, waterskiing, and kayaking. This is a great beach for learners. The Lakes are situated around numerous reserves, which also contain Narrabeen Caravan Park, which is a Sydney icon. 

There are some excellent walking tracks around the lagoon and lakes. South Narrabeen Beach is located at the end of Clarke Street; it has a surf club with facilities. Narrabeen Beach also has a surf club with plenty of cafes and restaurants available.

North Narrabeen is famous for being one of the best surf breaks in the world, many world championship competitions are held here regularly. The reason the surf is so good is because of “Shark Alley” a deep channel and with the lagoon emptying into the sea creates a sandbar, which then produces extraordinary waves.  

By transport catch the 182 L87, L88 or L90 from Wynyard or the bus 155 or 157 from Manly. 

Plenty of facilities are available including change rooms, toilets, showers, & parking .

title: Clean surf beach
text: Beautiful clean and well-maintained surf beach, perfect for surf board riding or swimming.  There is a cafe at the beach which is no doubt popular in the summer.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautifully clean with soft sand. Being on a business trip I only managed a few early morning walks but it was stunning.

title: Pristine
text: I love going to this beach. It is still very pristine and beautiful. Not so crowded as Manly or Dee why. It is worth a visit if you are seeking some alone time or some romantic time with your partner.

title: Crashing waves, beach-side pool or a gentle lagoon - your choice
text: I just love North Narrabeen with its deep yellow sand falling down to a good surf beach.  The swimming pool at the end,  nestled under the cliffs and then the lagoon which is great for kids and adults alike. Its got the lot.

title: Fabulous Spot
text: Great location, great beaches, excellent restaurants, great transport link to city and Manly. Plenty of good cafes, access to beach is plentiful, the lakes are on your doorstep as is good cycling routes and golf courses.

title: An amazing stretch of beach
text:
Long, clean, uncrowded, world class surf beach and one of the best in Sydney.  Lots of places to park, multiple surf clubs with eateries and a kid safe lagoon entrance to the northern end of the beach.

Walk, surf, swim, run, kite surf or just sit.  Narrabeen is good for all.  Its a quintessential Aussie beach icon.

title: Great Beach
text: Love the Beach so close to the motel and great surf! Highly recommend any time! It be back next year

title: best surf out
text:
Love the surf.
Family friendly areas as well such as the little lake area.
Short walk to food and transport :)

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text:
Large expanse of beach with a surf club.
Wooden boardwalks and seating at some access points.
Good cafes nearby.

title: Surf Paradise
text: My S-I-L surfs here every morning, has done for 10 years and rates it his favourite break. All along this stretch of beach good surf is found.
