text: This was a good beach to swim at, and hang out at during the day. It was packed our first day there! There are some rocky areas, but nothing too bad. It is also right next to some restaurants and places to grab a drink.

title: vacation
text: The beaches were very rough and rocky and we were not able to swim too much. Our next visit will not be during surfing season.

title: perfect beach for us
text: a lot of waves which we had fun with.  nice beach to hang out with space to relax or play in the ocean.  not as crowded as other beaches by san juan

title: Great for first time surfers
text: Went to Sandy beach on semi-flat day and a day with 8-10 food waves. Semi-flat day was perfect for first or second time surfers. Rocky bottom but not sharp and it's deep enough where if you do not dive you won't hit bottom. Definitely a fun experience!

title: Mostly sandy. Some rocky bottom.
text: We wanted to boogie board here but the beach is very steep and the wave break fast on the beach. The surf wasn't huge but it was very rough with strong currents. On week days you can stroll along, without seeing many people for long stretches. On the weekend it's more crowded.  You can rent surf boards and boogie boards.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Nice sand beach, less rocky than others on the island.  Good for experienced swimmers, surfers, boarders.  Be careful with children as the drop-off is steep.  If you're driving here for the day, aim your GPS for RD2H Ecotours as they're set up in a public (I think) parking area.

title: For surfing and yoga
text: Wind facing side,... north. I hope that horse that was getting trained while being ridden bareback finally got over it's fear of the water.

title: Surfs up here
text: Sandy beach is a little difficult for new people to find off Highway 413 but worth the investigation.  Beautiful beach and waves while you relax and watch the surfers. Makes for a Great afternoon in the sun.  You have got to drive out there.

title: Beautiful wave-active beach
text: Beautiful wave-active beach with beautiful sand and constant temperature of 80 plus degree water and air.

title: Stayed at sandy beach
text: Stayed at pelican point right on sandy beach. Nice clean beach. Would definitely visit again. Fun watching the kids surf during the day.

title: Great waves
text: Great spot for surfers. Also a good spot just to relax on the beach. Waves might be a little rough some days so precaution must be taken if you want to go in for a swim.

title: Rincon beaches run the gamut from placid days to surfer juggernauts!
text: I do not surf! I do love watching surfers though! Wish I had been an aficionado in my youth! I love the laid back no worries vibe in a real surfer's locale. Rincon in general gives off that vibe. The people are as friendly and helpful as any location in the Caribbean I have ever been, and I have been to quite a few!  Unfortunately there had been a storm during our visit (my GF and I) and we had several days of dangerous rip currents. When we got calm days at the end of our trip we took advantage of a glass like sea. We loved our time in Rincon and plan to return. San Juan on the other hand reminded us of rude driving like NYC! OLD SAN JUAN at night was well worth it for the strolling and fine food, That part of San Juan we cherished!!- Kevin Alcock, N.J.

title: Great beach for learning surfing.
text: The water becomes deep rather quickly but that's not a problem. The waves have a tendency to carry you along the beach if you choose to swim, which makes this beach better for surfing. Sunbathing is better done in the evening when the sun is shining from a better angle.

title: R AND R
text: this beach was Quiet and serene. We watched surfers and families, when we were in the water, we even seen fins, so if you pay attention you might find a little aquatic life. A little crab came out of the sand, if not just to pop his head up to see what was going on, and then he was gone .. Good times.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: We walked Sandy Beach one morning during our visit to Rincon.  It was both quiet and peaceful.  It's probably better for surfing than swimming, but will work either way.

title: It's a paradise!!
text:
I rented a mini apartment in a house called Happiness House
I had an awesome time enjoying the Sandy Beach view, walking around visiting the shop spots, bars and talking with great people from different countries of the USA
Rincon is one of that place that you never leave
Definitively I'll back

title: Beautiful beach!
text: We absolutely loved this beach.  Great for surfing and hanging out - lots of sand, great waves and some great restaurants and bars along the strip!

title: Tamboo, Flamboyan, Kahuna, Pelican Point, Casa Islena, Pools bar, Calypso
text:
I think the best of the attractions for price and satisfaction are as follows:
Tamboo: drinks and nightlife
Red Flamboyan: Fish, seafood
Big Kahuna: Burgers
Pelican Point: accommodations
Casa Islena: Small dish appetizers
Pool Bar: Sushi
Calypso: Sunset run specials
Surf: Punta Higero and Antonios on Sandy Beach, Marias on west beaches
Weddings: on-the beach weddings
Mar Azul: Surf Board rentals

title: Just beautiful!
text: Highly recommended for surfing and for swimming and laying out. Some restaurants and coffee shacks walking distance to beach. Love love loved it!

title: 2002-2016 Vacations!
text: My husband and I have been traveling to Rincon, Puerto Rico since 2002. We have made so many lasting friendships!!! We always look forward to returning every year!

title: Great place for photos
text: You're gonna love this place for taking photos, I tried swimming here the other day, but the waves are kinda huge for comfort, so I just sat by the sands and took photos, I love it!

title: Very windy!!
text: I don't know if it was just that day we visited. It was so windy. The waves were HUGE!! The beach itself is of course beautiful but definitely not for someone who wants to just chill. It's perfect for surfers but not for the regular beach-goers.

title: Great Waves
text: This beach has great waves in the morning. Had an amazing experience at this beach two days in a row.

title: Watch the surfers
text: Great beach to watch the surfers do what they do best. Take a minute and enjoy the sound of the waves.

title: Worth a trip
text: Fun beach to walk!  Was staying in the area and drove over to walk this nice beach..Fun beach bar at the end..not crowded.. Will be back!

title: My favorite
text: This place brings so many memories. Great for bodysurfing.  Several restaurants, lodging, and bars nearby.

title: Waves for miles!
text: The last stop of our trip. What a hidden gem. Beautiful beach with lots of surfers! Loved it! Restaurant and bar close by.

title: Sandy Beach with Surfing swell
text: Sandy beach is a great beach in Rincon to wall the beach and swim off of when there are no waves.  BEWARE.. IT IS DANGEROUS when the waves are breaking.  There are dangerous rip-Tide currents in certain areas that one should ask the local beach people about before swimming  while waves are breaking..  Most of the time its great for swimming  with a few rocks here and there to watch out for big waves..  Enjoy your visit to Sandy Beach but be watchfull for big wave days.......

title: Beautiful
text: Absolutely beautiful beach, not crowded at all, clean water, quiet and relaxing. We took our kids with us and we all felt very safe.

title: Nice beach
text: A nice beach, a little less traveled than the Condado beaches by the big resorts.  Clean, with good sand, and a nice decent clientele

title: Great Beach!
text: Love this beach.. we went andonly a handful of people there. We were told it was the off sea which was great!

title: Nice sandy beach
text: No rocks or anything- it was a good beach for swimming and looking for sea glass and rocks.  Not a lot of shade though

title: Nice Place to Surf and Find Sea Glass!
text:
This was close to our vacation house so it was our first option for a beach when we started our vacation. It isn't really noisy or crowded. There is a small trailer where surf lessons are offered and you can rent whatever board you want. 

There is a beach-side bar down the ways and if you go past that, you can find a little lagoon next to the rocks. It's fun to explore the beach in its entirety too when it comes for searching for sea glass.

title: easy to get to, not good for swimming
text: Stayed at a spot near Sandy beach and it was easy to get to and find.  The day we went the surf was rough so it wasn't ideal for wading or swimming, especially for kids.  If you like to park up and just relax with the sound of the ocean on an isolated quiet beach this is a good spot.

title: Spectacular!
text:
It s a must see! 
Perfect location during day, can turn romantic during night!
Parking available and free.
Clean beach, fit for kids too.

title: Sufing all day, Tamboo for lunch
text: Great place to surf for beginners in the summer.  Learned from the best, Albert and Nathan at RD2H.  Rental chairs and umbrellas available. Surfed in the morning then lunch at Tamboo during the storm!

title: Not my favorite beach on the island
text: Beach was the closest to the house we were staying in.  Not my favorite beach on the island as it had a steep drop off and waves crashing close to shore.  We did see a turtle nest excavation while we were there so that was interesting.

title: Clear water, clean sand and quiet
text: We enjoy walking here everyday to simply play in the ocean. It's typically quiet u less it's a holiday weekend, which we love. Kids learned to surf here too.

title: LOVE THIS BEACH
text: Our second visit to PR and still our favorite beach in Rincon! Watch out because the waves can get crazy in October-April. Look for sea glass and see what all you can find!

title: Very nice Beach
text: This is a very nice Beach to go to if you like to serve it can get very good I'm glad that it's a nice day just to relax on there are some good places in the area to have lunch or dinner and some cold beers

title: Great beach!
text:
Beautiful, wide, and clean. The beach was just steps from our house and very convenient. 

We spent a lot of time on the beach during our stay. It was perfect for going for walks or just splashing around. 

It wasn't a great wading beach due to the reef and the current that ran along shore. It was a little too rough for the youngest (3, 4, and 10) in our parties to really enjoy. 

Convenient (and good!) bar and restaurant located right on the beach, The Tamboo. 

Gorgeous sunsets!

title: Super great
text: My family and I spend the day in Sandy Beach and the Tamboo place and it was excellent. The beach is great for surfers and for the complete family. Be carefull always with the kids and old fulks because of the waves. Super nice beach to suntan and for turtles nesting, so be carefull.

title: great family beach
text: This beach is lovely for swimming and sunning in the summer. Shade is not as accessible as some of the other beaches so you might want to bring an umbrella.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Enjoyed this beach while relaxing and taking surfing lessons with our family. Breathtaking views. Can't wait to return!

title: Very sandy beach!
text: nice beach to surf and chill on the sand. not very good for kids... but otherwise its a clean water area good to have fun.

title: lovely
text: Lovely swimming beach when we went in June. Even some decent snorkeling.  Nicely maintained yet not commercialized.  Not too crowded, even on weekends.

title: SANDSAYSIONAL
text: Felt like a local every time i returned. Sugar type sand, the waves are the highlight, crashing rocks or curling in the reflective light kissing the sand as they come in.. The only beach that has a feel of private remoteness yet there's an eatery and rental place at hand, strange yet satisfying. No crowds just surf sun and solitude!  Come get acquainted!

title: Simply Beautifu
text: My family, friends and I really enjoyed ourselves at Sandy beach. The views are simply breath taking! Love it very much!

title: great beach with great restaurants and bar next door.
text: There is plenty of parking during the week. It gets a little crowded over the weekend. Go to the beach early!

title: Sandy beach
text: My wife and I took a ride to this beach it was beautiful lots of sea glass and surfers lots of restaurants and people. The only thing is getting there hard to find use your gps or you will get lost

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful, quiet beach. Favorite beach in PR, there is an awesome beach bar/restaurant on it too. The beach had small little bumps to surf, they also have a small shop where you can rent boards.

title: Beautiful Beach with a nice surf and restaurant!
text: Many of the beaches we visited in Puerto Rico were filthy, but not this one!  The beach was clean, the waves were just strong enough that the whole family could get up on a board (my eight year old son rocked it) and there was a lovely restaurant with food that was pretty darn good.  Definitely go here if you are in Rincon!

title: Fun to walk and find sea glass, beautiful views, better for surfing than swimming.
text: The views on this beach are beautiful. You need to be careful because it has a lot of rocks and coral under the water. The river mouth is where you will find more sea glass, and it is usually best after storms, you can look through the area where there are shells and the glass will be within there. The rays of the sun on the water were picturesque. I went in May and for a lot of my walk I had the beach to myself which was very cool!

title: Good beach for surfers but not paradise for swimmers
text: A lot of surfers but there is a reef directly on the beach so it is kind of dangerous for swimmers.not a big beach and not many possibilities to find some shadow..anyway the water is okay

title: Coolest beach
text: Great fun for surf watching, sunning or just walking.  Swim at your own risk, but fabulous.  If you only see surfers stay out of the water unless you have your own board.  Food in the area is also worth.

title: Beach Vacation
text: First visit to West Coast. Beautiful beach but sand is not as soft as others meaning bigger grains. Sand gets extremely  hot during day for walking. Great for families not looking for calm, glass like beach. Best spot is right by Tamboo for the shade, music & drinks. Kids are 13 & 11 and the locals got my kids interested in surfing.

title: lovely walks and swimming on Sandy Beach
text: Good food at Tamboo Tavern, be careful of the surf.  Still able to find beach glass.  Ocean pools safe for children.

title: Beautiful
text: Although we did not try surfing, we really wish we did!  This beach was beautiful, and it was so fun to watch surfers of all different ability levels out there giving it a try.

title: Best swimming beach in Rincon
text: Only location where it is not rocky to swim, sandy beach located by tamboo is best location to enjoy smooth suntan with calm beach to take a dip.

title: Relaxing beach day
text:
On March 28, 2016 my partner and I decided to take a beach day. We went to Sandy Beach. Discover a quiet corner and made our camp!
There are many people, locals and tourist. The beach was clean and the waves calm. 
Unfortunately, the afternoon showers appears and have to go to other place.

title: Good for beginner surfers
text: Being one of the few mostly sand bottom beaches, this is a good place for beginner surfers. Surf lessons are offered here and the instructors are very nice!

title: Family retreat
text: The hotel had great location, espectacular views  food was good and service too. We stayed at Tamboo's. The beach is great but you better know how to swim. Friendly people.

title: Beautiful, laid back and friendly
text: Sandy Beach is the kind of beach that decompresses the soul.  Chill on the sand, rent a surfboard, go snorkling, or hang out with a Medalla on the deck at Tamboo.  So easy.

title: Wide and windy!!
text: A lot of surfers hit sandy beach. It is on the north side of the island and just about 15 minutes north of Rincon. There are some nice local shops tucked in along the beach. The prevailing wind tends to come out of the north east and so this beach gets the big wind. As a kite flyer I love it!! Not a great swimming beach because there are a lot of waves and it can be rough. But it's a great place to watch surfers and hang out on the white beach.

title: Sandy Toes
text: When we went the water was a little rough but was fun watching surfers. Great for long walks on the beach.

title: Absolutely Beautiful!!!
text:
The beach was amazing! We found a spot by a surf board rental shop and parking was free! The water is crystal clear! Must see!! 

There were also mango trees on the way and we picked a couple of them. :)

title: Great beach and surf spot
text: We surfed here a few days while we were on an epic surf trip. The beach is great and family friendly. There is food right there and parking was tricky. One of my favorites on the trip!

title: Nice !!
text: We stayed Right across the Street !!!  So Beautiful !!! Third time in Puerto Rico... Want to Live Here !!!

title: loved it!!
text: really beautiful beach, while my boyfriend surfed i was just relaxing on the sand and i what i liked a lot of this beach is that i could get in into the water. And you got Tamboo in front of the beach which is a really nice bar to hang out.

title: love this beach!
text: This beach was amazing great beginner surfing. The beach was sandy with a large beach front area and lots of restaurants.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful beach. Get there early and collect your sea glass. Chair/umbrella rental available from trailer in main parking lot.

title: Beautiful Sandy Beach
text: We hiked to Sandy Beach from Domes thru the trails and along the beach. It was isolated and beautiful.

title: Nice area but somewhat isolated from the town of Rincon, so think twice before you stay here.
text:
Beach area north of Rincon by about 10 minutes, up the somewhat harrowing (ie narrow, steep and windy ) 413 and then you need to turn left either just before or after the Lazy Parrot ( and back down the hill ) to get there.  Casual and surfer-friendly.

Quite a few places to stay but not that convenient if you're heading back and forth to town ( due to the route ). 

It's obligatory to check out Tamboo for lunch, dinner or the nighttime bar scene.

title: Fun area
text: Loved loved loved Rincon. Cute little area where you can sit on the beach and enjoy the view of the surfers! Sandy beach is the best area to stay in my opinion.

title: Surf!
text: Beautiful and long beach of Saquarema in Rio de Janeiro, where the Brazilian stage of the WSL world surfing championship takes place, very good for the sport, but very unsuitable for bathing due to the risks on most days.

title: Place to be happy!
text: Super quiet and pleasant city, beautiful and clean beaches, strong waves, but offers quieter places.

title: Naturally beautiful!
text: Naturally clean.. Quite cold water... But it makes up for it by the sunshine that accompanies it largely only year-round.

title: Very good beach.
text: The beach is wonderful, clean and beautiful. What we had difficulties with was a place for lunch and dinner, it is very difficult to find a good place with a fair price. The hostel we stayed at I found too expensive for what it offered. They need to better structure the accommodations combined with food. As a first time, it was worth it.

title: Beach for those who like waves.
text: Excellent beach, with waves, without the hype and movement of Cabo Frio, but in a simple and pleasant place. Sunset in the sea, along with the Morro da Igreja and the view of the lagoon, many surf schools. Shops, bars and restaurants meet your needs. The World Surfing Championship takes place on site and depending on the season the sea can be rough. It is not suitable for those who do not know how to swim or have little familiarity with the sea of waves, although there are always present lifeguards, but at the end with stones there are quiet places suitable for children. The sand is soft and difficult for walks. We even saw large turtles near the beach,

title: Rough sea.
text: Wonderful, beautiful, clean beach, but with little infrastructure. Quite rough seas, but for those who don't like turmoil it's the ideal beach!

title: Empty beaches on holidays.
text: We traveled for the first time to Saquarema and the beach of Itaúna, which is one of the most famous, surprised me very positively. Fine white sands, very blue sea and it wasn't too angry in the spots we visited. The water was not cold. Quiet beach, empty because it was a holiday, I even got scared. I didn't even believe the truth. No speakers. Most of them don't have chairs and umbrellas rent, so it's good to take them. Also there aren't many kiosques depending on where you are so it's good to bring some snacks. On the waterfront there are some more cool party bars too.  I loved it.

title: Place to be happy!
text: Wonderful place. Super quiet neighborhood. Clean beach, but rough sea, in some points where there are rocks is quiet for children.

title: Itaúna is life!
text: Beach delight, great to stay in Saquarema. It's the surfers' spot and worth a walk to the church by the sand

title: Beautiful beaches!
text: Beautiful Itaúna beach with clear sand, with preserved natural vegetation, beautiful sea, clear waters but very cold, big waves come in when low tide even so be careful because there are currents. Respect Red Flags

title: Surfing championship beach.
text: It is the place where the stage of the WQS, world surfing championship, takes place, so it has many waves and it is necessary to take care of the children. It has more than 5km of sand, so even in times of covid there is no problem of agglomeration.   Access is simple, if you go by car there are private parking lots, or you have to stop on the street.  The sunsets are also amazing.

title: Beach with strong waves.
text: As Saquarema is already known for its good waves for surfers, I wasn't surprised that I couldn't bathe in the sea (I didn't risk it because I didn't know how to swim). The beach is great. At the beginning it is very empty and private and along it you can find kiosks and visits from many dogs.

title: Beach
text: Beautiful is the beach of Itaúna, famous for its big waves. White sand and always clean water. We just have to be careful because sometimes the current is very strong.

title: Beauty and Care
text: Beautiful beach, clean and very extensive, you can choose to stay in a more private spot since the beach is so extensive that people are not crowded, but on this beach you should be careful with the wind, as it disguises the heat so always use sunscreen and have a lot with the waves, as they are very big.

title: Preserve to be able to appreciate.
text: A beautiful beach! Almost virgin, with little flow of people, high waves and undergrowth. Nature still little affected by human contact.

title: The beach of high waves, but it also has its tranquility.
text: A very busy beach, good for surfing, but I have witnessed calm tide with natural pools, there is also a part of the beach with many caves that you can practice amateur diving

title: Beautiful sea to admire!
text: Itaúna beach is beautiful but not suitable for children because the sea is very strong. I went with my husband and my son who stayed in a small plastic pool on the sand. We stayed on the straight of the Surf Association, where the view is beautiful and there is a children's playground.     The sea is beautiful, overlooking the church (symbol of Saquarema).

title: A paradise on Earth.
text: I recommend going and taking the whole family, it's worth it, in addition to being a quiet place, good tents, in addition to having a nice view to take pictures

title: Wonderful beach.
text: Empty beach, the sea is not always possible to enter, good for surfing, clean, amazing place, I recommend !!

title: Tranquility
text: A quiet beach with places with few people, more with a sea with big waves good for the outbreak, some good restaurants like the girl from Itaúna, beach house, surf house is etc, there is a good place for children right at the end of Itaúna where there are some rocks, the sea is much calmer but finally it is a beautiful beach

title: Surf Temple and Good for Children
text: It is a beautiful beach chosen by the surf crowd, for offering good waves. However, because it has stone barriers, it anticipates surf, holding back the force of the waves and forming an area with calm waters near the sand, ideal for children to play - always observing periods of low and high tide.

title: Wonderful, but very cold.
text: I was with the family now in January and we really enjoyed this beach that is beautiful, quiet, even in high season there were few people, the sea was calm on the first three days but the water was extremely cold, on the other three days the sea changed gigantic waves but it was a show apart. I missed kiosks on this beach.

title: What peace!!!
text: Me and my daughter love the beach, it's quite windy, few people, very beautiful, but the water is really cold. I advise you to stay close to the rocks that form swimming pools, because in several places the sea is very rough and dangerous. I loved Itáúna!

title: Great
text: Very good beach. Cold water and usually strong waves. There are places protected by stones, forming "pools". Pretty cool !

title: Lunch
text: Very beautiful beach.                 Good for family. Good for surfers. Very nice. Several restaurants. Lots of hostels.

title: Very beautiful! I found it dangerous.
text: Very beautiful the landscape, the color of the sea, beautiful and beautiful. But I thought it was dangerous, despite seeing a lot of children but already with surfing in my veins.

title: Great beach!
text: I recommend excellent beach, it has its very wild places, but it has the calm Family side excellent for children I always take my daughters!

title: Open beach
text: Nice beach, good basic infrastructure, several restaurants along .. open sea beach, need to be careful.. Surfing in the area

title: Surf
text: Great beach for surfing, but dangerous. Now you have to know the current, it takes you to the bottom, but it brings you back.

title: Only for Surf
text: Beach dedicated exclusively to surfing, if that's not your intention it's not worth it, a lot of wind and rough sea.

title: Surf, Sun, and Beautiful People Beach
text: Wonderful beach! Be sure to visit the Casa de Praia restaurant.There you will find a very well cared for cuisine, especially the Lula a Doré which is a show, as well as sushi, massage or even get a tattoo!

title: Big and beautiful
text: Big beach with good waves to surf, those who surf will like it a lot, the beach has already had a surfing championship.  The beach also has quieter areas, there is a part where water accumulates, a shallower part, good for children.

title: Beautiful
text: Very beautiful long beach, clear waters, several inns, some places with trees making it easy to park

title: To contemplate...
text: Very beautiful beach. Excellent landscape to enjoy and photograph. As for the bath, things get complicated. The waves hit a lot and pull a lot. For surfers, great. Now for us clumsy beachgoers, it gets complicated. You can't get it any wetter than your shins. And that's not a problem, of course. Just a note and a warning for those who are going to get to know the region, especially for those who are with children. And for these, a few minutes walk towards the church, you arrive at Praia da Barrinha which, yes, is quiet, with large shallow stretches, which make the joy of the tomboy and everyone else.

title: Beach
text: Very good for surfer. Spectacular view. It is worth the visit with good restaurants on the waterfront.

title: Beautiful, good waves.
text: The best beach in saquarema for those who enjoy good waves, a fantastic view of the entire shore with the church in the background, where the national stage of the world surfing circuit takes place, the city is known as the national capital of surfing, those who come to saquarema have to visit this beach.

title: Beautiful beach
text: I think for bathers the best time is at low tide. Very quiet beach, with beach bars nearby for those who want to listen to some music, eat and drink something.

title: Beach wedding
text: Wedding on the beach. Beautiful place with a little church in the background on top of a rock completing the look.

title: Beautiful!
text: Beach with sea that you need to be a little careful, even because the city hosts surfing championships! But it is beautiful, with a large strip of sand, empty (at least in winter). The point I stayed at was in front of Casa da Praia which has options of restaurants and shops. There are shows in the evenings. I didn't see ANY street vendors. Very clean sea and cold water but after a little while it becomes great!

title: Beautiful coastline.
text: Beautiful beach. Although dangerous for me. But, it's eye candy. And very calm! I wish I could spend more time there.

title: Itaúna: Revival!
text: I was in Itaúna last Sunday. It's always nice to go to Saquarema. It may just be a personal feeling, but it's a dive back in time. A 70's revival! Spot those people who exude freedom, a lush sea and good rock here and there. Serguei, the dinosaur of rock is gone, but Saqua (for the intimates) keeps all that charm of alternative places, of beautiful and tanned people, in short, a paradise!

title: Beautiful beach
text: A very beautiful beach, with a sunset next to the Church of Nazareth where anyone can become an excellent photographer. Beach with strong waves, you need to be very careful

title: Beautiful place
text: The sea was very rough But this is common there, very good for those who know how to swim, it is quiet, I do not recommend people with mobility problems and entering the sea of Saquarema, the view of the beach is wonderful, the day was beautiful.

title: A paradise 2h30 from Rio
text: Itaúna beach is a beach that surprises by the beauty and purity of the water, although sometimes it is a little cold. According to the movement of the tides, it is possible to enjoy pools that allow people to stay in the water and enjoy themselves. In addition to all this, we have surfing for those who wish to enjoy this sport

title: Pleasant beach
text: I went on a long holiday and the beach was very quiet. Known for its strong waves, frequented by many surfers and icy water... On this holiday the waters were calm and with a pleasant temperature. Not to mention the incredible look with the almost transparent green water. I love Itaúna!

title: Wonderful and indescribable place.
text: A true paradise. Fascinating place with wonderful beach. I've known them for a long time, my kids grew up there. Sensational

title: Paradise
text: It's one of the most beautiful beaches I know. It has a variety of restaurants and inns, as well as beautiful and pleasant people. RECOMMEND.

title: Great beach
text: Quiet beach and is almost never crowded. The waves take a little away from the public who like to get in the water.

title: SUPER NICE.
text: Close to restaurants, hotels and inns. Square close to the beach, clean and well maintained, a wonder!!  Well worth a visit.

title: Itauna Beach, the best in Saqua!
text: I love Itaúna beach! For me it's the best beach we have in Saquarema! It has several bars, restaurants. I highly recommend it, it's worth it! It's only in high season that you have to arrive early because there are few places for parking (but that's in a place in the lakes region in high season) hugs

title: Itaúna best beach in Saquarema
text: Clear, clean and crystal clear water. Sea sheltered in the rocks in front of the Maasai Hotel where I stayed. The Maasai Hotel is all good, perfect location, very good service and restaurant. I'll be back as often as I can.

title: Wonderful!!
text: Love!! Very beautiful beaches!! I highly recommend it!! Just be careful with hotels and hostels, ask for a photo before closing the deal

title: Excellent place. Unforgettable beach
text: Beach that hits a lot I don't recommend for small children beautiful too could have more kiosks. But it was worth the ride.

title: Very beautiful!
text: Beach with strong waves, perfect for surfing. It is on this beach that one of the stages of the world surfing championship takes place. Clean and crystal clear water, but extremely cold. The sandy expanse of the beach is clean. To bathe, I used to go to the rocks where there is a kind of cove protected from the waves by the rocks. Itaúna is located in the southern zone of Saquarema.

title: Very good
text: The place is very nice, quiet and with many gastronomic options. I'll definitely come back other times.

title: Great beach!
text: Itaúna beach is not the most suitable for swimming, since there are many currents and strong waves, making it deep very quickly. So much so that it is widely used by surfers... However, it is clean, with clean sand, not too cold water (as is common in the Lake District). There is not a very good structure for food on the beach (only in the surroundings). Most regulars take their coolers with drinks as well, since on the beach it is difficult to find and, when there is, it is expensive.

title: The best beach in the city
text: The open sea in Saquarema is famous for its high waves, but Itaúna has a special corner between the rocks that allows for a quiet swim at low tide. A place I always come back to for a swim.

title: Beautiful
text: The beach seems to be incredible, I didn't get to stay on it, on the trip there was no time, but I was longing to go back just to see the beautiful sunset that I saw friends posting on this beach.   It has a lovely view.   Downside: there's no shadow!

title: Itaúna top
text: There's no way, when I go to Saquarema I have to go to Itaúna.  For me it's the best beach in town. Clear waters and great spots to enter the sea. Staying close to the rocks is great for children and the elderly, as it tends to be quieter there.  But there's no way, in Saquarema when the sea is rough there is no beach that is calm, so always be careful.

title: Always breathtaking.
text: It's my favorite beach. A large stretch of sand, always clean. The water is always cold and more agitated. We're in luck to catch a warm, tame, Caribbean-like week. But this only happens rarely.

title: Lovely place
text: Great for kids near Lagoa. Clean sand, a well-frequented place I only miss a few kiosks and public bathrooms.

title: New Year's Eve 2018
text: Excellent beach to enjoy with family and children. You can see turtles swimming near you.  Calm sea near the church or the rocks at the end of the Oceanic. Clean and transparent sea.

title: Best beach in Saquarema.
text: Clean, clear, and sometimes hot water (but sometimes very well). Good for those who like to catch waves and for families with children (stay close to Massai). A nice beach, with good energy and very relaxing.

title: One of the best beaches
text: My favorite place to go to the beach, always very pleasant and without that amount of people that crowd the beaches of the South Zone of Rio de Janeiro. The beach doesn't get crowded and you don't have any worries about possible muggings or trawlers.

title: Surfing capital
text: The best beach in Saquarema !!  Great for those who like to surf, to enjoy a beautiful sunset!!!

title: Beautiful, big and strong
text: One of the best beaches in Saquarema, with strong and imposing waves. It has many inns, bars and restaurants. As I have a 4x4 Troller I like to be close to the sands to challenge the car.

title: Big and beautiful
text: Big beach with good waves to surf, those who surf will like it a lot, the beach has already had a surfing championship.  The beach also has quieter areas, there is a part where water puddles in the sand, good for children.

title: Surf Point
text: The beach is huge and due to the rock formations allows the formation of good waves for surfing. It doesn't have much structure of stalls for snacks and snacks, but it does.

title: Too beautiful!
text: Beach not suitable for children. It hits a lot. Lots of surfers. Very few street vendors. Recommend!

title: Clean beach
text: One of the options is to enjoy Itaúna beach, with crystal clear waves. There is a part that has rocks and forms pools, good for children. On the sand, there is little structure of tents. Some restaurants charge high prices, it's always good to research.

title: Wild beach
text: Still wild beach, with vegetation around, no tents on the sand which makes it beautiful. The sea has a lot of high waves.

title: Holidays
text: Beautiful beach a breathtaking sunset. The beach was very strong with no conditions for swimming, but it was wonderful, powerful and awesome with waves of about 3 meters. I recommend visiting the city as well.

title: Rough sea
text: The sea was rough, but the beach is very clean and with a lush view. On other occasions, bathing is allowed.

title: Itaúna Beach
text: Excellent clean beach with great waves to surf, a tip with children better option to stay on the rocks in the corner of the beach.

title: Getting to know Itaúna!
text: Very beautiful beach with a very long strip of sand, the sand was clean, very rough sea and cold water.   It has a beautiful view of the church and options of places for a good meal or a drink, for all tastes and budgets.

title: Tour
text: Great. Beautiful centennial church overlooking the beaches and the lagoon of Saquarema, in addition to the village and on some days the beaches towards Cabo Frio.

title: Beautiful place!
text: It was my first visit of many (I hope!) Beautiful, quiet beach, despite the fact that the sea is extremely rough. Loved Saquarema and Itaúna beach

title: Incredible
text: It's already the second time I've been there and I feel like a traveler being welcomed. It is a planned beach that reminded visitors with wide streets and squares with parking between the mansions or beach bar. Speaking of the beach bars is another peculiarity because they are beautiful, pleasant and highly recommend

title: Tranquility and beauty
text: Despite being a surfer's paradise, Itaúna beach is not usually crowded to a large extent, allowing you to enjoy the beach more peacefully.

title: Surfing capital!
text: It's good to arrive early to find parking spaces, especially in the summer. Beautiful beach with very white sand and clean water. It is not for nothing that Saquarema is considered the national capital of surfing. Many water sports such as surfing, bodyboarding and stand up, even when there are no waves many divers too. In the background it is possible to see at the top of the rock, the beautiful church of Nossa Senhora de Nazaré, centenary, it is worth visiting and seeing the landscape of Itaúna beach from above as well. Almost every day the fishermen's boats go out to pull the nets, further to the middle of the beach near the Salvamar station, and offer fish still alive at good prices. There are many hostel options in the immediate vicinity. Restaurants with very varied prices, good research...

title: The best beach.
text: Best beach in Itaúna, mainly for surfing, kite, stand up and very good for relaxing.

title: Good for surfing and everything else
text: Itaúna should be a must-see destination for everyone who enjoys a beautiful and clean beach. The Maracanã of Brazilian Surfing is an excellent destination for those going to the region of the lakes. Some tips: (1) avoid stopping at the first few entrances; more towards the middle of the beach is less crowded (2) escape the beachside restaurants; They are the most expensive points and there is a possibility of having flannellinhas filling the bag (3) to park, prefer the alleys inside (4) if you can, go by bike - the tour is nice and there is a bike path inside the waterfront - take your padlock (5) in winter it can be a little cold, because of the winds

title: Beautiful beach
text: This beach in Saquarema has a very beautiful water tone, the water is very clean, but like all the beaches in Saquarema, they are a bit strong.

title: Very good
text: Beach with strong waves but very good. It's not crowded, but there's always movement. On the rocks it is good for snorkeling.

title: Exuberant beach
text: Place to eat on the beach: Garota de Itaúna restaurant. The restaurant is located on the sand of the beach. I always eat the dishes that have shrimp. Love!!!! Weekends usually have live music. The best stretch of beach for bathing is after the aforementioned restaurant, where there are some rocks that break the force of the wave and the pull of the current. As I have small children, to bathe in the sea, I always stay on this stretch, as there is a lifeguard tent and there is more movement of people. It is the stretch of beach also where the boats arrive from fishing. You can buy fresh fish on the spot. It is a summer beach that is usually not very busy.

title: Beautiful beach with rough sea
text: Quiet beach, empty even during the holidays. Locals only. Great for jogging in the morning. The sea is a bit rough, I don't recommend leaving children free in the water. If you wanted, a little further on there is the beach of Barrinha, with a lagoon that meets the sea and the water forms a swimming pool for children to play. You can take babies to this bar with peace of mind.

title: Late afternoon in paradise.
text: Located close to the Center and with waves that reach three meters, it is considered one of the best beaches in the country for surfing. The beach has some rocks at the beginning, which cut off the strength of the sea a bit, allowing children to play in smaller waves. At the top of the rocks we can fish, as it is next to the entrance to the saquarema lagoon. What's more, it has a beautiful sunset, and a view of the Church of Our Lady of Nazareth, perched high on a hill. It's worth knowing.

title: Very good location, but very dangerous.
text: Beautiful beach, good for walking, but the sea is not suitable for bathing because it is rough and has a lot of current.

title: Surfing championship beach
text: Of the beaches of Saquarema, Itaúna is the best for bathers, because of the rocks it does not have many waves as in the beach of Vila which is totally open sea. It has more bars and places for consumption. It is the noblest area of Saquarema. Location of the Surfing Championships. It's worth it. Pretty nifty.

title: Preview of the World Surfing Championship
text: Itaúna is a wonderful beach on any occasion, even if it is wild. The view of the profile of the Church in the distance from Laje is an unforgettable image, even more so if it is at sunset. The advantage of having gone at this period of the championship is that the white sand was very clean of any garbage. Congratulations to the organizers of the event.

title: Surf temple
text: Beautiful beach, frequented by beautiful people, temple of surfing, with good bars. Just standing there watching the big waves crashing is worth it.

title: Carnival is always wonderful
text: Always wonderful Carnival in Saquarema. Great beach, good services. The city remains in conditions of service and the beach is not exhausted with the number of tourists. It's worth knowing

title: Beautiful and pleasant beach
text: Beautiful place.  Different, as practically not the famous promenade. It has the tip of the beach, the famous Barrinha, where an ideal pool for children is formed, but with a high frequency of people. It has good restaurants on site.

title: Beautiful beach, strong sea, little structure
text: If you don't mind the structure of bar service on the sand of the beach, which are absent or precarious, this is a beach with a beautiful view, white sand and beautiful people.

title: Cold
text: Very busy beach in April and quite cold, suitable for surfers... But we stay between some rocks where it creates a kind of "pool" where the waves are less strong... We saw a lot of dangers and a lot of people who worked their luck, giving work to the lifeguards who were always ready and attentive... The water, very cold, but clean... the sand, white... the seafood there, close to us in our sight... the fishermen leaving and arriving at TD the moment with the fruit of their labor... The seagulls flying over the waters near the bathers, fishing, gave a show of their own... Lovely TD... But be careful who goes with children and teenagers... The sea from there is treacherous MSM in this "calmer" place and pulls inwards... You can't leave a person, especially children, inexperienced, alone in the water... We saw a rescue that was almost not possible and the boy wasn't even drowning, he just couldn't get back to the sand, because the water pulled him to the sea... Knowing how to swim is of no use there, if you don't have respect and care... Always stay alert and don't neglect your protection... Not neglecting the rules and warnings of the lifeguards, you only have to enjoy, as we did...

title: Without a doubt one of the best beaches in Brazil
text: Itauna really is the Brazilian Maracanã. A unique place in Brazil. The city breathes surf. The waves are the best on our coast.

title: Place of peace, place of the world surfing capital
text: Very good the place has very inviting restaurants showww is an unforgettable place I have been going since 1990

title: Great!!!
text: Beach a delight, cold water, the waves were strong but they didn't stop me from enjoying the beach. It was great! It was very hot the day I went.

title: Very beautiful
text: The view is very beautiful, the sea on this beach is quite rough, it is not advisable to take a walk with very naughty children, a good place to rest on the sand and leave the hustle and bustle of the city's daily life aside

title: Wonderful beach, loved it
text: Miles of white sand and wonderful warm sea, at the beginning of winter it wasn't even very angry but it wasn't bay either! It has no buildings, it's very natural, it's very quiet and clean!

title: There is no better
text: Best beach in Saquarema, rough sea but calm sands. Great place to relax, no danger, quiet, friendly people, with restaurants nearby.

title: Beautiful green waters
text: Being at Itaúna Beach is like taking a trip to the most crystalline and greenish waters of the country. Comparing it to something outside, it reminds me of the Caribbean. I like it a lot out of season when it's quiet and not too crowded.

title: Beautiful beach
text: A great beach with an extensive strip of sand. There is also a breakwater with a channel with sea water entering the lagoon that is right next to the beach, and at the foot of the little church, which is very famous by the way. There are days when the sea there is very rough and it's bad to bathe, but the day I went was great! I was very close to the breakwater and there was a sandbar where it was like a swimming pool, it was very good and I could enjoy it a lot. I highly recommend it!

title: Beach
text: Best beach in Saquerema. It is a paradisiacal beach and well frequented by surfers. It is the noble part of the city.

title: Happiness lives there ...
text: A place where all tribes gather and a place to meet nature. Beautiful... Wonderful... There's no equal...

title: Beautiful beach but it's not calm
text: The beach is excellent but it is not for children, the sea is wild and the worst thing is that it does not have a plateau that goes towards the sea, but it is excellent to spend the day, it lacks a little beer tent, it is very deserted, but it is worth going.

title: Lunch at rest
text: Beautiful beach, spectacular place that we must know, clean, safe and comfortable to go with family on weekends, in low season even better

title: Excellent
text: Great beach to come with family! Polite people and a very quiet atmosphere. The only recommendation is that you do not leave children in the sea alone as there are many sandbanks and the sea sometimes pulls well.

title: City postcard
text: Even in high season it is a very beautiful place, if you are willing to walk on the sand, in places further away from the church you will find emptier areas for bathing. Very beautiful for photos, the place allows a beautiful view of the church, bridge, sea and lagoon.

title: Loved it
text: Delicious place to go for a walk! In the region of Av. Oceânica is very full of restaurants and food options.

title: Great beach
text: Clean and cold water, beautiful view, very nice place to spend holidays or weekends, good frequency.

title: Three-day visit... three sea conditions!!!
text: Beautiful beach, but with sea that may not please everyone... at least every day. 1st day: medium sea, with waves, alligators and some "broths"; 2nd day: only broth for the few who ventured to swim! ; Day 3: Lagoon with children swimming, snorkeling with sea turtle,... Very good!

title: Very well maintained and beautiful.
text: The beach with white and cold waters is very beautiful and because of that a calmer place. Good for surfers. It has a structure of restaurants at average prices and where to park nearby.

title: Beautiful
text: Open sea. Very clean place, beautiful people, wonderful place for all ages. A beautiful sunset. It has restaurant security. All the best.

title: Very clean
text: Rough seas, some areas with lifeguards, very clean sand... Several restaurants on Rua da Orla. The water is very cold, which is characteristic of the region

title: Family gathering
text: It is a beautiful beach, however it is well sloped and "sinks" very quickly. Very strong sea, which requires a lot of care from bathers

title: Okay
text: Beautiful beach, with good views, strong waves, it is recommended to enter if you know how to swim well. There is a lack of tent infrastructure, there are no showers!

title: A bit strong beach, but with good and pleasant structure
text: The beach is beautiful, but you can't fool around, because it's strong, it has a lot of waves. There is a point where there are stones that is the best point, because the stones break the waves a little. At this point there is also a good structure for bathers, chairs and tables to sit and a menu to choose what you want on the sand. They don't charge for the table or the chair, but you have to consume something. Overall, I like this beach as it looks clean and has a good structure, although it has a lot of waves.

title: Beautiful beach, but very dangerous
text: I like it a lot, however, just to fish from the sand. It is a very dangerous beach to bathe. She is hardly at ease. It takes a lot of caution to get in.

title: Very clean and beautiful view
text: The best beach in Saquarema. I spent the turn of 2017 to 2018, the sea was calm and I was able to enjoy it a lot. The water is super cold, but too clean. Be careful with jellyfish. There are street vendors during this period, selling popsicles, cheese, shrimp, pies, bags... and there are stalls that serve by selling food and drinks, portions of fish and rental of tables and chairs, which usually leave for free with a minimum of R$ 30.00 of consumption. They usually only accept cash as a form of payment.

title: One of the best beaches in the Lakes Region of the State of Rio de Janeiro... one of its characteristics is white sand
text: Very good.. one of the best beaches in the Lakes region........ Its main feature is white sand of the open sea

title: Our surfing paradise.
text: clear and icy waters. High waves, good for extreme sports. Beautiful view of the Mother Church of Our Lady of Nazareth.

title: Surf land
text: Great beach I recommend the visit beautiful clean view...  Diving and recreation Clear but not too hot waters depends on the season

title: Excellent
text: Great location, excellent service, excellent food, nice atmosphere, great options, top craft beer

title: Beautiful beach.
text: Very good beach, on the day we were there there were few bathers, it was safe and my son can play a lot!

title: Best beach in Rio de Janeiro
text: A beautiful beach, it just hits a lot but otherwise it is super quiet in terms of space for the children to play, I liked everything and especially the cleanliness and not being crowded

title: Beautiful
text: Beach with transparent waters, beautiful place! Great place to enjoy with family, quiet place.

title: Beautiful!
text: One of the most beautiful beaches in the Lakes Region. Whenever we are in Saquarema it is a mandatory stop!

title: Wonderful beach!
text: Well located beach with restaurant infrastructure on the shore. Extensive strip of sand where you can go with the family to spend the day or watch the sunset. Waves are often good for surfers.

title: The best
text: Undoubtedly, one of the most beautiful beaches in the region, clean, well frequented, has the most beautiful sunset we can see, and some restaurants that serve great quality.

title: A beautiful and popular beach
text: Beautiful beach and as soon as we arrived we came across a large restaurant that is in front of this beach! I just went in passing, I didn't stay! But it's worth the visit!

title: Fantastic
text: Itaúna is a beautiful beach and famous for surfing competitions. There are no kiosks but the street vendors do the job by selling drinks, ice cream, cheese...

title: Sea too cold
text: The beach itself is very beautiful, but you immediately realize that there is no one in the sea because the water is very cold! Her legs even hurt from cramps.

title: Wild beach without structure
text: The most famous beach in the city, with a large strip of sand but without any structure of ⛱tents or chairs with umbrellas. I really like this convenience, but I didn't find it there. The hostel rented us an umbrella to take away for 5 reais and we had to lie down on the towels. Somewhat uncomfortable. There are no toilets or anything near for you to drink water or eat something.  The sea was too cold and rough, with very big waves! I went into the water until my knees got wet and soon I was "sucked" in. A danger! ⛔️ I don't recommend it for children! October/2017.

title: Good beach
text: Clean, quiet, beautiful beach, but with strong sea, mts waves. Difficult for common bathing in certain regions, but said to be ideal for surfing.

title: Beauty
text: Wonderful beach with restaurants around. Enough beauty to delight TDS tastes. Suitable for surfing and other extreme sports. It makes you enjoy the beach in TDS the senses.

title: Leisure
text: Whenever we can, we can spend a weekend in saquarema. We like everything here. Good beach and very family-friendly.

title: Great for surfing.
text: I went there many times to catch waves. The World Professional Surfing Championships also take place there. This year the beach was crowded. It has great waves for those who like to surf.

title: Paradise
text: Of natural beauty, this beach for me is one of the most beautiful in the region. It is usually always clean, there are good restaurants and bars in its surroundings. Recommend!

title: Excellent for Surf
text: Beautiful beach, ideal to be in the company of friends and family, fine sand, has many options to eat, and there are always surfing championships there.

title: Beautiful sea for surfing!!!
text: Beautiful beach, quiet place for family, fun to walk with friends. Excellent dining options. Those who come like it and want to come back.

title: Wonderful
text: In addition to being beautiful, it is the stage for several surfing championships, shaking up the city and attracting many tourists.

title: Great Beach
text: Good beach with great beach structure with tents and attendants on the sand. Prices are good also during the seasons. beach to enjoy with family and friends.

title: Fantastic beach
text: Ideal for those who like a beach for the family, very beautiful. Great gastronomic options in the region, relaxed atmosphere, it is possible to practice extreme sports, especially surfing.

title: Beautiful place
text: Beautiful place!  Known as the Maracanã of surfing because it is the place where several championships take place, including the World Surfing Championship

title: Beautiful
text: A beautiful beach< but it escapes the ones we wanted, which is a beach like the one in front of the Hostel, which offers all the comfort!

title: Very beautiful beach, can be used by the whole family, clean place with resting area
text: Suitable place to spend a quiet weekend, with restaurants close to the beach, and especially Marquinho's restaurant, excellent fish

title: Beautiful
text: Very beautiful beach with a large portion of white area with an open and rough sea, having a place to practice sports with volleyball and other

title: Wonderful beach!
text: Very quiet and peaceful. Ideal for spending the day with family and friends! Everything is clean and sand is very clean!!

title: Vacation
text: Top place. High waves. Several inns, diverse cuisine. Stunning nature. Various ballads.

title: SCENIC
text: I find this beach to be quite unusual, in the way that you get to it .. scenic. Be sure to view it from the lookout

title: Best Surf
text: Best waves ever but you need to know what you are doing and surf within your ability, have fun, respect the locals

title: Surfer’s paradise
text: Awesome atmosphere at this beach which draws in the surfers by the dozens! I enjoyed watching them ride the waves. Lots of serious photography going on here.

title: Snapper Rocks
text: Visited on Wednesday 16th June. We had always just look at Snapper Rocks from the lookout above so this time we went down for a closer look. Very busy with surfers enjoying the waves.

title: So picturesque
text:
We love this beach - you could sit and watch surfers all day , the water is stunning and the views are amazing !
One of our favourite spots on the Gold Coast for sure

title: Always loved Snapper Rocks
text: Long weekend and hard to get a table for lunch. Service good even with Covid 19 restrictions. Parking impossible...not a lot of waves for the surfies...

title: Expansive view
text: Enjoyed the hilly walk - over the headland and you can go right down to the next beach. Scenic place to be

title: Lovely place to walk and view the surfers
text: Such a scenic place, with well maintained Paths near the water and up to Point Danger. Good place to watch the surf or the surfers!

title: Stunning views
text: Best place to visit, stunning view. Very relaxing a must see place to visit, highly recommend this place.

title: Best beach for kids!
text: Snapper provides are nice little protected beach with smaller waves perfect for the kiddies on their day out. With crystal clear water and an amazing outlook, you'll be glad you went! Make sure you take a beach umbrella as there's not much shade. Parking can be difficult also so be patient or look for somewhere on the street.

title: Great spot for photography
text: Spent a couple of hours here photographing the local scenes and surf. Great spot especially at sunset.

title: Iconic spot
text: For surfers, I gather it is still top notch. For a person walking on the beach less so. In fact, calling it Snapper Rocks is a bit of a misnomer these days, it has had so much sand dumped on it that it is more like 'Snapper sand bank' which is a bit sad.

title: Paradise
text: Anywhere along this stretch of beach is paradise and will not disappoint.  Beautiful clean ocean, cafe's and the scenery is certainly worth the trip.

title: Perfect
text: One of the best surf spots in the world (first stop on the World Surfing League Tour) with safe options on for the kids. Right-hander sand bottom which barrels when overhead.  On a good day you can ride 2km down to Kirra on 3-4 waves. Natural beauty meets city life.

title: Wonderful Beach
text: This is the place where a lot of the best surfers surf.  Stunning View and great to watch the surfers. Crystal clear water and lovely clean sand to walk on. We walk this beach quite often as we live close by. There is parking but you have to be quick and it gets taken early.

title: Great beach
text: Great relaxing beach, away from the busy surfers paradise life. You'll find families and young people enjoying the nature and the waves. I would recommend.

title: Gorgeous spot
text: This is a beautiful unspoilt part of the Gold Coast away from the hustle and bustle of Surfers and Broadbeach.  Great walks around the headland and secluded swimming spots.

title: Great Surf Spot
text: Snapper Rocks is a great iconic Surf Spot.  Great place to visit for a surf, sunbake or swim.  great views.

title: Beauty
text: Great spot where you can walk along the esplanade or over the hill, or on the sand at low tide. Very scenic

title: Gorgeous Views
text: Lovely scenery and views - a wonderful place to either explore, sit and contemplate or take beautiful photos - it has it all

title: Beautiful Beach & walking track
text:
This is a beautiful beach with fantastic walking/bike riding tracks & elevated lookouts to view the surf & Surfers Paradise in the back ground.
Brilliant views & boardwalks also.

title: Our most favourite beach on the GC
text:
We love this place! Truly. Great views from morning to night. Grass, sand, shade, toilets... parking is mostly available ... a kids play park, showers. 

Rocks to climb on with the kids. Yep love it!

title: Worlds Class Location
text:
Sensational beach with areas for kids to swim together with world class surf. 
Grab a ice cold beer from the friendly staff Rainbow Nay Surf Life Saving Club. 
Top sunset spot.

title: Non-event!
text: If you wish to see Snapper Rocks at their best, I think you have to come on a stormy day, and probably not at low tide!  As seen today, they formed part of a pretty coastal scene, but nothing to write home about.  Seen from above near Danger Point, they appear to form a horseshoe with flat sand within.  There was plenty of car parking nearby, and an easily accessible sealed path around the coast.

title: Watching the surf is great
text: A famous surf spot around the world is Snapper Rocks. Loved watching the action from the shore. Head to the rainbow bay surf club for a meal with a view or park on Snapper Rocks Rd and walk around the pretty area.

title: Great Surf
text: Great surf and beautiful views white sands and a rock pool just be careful when the tides high it can get a bit rough in the pool

title: What a great location
text:
Travelling down Qld’s beautiful Gold Coast most of the beaches look the same and then suddenly you are at Snapper Rocks
Wow the surf just pumps in and you note very quickly that there are some serious board riders there
Worth a visit

title: Easy walk from Mantra Twin Towns
text: It is a nice easy walk from where we were staying at the Mantra Twin Towns.  If your a love surfing then this is the place to be.

title: Very famous surfing area if the waves are good but very pretty too
text: All the beaches along here are truly wonderful to view, walk along, sun yourself, relax, surf, swim, stay in a resort, eat, shop! There are walking trails, facilities, and they get very crowded as it is a huge tourist area, and many Australians also vacation here. Go early, hopefully find parking, use sunscreen and have fun.

title: Wonderful part of the coast, lots to see.
text: I always park at Point Danger near Captain Cook Lighthouse and never have to walk to far. The view here is amazing to the south - Tweed River mouth, Flagstaff Beach and beyond. I have seen whales from here at the right time of the year. Then walk past all the info on Centuar Remembrance Walk  with views to the north and Snapper Rocks, steps go down to Froggy Beach, with the green frog on the rock, watch the people in the man-made pool as the surf covers it then recedes (depending on the tide and swell- awesome), watch the surfers at Snapper Rocks, then to avoid the steps walk back on the footpath by the road. What a great way to spend a few hours.

title: Easy to reach and good walk from captain cook
text:
We parked at captain cook and walked to point danger and down to the beach, then snapper rocks. There were a lot of places to go down to the beach and rocks. More tourists at captain cook but hardly at snapper rocks since most of them just took photos at captain cook and get on their tour bus. 

Easy to walk with children and nice walk.

title: Piece of history
text:
We weren’t able to access the rocks due to works being undertaken to improve the area which was unfortunate as it was on our list of places to visit, ah well we will have to come back!
Great scenic views from above made our trip worthwhile.

title: Natural formation with a unique rock pool along with scenic views overlooking the beach
text:
It is a small area along the coast with some parking lots, wind can get really strong. There is some small cafe along the same area too.

Its a nice place for some photo moments, but will not need more than an hour to visit.

title: World Famous, share & enjoy
text:
A magic area most surfers globally love to visit at least once in their lifetime to admire & also get a few waves, be it 2 foot to 6 foot high plus (0.5mtr - 2mtrs plus).
For those who don't surf it's still an amazing place to visit, relax & enjoy. Rainbow Bay Surf Life Saving Club have lifeguards on Patrol for swimmers. There are picnic tables, free Bbqs & a kids play park for all to enjoy. In the surf it does get very crowded, just relax, share & enjoy the waves, even just one good long wave here is a memory to treasure. Rainbow Bay sits in the midst of World Heritage Surf Zone, in some bigger surf people have been know to get a wave from Snapper Rocks through to Kirra when it's all lined up! Enjoy your time

title: Beautiful little area, awesome scenery
text: Beautiful little area, awesome scenery, looked like some nice waves but I’m not a surfer .  Well worth a look.

title: The real "Surfer's Paradise"
text: Great Beach, great break, great little community. Snapper Rocks gives you a safe family beach just around the corner at Rainbow Bay or one of the best surf breaks in the world.

title: Snapper Rocks "rocks"
text: Sanpper Roks Beach is beautiful hands down, but so are hundreds of other beaches in Australia. There wasn't one beach that wasn't;t beautiful, so take your pick! Snapper Rocks is good but def a ton of surfers out there. I know there are many other good beaches to surf...:)

title: Snapper Rocks the best view ever !!!
text:
Amazing place ! such nice beach and view !
You can´t miss click many photos here in the morning or in the sunset...
Unforgetable !

title: Karin S
text: On Monday and Tuesday night they have “Roast Night” for $11 a choice of pork lamb or beef. It is excellent value and delicious apart from those meals it’s pretty poor.

title: Great Surf Beach
text: Visited on Monday 4th February. This has to be the best surf beach on the coast, not to be missed and the view is great as well.

title: Snapper Rainbow - Best Beach in Queensland
text:
Best place on the Gold Coast to have a swim or just to sit and watch the surf. Try the balcony at the Rainbow Bay Surf Club and have a great meal and cold beer.
The volunteer lifesavers at Rainbow Bay are the best. One of the few North facing beaches on the coast so it’s perfect with the wind from the SW to SSE

title: Coolangatta gold
text:
Well worth a visit to check out very good waves and try the Surf club for a good meal and cold one. 
Well worh the visit

title: Great place to watch the surf board riders
text: Great action photo opportunity here. Nice walk around headland too. Beach is great here for a swim too.

title: Superb vista - any time of day!
text: A place where you know you are alive! The feeling of oneness with the mighty ocean is literally awesome.

title: Great beach, great amenities, close parking!
text: Snapper Rocks beach is a great place for a family day on the beach, with dining facilities and bathroom amenities close by. Parking is also very good, but the only downside is when leaving after a large event, traffic bottles necks and it is difficult to get out in a timely manner.

title: Nice Sunset Walk ~
text: I love here more than other areas. It was so beautiful and chilling. The sunset was awesome. It has interesting rock formation with some rocks pools among them which you can sit in. But the waves here seems rough tho. I had a great walk from the coolangatta beach to rainbow bay to snapper rocks and point danger.

title: Checking it out
text: Interesting natural rock formation with some rocks pools amongst them. Quite rough surf at times. You can walk out on the rocks but keep an eye on the surf. Gets busy and parking can be a problem.

title: Great time at Snapper
text: Had a great time at snapper. Great beach, excellent surf and close to the drinks at the surf club. Must have the best view of any surf club in Australia.

title: Serious Surfers Only
text: Great surf spot and if it’s pumping and like most of us you’re not a pro, there’s Little Mali Rainbow Bay Greenmount and even Kirra just a paddle away.

title: Great little spot
text: Almost a hidden gem but worth the trip. Beautiful spot for a splash or people watch. Parking can be a problem sometimes so come early or later in the day, or just walk from where ever you are.

title: Great spot
text: Plenty of parking around the corner from the surf club  ( Rainbow Bay surf club  ) - shame that the price of spirits was over $15 for 2 basic spirits in small glasses with postmix.. other surf clubs charge far less with 10x better facilities and views.. In 20 years of visiting the Rainbow Bay surf club over looking snapper rocks.. it's hardly changed...

title: Great Beach
text: Great holiday location - in close proximity to the wonderful Rainbow Bay Beach and the Snapper Rocks surf breaks.

title: Amazing view!
text: This place is so beautiful! You can shoot amazing photos and enjoy natural pools! After, grab some drinks at the surfer's club. They have cool music too.

title: Surfer Paradise
text: This is the true surfer paradise in Gold Coast, is the home for annual WSL usually in March - April. It also has a cool rock pool and the view from the top of the hill is just breathtaking!

title: Walking
text: we walked round to the snapper rock it was an easy walk and very nice along the sea front. I could walk that many more times.

title: Listen to the roar
text:
A truly picturesque location with a booming sound coming from the wave action battering the rocks. 
Another Gold Coast Gem

title: Pumping surf
text: I knew about legendary Snapper Rocks and decided to have a look on a rainy chilly Sunday. Surf was pumping and the surfers of all ages were lined up to get out there. So many vantage points to just simply watch these skillfull athletes.

title: World class surf break
text: Snapper Rocks and Rainbow Bay is a world class surf break located just below Point Danger . Know for is glassy clear waters and broad sandy beaches, Snapper offers a fiesty right hand break, often with dream barrels or cruisey lines for the long boarder. It can get very busy in the surf so step up with confidence!

title: God is good
text: Lovely strip of coastline. Plenty of shops nearby but this particular place is serene and unspoilt. We'll be back.

title: Stopping point on casual beachfront cycle
text: Traditional beach, wide and sandy, with great views right up to northern end of Gold Coast. Very crowded for board riders, but plenty of room for body surfing.

title: Snapper Surf club
text: This is one of the best spots on the coast to watch everyone surfing while you have a beverage or have lunch. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.

title: Great spot hotly contested
text:
Great spot... views and atmosphere are A class. Good luck with the parking situation though. Its hotly contested and you're genuinely better off parking away from here and taking a walk along the well equipped paths / boardwalks etc to Snapper Rocks. 
Take water as we stayed longer than we'd anticipated because it was so cool. Good vibe soak it up. Water in September is coolish but well worth a dip after a power walk!

title: Nice Walk
text: Bit of a surf beach. Nice place to walk around though, especially in the morning. Probably not the best swimming beach though.

title: spotted this beauty from my room at greenmount hotel
text: straight across from hotel, to pat fagan park, great view, and stairs down to the beach, there were a wedding party having pictures taken there while we were visiting, stunning

title: Rocky foreshore
text: Interesting walk around Rainbow Bay and Snapper Rocks , saw us viewing great rock formations right on the beach. One could imagine thousands of years of shifting boulders , tides and winds to form these fascinating rocks.

title: CHECKING OUT THE SURFERS
text: Snapper is great if you want to check out the surfing prowess of the locals or the pro's.  Great area to just sit and chill out.

title: Great atmosphere
text: Rainbow Bay beach very safe and family friendly. Kids will love playing in the sand. The beach faces north therefore protection from the elements. The view from surf club is breath taking

title: A magic spot
text: Snapper Rocks is an Icon on the southern end of the coast. We always make a point of driving home via the culdesac nice and slow, wind down the car window and breathe in the salt air. Stop and look across to the sand castles of Surfers Paradise and the majestic coastline leading to it and just take in what a beautiful place it is.  The walkway around to Froggies is incredible at any time of the night and day. Hmmnnnn.... makes me want to go again

title: Where else in the world would you rather be?
text:
Snapper Rocks, Coolangatta,Rainbow Bay all together to make one of the best seaside locations anywhere.
Clear clean surf, beautiful sand and great surf club

title: Peaceful
text: I loved this beach. You can easily find secluded spots and chill there away from crowds. Also, if you climb to the top, you get a magnificent view of Surfer's Paradise.

title: Beautiful
text: Excellent photo op for any photog, great place for a walk for just about anyone.  Must see when visiting Coolangatta.

title: Stunning Beach
text: I escaped Surfer's Paradise for the day and camped out here. Even in winter the beach and the rocks are beautiful, it was even warm enough to get my toes wet! There were plenty of people swimming in and out of the patrolled zones so the water must have been nice.

title: Nice one
text: It is nice to stay there but gold Coast have better places But for BBQ will be good with a nice view

title: What a great spot
text: Great spot for kids of all ages, surf beach for the big kids and lagoons for small kids, soft white sand for bathing under the sun. If you are in the area its a must visit.

title: Great place for a photo shoot, and to watch the moon rise.
text: We were there for a photo shoot, and enjoyed the views back towards Surfers Paradise. As well as the moon rise and sunset.

title: THE REAL SURFERS PARADISE!
text:
Go early to see sun up. It is beautiful! 

Bring surf and body boards, long shallow banks assist surfers of every age!

Gorgeous soft sand.

Amenities are nearby but don’t block the view of nature.

People are mostly older and white but friendly considering that it’s Australia.

Worth our trip bc of Snapper Rocks. PERIOD.

title: Great Place
text: Great vibe, love the atmosphere of this place. I can sit for hours watching the views and the surfers coming in.

title: GET YOUR ROCKS EXCITEMENT.
text: Just an easy stroll along Coolangatta Beach to the Rocks.  Park (well that is your 'butt')  on a rock or on the sand nearby and  watch or participate in the action happening around you.  People watching comes free of charge and can be so rewarding.

title: Great surf spot
text: I can now understand why this is a surfing haven and mega for surfers from all over the world. We walked up to see what was all the noise. Well worth the visit. A great break running all the time and lots of guys trying to catch the perfect wave.

title: Great views
text: Went for a walk whilst holidaying in Coolangatta up to Rainbow Bay and surrounding areas.Terrific views and loved watching the surfers at Snapper Rocks,great stretch of beach

title: What a View !
text: Snapper Rocks is a great spot to whale/dolphin watch from the shore and to of course watch the local surfers...the atmosphere is relaxed and friendly and is easy to make new friends... with Rainbow Bay Surf Club onsite it is just great!  Enjoy!

title: Big waves and stunning views
text: Love this place - wish I brought my swimmers. Great place for a surf or just to chill.... definitely worth a visit when on the Gold Coast.

title: SURFING - SNORKELLING
text: Snapper Rocks is know for its beautiful beaches and golden sand, if you have come to the Gold coast for our beaches then you must visit this beach you will fall in love with the place i know i did, i am lucky to live only 20mins drive from here and my son and i always come down this end of the coast for a swim and surf. Snapper rocks is protected by the headland so the waves are always fun its perfect to learn to surf have a swim or go snorkelling you could even fish off the beach ..

title: Outstanding
text: Outstanding place to enjoy the beauty of creation and to cheer the swimmers on in the Cooly swim. Lovely clear water

title: Great views
text: Snapper Rocks is a great place to sit and watch the world go by and if you are lucky enough to be there at the right time, you might even see a whale playing in the distance.

title: Amazing & Breathaking scenery
text: Saved this for the tail end of the day whilst on the Gold Coast, and was not disappointed. Was able to watch the sun set over the water with picture perfect photo opportunities. Nice for kids to be able to play here, and to cast your eye over the sheer number of surfers doing their thing. Take a walk around the paths to Froggy Beach & Point Danger for more breathtaking views

title: Surf/people watching
text: great spot for an early morning walk from Coolangatta, watching the many surfers enjoying great waves on a beautiful clean beach

title: Daily Walks
text: Beautiful paths to take your daily works along the coastline. The world surf comp was on when I visited so it was extremely busy. Lovely sandy beach to swim & enjoy the views.

title: Finding the best place for Snapper Rocks
text:
The first place where I saw the Snapper Rocks was right under me. I had a great view of them, just above them. 

Eventually, I went back down to the Snapper Rocks. It was even more attractive. The waves were covering large stones. However, there is a pool where we can swim without any difficulties. No waves! It was charming!

It is a must see!

title: Amazing surf
text: You are so close to the action I can see why this is one of the best surf beaches in Aus for spectators.  There had to be over 150 surfers out in the water the 2 days we were there with waves up to 4 mts.

title: Surfers Heaven
text:
I live locally and often visit Snapper Rocks and Rainbow Bay to take photos 

I was there in February to see Mick Fanning surf his last competition in his home town. 

There were lots of people, fans, media and surfers either in the stands or like me just standing in the rocks or sitting on the sand. 

The rest of the year Snapper and Rainbow Bay are awesome for a surf, swim, relax on the beach or just a walk around the area to take in the natural beauty.

title: Just magic
text: I have been coming to snapper ricks for 51 years and it is a beautiful spot to chill and relax. Watching the surfers and the waves crashing on the rocks is so relaxing.
